business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Izumi Japanese Kitchen in Gulshan, Dhaka is one of the finest places to experience authentic Japanese cuisine in Bangladesh. From the moment you step in, the ambience transports you straight to Japan with a beautifully designed Sakura tree, lotus ponds, fish-filled water features, and a gentle waterfall that create a peaceful and elegant atmosphere. Itâ€™s the perfect spot for a relaxing meal, a date night, or even a quiet lunch after a busy day. The seafood here is the true highlight fresh, flavorful, and prepared to perfection. You must try their salmon dishes, shrimp tempura, and the sushi and sashimi platters, which showcase the best of Japanese craftsmanship and taste. Other must-try dishes include the dragon roll, fish platter, udon and soba noodles, maki, kabayaki, sukiyaki, and nabemono, each offering a unique flavor and presentation that reflect the authentic taste of Japan. The service is excellent, with courteous staff who are attentive without being intrusive. Prices are reasonable considering the quality and experience. The restaurant accepts cash and card payments, and VAT bills are provided. Overall, Izumi Japanese Kitchen offers an unforgettable dining experience a beautiful fusion of authentic Japanese flavors, serene ambience, and top-notch service right in the heart of Gulshan.

business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Izumi Japanese Kitchen is a great place for real Japanese food. The menu has lots of Sushi and Maki options, and they serve seafood in many different cooking styles like grilled, fried, or with rice. From the food we tried: ğŸœ Yaki Udon (Stir-Fried Udon Noodles) â€“ Thick noodles stir-fried with beef, cabbage, and mushrooms. It was flavorful and filling, with a nice smoky taste. ğŸ¥© Steak with Sauce â€“ A Japanese-style beef steak covered in a rich tomato-mushroom sauce, served with croquettes and vegetables. The steak was soft and juicy, and the sauce added great flavor. ğŸ¤ Tempura â€“ Light and crispy deep-fried vegetables and prawns. It was not oily, and the coating was perfect. A must-try for tempura lovers. ğŸš Crispy Soft Shell Crab Fried Rice â€“ This dish looked amazing and tasted even better. The crab was crunchy, and the rice had a nice mix of herbs and flavor. ğŸ£ Shrimp Tempura Maki Roll â€“ Wrapped in seaweed, the sushi was fresh, well-balanced, and had the perfect amount of crunch from the tempura inside. Overall, the food was fresh, nicely presented, and full of flavor. The place is clean and cozy, with a calm Japanese vibe. A bit on the higher price side, but totally worth it for quality Japanese food. âœ… Highly recommended if you love authentic Japanese cuisine.

business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the authentic Japanese restaurant in Dhaka. It was really a delightful experience with a very welcoming and pleasant environment and soothing ambience. All the dishes I tried, cooked to perfection and absolutely delicious, full of flavor and seemed like fresh and high-quality ingredients were used. The service was top-notch as well. Highly recommended for Japanese food lovers.

business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Izumi is one of the best authentic Japanese restaurants in Dhaka. Hidden in Gulshan, it offers a serene ambience, exceptional service, and delicious dishes made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The sushi, sashimi, and tempura are standout items. Though pricey, it's worth it for Japanese food lovers. Highly recommended!

business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: What a chic restaurant. Hidden in Gulshan, this restaurant I chose based on reviews and found because of some helpful locals. Nigiri and sashimi platter was delicious and I highly recommend it - expensive but cured my sushi fix. Service was friendly, attentive, excellent from beginning to end, the atmosphere and ambiance was desirable, and the food was so enjoyable. Walked in without reservation on a Friday night around 1930, no wait - although reservations Iâ€™d recommend.

business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Really a wonderful experience. A top Japanese restaurant in Dhaka, in fact the best. We had the tempura which was served perfectly, amazing assortment of sushiâ€™s and the mains were great as well. The decor is minimalistic and sets the perfect ambience in which to indulge. Donâ€™t miss the huge tree in the backyard which was brought all the way from Japan! Overall an exceptional experience and definitely worth visiting.Izumi is my favorite Japanese restaurant. The sushi is amazing, the tempura were sooooo good. the last time I went to Izumi was I think a few months ago. I went with my aunt and uncle and my cousins. The food was extraordinary. It was rich with flavors. It was just balanced. My best friend, Adam's birthday was there. But unfortunately I could not go. My father always goes there for lunch if he can. And I wish I could go again soon.

business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: 10/10 experience. The food is tad expensive no doubt. We were 8 person, spent 25k BDT rather quickly ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­. Everything else was amazing. The place is low key. Was hard to spot without any visual branding in front of the building. The inside was spacious, well decorated with soft light. There was an artificial waterfall thing in wall and big yard in front of it which was pretty cool. Now the food. It was awesome. Their beef udon and sushi/sashimi were exquisite. I didnâ€™t like the ramen that much but everything else was perfect. Their lemonade (plain, not the mint one) was the best Iâ€™ve ever had. Such delicate balance of sweetness, tanginess and coldness. *chef kiss* Will visit again but not too soon considering how much it costs. Per person cost can blow up to 3000++ pretty quickly. A more budget friendly but delicious Japanese food place is Izakaya in Dhanmondi. Well, not as Grand as Izumi but definitely better value.

business_address: House 24 C, Rd 119, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Itâ€™s been years that I have had this desire of visiting this place for, but it was only July the 4th this year that I finally was there on. Better late than never! The place is simply amazing. Itâ€™s spacious, so mindfully decorated, great ambience, minimal interior design, and it has all the elements to make you feel welcome and comfortable. I loved it a lot. Yes, itâ€™s expensive, kind of, but for this quality I was more than happy (mmm, or maybe not this much, haha) with the price we were paying for the food. Mineral water is served free here which is admirable. You will have a wide variety of different options to choose from. Itâ€™s a two-storied building. We had a table at the ground floor. We ordered bento box. Everything tasted excellent. My best experience with Japanese food in Dhaka has been with â€œSamdadoâ€ until then. But I would say â€œIzumiâ€ is a class of its own. I always joked that itâ€™s a place where you donâ€™t go to eat with your own money, rather you go with someone who pays for you. But after this first visit, I think Iâ€™m more than willing to pay for myself the next time Iâ€™m there. And there will be a lot of â€œnext timeâ€ like that here, I believe.

business_name: The Garden Kitchen at Sheraton Dhaka
business_address: 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The Garden Kitchen Buffet at Sheraton Dhaka offers a delightful dining experience with an impressive spread of dishes that cater to a wide range of tastes. From succulent grilled meats to fresh seafood, flavorful curries, and an array of international cuisines, every item on the buffet is crafted with care and bursting with flavor. The dessert section is a standout, with an assortment of decadent cakes, pastries, and local sweets that are hard to resist. The quality of the food is consistently high, and the presentation is impeccable, making it a feast for both the palate and the eyes. However, the experience comes with a couple of caveats. The buffet tends to get extremely busy on Fridays, which can lead to longer wait times for seating and a slightly chaotic atmosphere. Itâ€™s advisable to book in advance or arrive early to avoid the rush. Additionally, the price is on the steeper side, with the cost hovering around BDT 7,000â€“8,000 per person. That said, the experience becomes significantly more affordable if you take advantage of bank promotions, such as buy-one-get-one or buy-one-get-two deals, which are often available. Overall, Garden Kitchen delivers a premium buffet experience with exceptional food quality, but the Friday crowds and high price point are worth considering. If youâ€™re looking for a luxurious dining outing and can snag a bank deal, itâ€™s well worth a visit!

business_name: The Garden Kitchen at Sheraton Dhaka
business_address: 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Last night, we treated ourselves to the dinner buffet at The Garden Kitchen in Sheraton, and it was an absolute feast for the senses! From the moment we walked in, the warm ambiance and inviting spread set the tone for a fantastic dining experience. The Turkish kebab was a standoutâ€”juicy, perfectly spiced, and so flavorful that I couldnâ€™t resist going back for seconds. The Nehari was rich and aromatic, with tender meat that melted in the mouth, while the dumplings were delightfully soft and packed with delicious fillings. And oh, the steakâ€”cooked just right, succulent, and full of smoky goodness. The dessert section was a sweet loverâ€™s paradise! From delicate pastries to creamy treats, every bite was heavenly. Itâ€™s rare to find a buffet where every dish shines, but The Garden Kitchen nailed it. What made the evening even better was the kids' zone, which kept our little ones happily entertained while we enjoyed our meal. The only downside? Cold drinks werenâ€™t included in the buffet, which would have been a nice touch. Overall, it was a wonderful experienceâ€”great food, a welcoming atmosphere, and plenty of variety. If youâ€™re looking for a satisfying buffet with something for everyone, The Garden Kitchen is definitely worth a visit!

business_name: The Garden Kitchen at Sheraton Dhaka
business_address: 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Went there for both brunch and dinner. In spite of reservations it took time to get seats. They offer bogo on weekends so too many people. Initial offered seats were makeshift, congested and almost attached to other tables. So we denied. They arranged another table after 10/15 minutes. Dinner buffet was good. Many cuisines were available. Liked the grill and Asia section. Fish items were very good. Many desserts were available.l but mostly tasted similar. Liked macha cheesecake and kulfi. For brunch, items were plenty and tasty. Varieties of juices are also available for brunch which are included in buffet prices.

business_name: The Garden Kitchen at Sheraton Dhaka
business_address: 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: **Buffet Review: Sheraton â€“ The Garden Kitchen** Sheratonâ€™s buffet, served at **The Garden Kitchen**, is undoubtedly one of the finest buffet experiences in Dhaka. Known for its extensive and well-curated selection of dishes, this buffet offers a diverse range of cuisines, including international and local favorites, catering to a wide variety of tastes. The spread includes everything from fresh salads, soups, and appetizers to a grand selection of main courses, including premium cuts of meat, seafood, and vegetarian options. The live cooking stations are a highlight, where chefs prepare dishes like pasta, grills, and stir-fries to your exact preference, adding a personal touch to the dining experience. One of the best things about Sheratonâ€™s buffet is its **"buy one, get two"** offers that are frequently available through various bank cards, making it an exceptional value for money, especially given the premium quality of food. These discounts make it a popular choice for group dinners, family outings, and celebrations. However, itâ€™s important to note that **drinks are not included** in the buffet price, which is a standard practice but something to be mindful of when budgeting for the meal. The dessert section is equally impressive, with a vast selection of sweets, cakes, pastries, and traditional Bengali desserts, making it a haven for those with a sweet tooth. The ambiance at **The Garden Kitchen** is modern, spacious, and elegant, with a warm, welcoming atmosphere that elevates the dining experience. The attentive staff ensure that guests are well taken care of, promptly refilling dishes and catering to any special requests. Overall, Sheratonâ€™s buffet at The Garden Kitchen stands out as one of Dhaka's best dining experiences, offering a luxurious spread, top-notch service, and great value, especially with their frequent discount offers.

business_address: 21 Road No. 17, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The best Indian food i ever tried in Bangladesh. Staff are really well behaved. We choose the restaurant based on a reviews and pictures,thinking this much wont be wrong .the food didnâ€™t disappoint,it was excellent.very fresh .very tasty.and it was well presented. Well balanced of spices. Parking was easy and the place felt special.

business_address: 21 Road No. 17, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Amrit Restaurant serves delicious food with authentic flavors in a clean and cozy environment. The staff is friendly, and the service is quick. A great spot for enjoying Indian and Asian cuisine with family or friends

business_address: 21 Road No. 17, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Was restaurant hopping at Banani looking for some out of ordinary taste (had enough of burgers, steaks and shakes), when thought about trying out this restaurant and look if they are still offering thali. We didn't get thali, (the signature Bahubali Thali needs at least 5 hours preorder) but what we got was way more enjoying and memorable than thali. The picturesque interior, warm welcome and attention of Ms. Sweety (host) and great kebabs were enough to make the evening superb! On top of that there was live music of popular hindi and bangla ballads! Ms. Sweety (host) understands her guests' need well and helped us to make our selection - Kabab Platter. Being the only guests at the restaurant meant exclusive privacy and close up of the singing duo. Food preparation time is a bit lengthy but that's okay as I hadn't prebook. The restaurant did their best to sweeten the waiting time with complimentary jeera pani and papar. The Kabab Platter is a mix of veg and non-veg kababs. All juicy, tender and freshly prepared. Has mutton, chicken and beef too! Tried pineapple kabab for the first time and it was yum! The quantity was too much for the two of us - could have easily sufficed for 4 adults. But no food waste resulted as the host handed us a takeaway pack with remaining kebabs . All in all it was wonderful experience, nice food, attentive host, nice ambience (more than few spot for selfies and profile photos) and tasteful live music! A definite repeat visit.

business_address: 21 Road No. 17, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Not how you get reviews for a restaurant, I hope you have nice foods and great atmosphere as shown in the pictures. But seeing scammers getting fake reviews for the restaurant is concerning. Random people should not knock someone to get some fake reviews.

business_address: 21 Road No. 17, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The rules and regulations of this restaurant are very nice. I really liked it. So, I happily gave it 5 stars. I hope this restaurant continues to grow and becomes well-known around the world.

business_address: Level 4, BTI Laureate, House 56, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Woodhouse Grill has been serving consistently good steak for several years now. We have come here for various occasions and tried different steaks. The service has always been good, and the doneness of the steak has been excellent. Their appetizers are really good, especially the Southern Cubes that we always get. This time, I tried the fish but was a little disappointed. It might not be the best idea to order fish at a steak place, though.

business_address: Level 4, BTI Laureate, House 56, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Woodhouse Grill, and it was truly an exceptional dining experience from start to finish. From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the warm and inviting ambiance. The rustic, cowboy-themed decor with long wooden tables, stylish chairs, and subtle Western accents created a cozy yet sophisticated atmosphere. The soft lighting and tasteful decorations made the environment feel relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a casual meal or a special occasion. Now, letâ€™s talk about the foodâ€”absolutely outstanding! I tried both the ribeye and T-bone steaks, and both exceeded my expectations. The ribeye was perfectly marbled, juicy, and cooked to perfection, easily one of the best Iâ€™ve had in Dhaka. The T-bone had a rich, robust flavor and was equally satisfying. Each steak was thoughtfully plated with sides like creamy mashed potatoes, sautÃ©ed vegetables, and grilled tomatoes, which complemented the main dishes beautifully. The homemade sauces, especially the mushroom and cheese options, added a gourmet touch that elevated the experience even further. Don't forgot to try the the hollandaise and cheese sauces. It's a must. If you donâ€™t try the corn salad, you gonna miss the most delicious corn salad in town. The service was excellent. The staff were friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable, guiding me through the menu and ensuring that my dining experience was seamless. They were professional yet warm, making me feel genuinely welcomed. Woodhouse Grill also offers convenient facilities such as free street parking and multiple payment options. Their special offers on Sundays and Tuesdays make the visit even more appealing for steak enthusiasts. Overall, Woodhouse Grill is a must-visit for anyone who loves premium steaks in Dhaka. The combination of exceptional food, inviting ambiance, top-notch service, and thoughtful facilities makes it an unforgettable experience. I highly recommend it!

business_address: Level 4, BTI Laureate, House 56, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The food at this restaurant is truly exceptional, offering a delightful culinary experience that is sure to impress any discerning palate. The dishes are prepared with great care and attention to detail, resulting in flavors that are both rich and harmonious. Whether youâ€™re a fan of savory or sweet, there is something on the menu to satisfy every craving. However, despite the outstanding quality of the food, the atmosphere leaves much to be desired. The music played in the restaurant is excessively loud, creating an environment that is far from ideal for a relaxed dining experience. This is particularly concerning for families with young children, as the noise level can be overwhelming and uncomfortable for them. During my recent visit, I brought my little daughter along, hoping to enjoy a pleasant meal together. Unfortunately, the loud music made it difficult for us to converse and enjoy our time. I politely requested the staff to turn down the volume, but my request was not accommodated. This lack of consideration for patrons with children was quite upsetting and made the experience less enjoyable than it could have been. Itâ€™s important for families planning to dine at this restaurant to be aware of the noise level and consider whether it would be suitable for their children. While the food is undoubtedly a highlight, the atmosphere may not be conducive to a comfortable dining experience for everyone.

business_address: Level 4, BTI Laureate, House 56, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Brisket Bliss at Woodhouse Grill â€“ A Must-Try If youâ€™re in Banani and have any love for slowâ€‘cooked brisket, do yourself a favor Woodhouse Grillâ€™s brisket is a revelation. I found it delightfully tender, with that hallmark smoky depth that only comes from hours of perfect slow roasting. Every bite melted, and the rich flavor lingered memorably. This aligns spot-on with other diners: Ambience & Service: You get the feeling of stepping into a cozy Western steakhouse warm lighting, rustic dÃ©cor and genuine, attentive staff who clearly care. The ambiance elevates the dish, making the brisket experience feel worth every taka spent. 2 free sides: Mashpotato (besssssst), mexican rice is good Was served with BBQ sauce. We also bought cheese sauce. Cause it's too good. I always go for for cheese and mushroom Quick Summary: Brisket: 9/10 â€“ Slowâ€‘cooked perfection, tender and smoky Value: High â€“ Slightly premium pricing, but the quality delivers Service & Setting: Excellent â€“ Friendly staff, Westernâ€‘style vibe Bottom line: I was impressedâ€”and that matches the broader consensus. Woodhouse Grillâ€™s brisket delivers consistently. Worth the splurge for a solid, smoky, meatâ€‘loverâ€™s experience in Dhaka. Highly recommended.

business_address: Level 4, BTI Laureate, House 56, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The atmosphere of this place and the service is second to none in Bangladesh. Amazing service, and the interior made me feel like I was in an old Western movie. I ordered the sirloin steak with mashed potatoes and Mexican rice. The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare, and the sides were great too. However, I felt the steak could have been better seasoned, and the fat cap should have been rendered better. For the price, I expected perfection, and I must say I've had better steak at lower prices in other places in Dhaka. Great place to go to with a group of people, whether family or friends, and if you've got the money to spare; but if you're looking for the best steak in town, I would look elsewhere.

business_address: Level 4, BTI Laureate, House 56, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: It was a great experience in Woodhouse grill, We ordered various meals, the steak was juicy and tasty, ribs very flavourful, the brisket had that smoky aged flavor in it, although it was a bit dry, 10/10 service, 10/10 behaviour, ambiance was good too

business_address: Level 4, BTI Laureate, House 56, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: In banani, if you are looking for steaks then you can count them. Brisket & ribeyes those I have tried and good. Price is similar compared to the other places.

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: A fine dine place if anyone wants to try authentic steak. Took La Boca platter and the meat came with medium rare doneness. A little bit chewy but tasted perfectly. Rice portion could have been better though and crisp croccante onion felt nothing special. The chicken sausage complemented the steak. The bruschetta came in as an apetizer I guess. Overall good experience. The chipotle aioli sauce was fantastic but the house special sauce was really nothing special, just so so.

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Meat Theory really stands out for its delicious dishes and beautifully presented meals. Tried the La Boca Plate, and it was absolutely worth it! The sides complemented it beautifully, and the overall presentation was nice. The atmosphere had a pleasant vibe, and the staff were genuinely welcoming and attentive.

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Went to Meat Theory in Banani to try their new Argentine La Boca Plate, but it wasn't available that day. So, we opted for the Cattle Battle Platter instead. This is an expensive platter loaded with lots of meat. To start, the steaks were really goodâ€”especially the middle one, the skirt steak cut, which was delicious. The beef cheese balls were really good too. To be honest, all the steak cuts in this platter were spot-on: nice doneness (they didn't overcook them), and the flavor was fantastic. But the sausages? Very disappointingâ€”didn't like them at all. For sides, we ordered mashed potatoes, sautÃ©ed mushrooms, and stir-fried vegetables. The mushroom sautÃ© was nice, the mashed potatoes were nice too, but the veggies were just average. As for sauces, we got the chipotle aioli and BBQ sauce. The chipotle was just wowâ€”it paired perfectly with the steak flavors, a definite must-try sauce. Drinks were decent. Service was decentâ€”I'd say good overall. But after eating, they asked us to leave because of waiting guests. I'd recommend going during non-rush hours if you're tackling a big platter; you might want time to relax afterward. Overall, this is a really nice platter (I'd say best for 4 people) with top-notch steak quality. It's a must-try dish, and I'd love to have it again. Last but not the least, I'd really love if Meat Theory offered discounts or happy hour deals on this.

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Went there a few days ago. Ordered baby back ribs with baked beans and sautÃ©ed veggies, cheese buldak fowl with herb rice and mashed potatoes, and the tenderloin steak was complimentary. The baby back ribs are my all-time favorite â€” the meat just melts in your mouth with a rich, robust flavor. The herb rice, mashed potatoes, and sautÃ©ed veggies were also really good. The baked beans were average. The cheese buldak was tasty but super spicy â€” perfect for spice lovers, but I couldnâ€™t finish it. The tenderloin steak was served a bit cold, but it was still delicious. Overall, the portions were good, but a bit on the pricey side. I wouldnâ€™t go for the platter like the cheese buldak again at that price.

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We tried the Cattle Battle Platter at Meat Theory, and it was absolutely worth it! The platter was loaded, well-balanced, and every cut of meat was cooked to perfectionâ€”juicy, tender, and packed with flavor. The portion size was generous, perfect for sharing, and the variety kept every bite exciting. The seasoning really stood out, enhancing the natural taste of the meat rather than overpowering it. If youâ€™re a true meat lover, this platter is a must-try. Great food, satisfying experienceâ€”weâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Hands down one of the best steakhouse in Dhaka. Except from having 10/10 steaks their employees were very well mannered and friendly. The atmosphere is very lively and as it sits on the 14th floor it has an amazing view as well! Iâ€™d recommend it if you are looking for a good steakhouse!

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: This is hands-down one of the best steak houses in town! We went there for a date and found there parillada platter, a scrumptious platter in a reasonable price with hefty amount of sides that comes with it. It was a great deal I must say! Everything was super yummy no doubt. However, I personally felt that they could improve their chillers a bit.

business_address: Tower B11, Level 14 Plot 43, Block F Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Absolutely fantastic steakhouse experience! The food was top-notch, perfectly cooked steaks, rich flavors, and a great variety of sides. The ambiance was cozy yet upscale. A special shoutout to our server, Chester, he was incredibly attentive, friendly, and made excellent recommendations. His service truly elevated our time. Highly recommended!

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Great rooftop spot with amazing grilled food! I had a fantastic time at Grill on the Skyline. The grilled chicken and kebabs were flavorful and perfectly cooked. The rooftop ambiance with city views was beautiful, and the staff were friendly and attentive. A bit pricey, but totally worth it for the experience. Highly recommend

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Grill on the skyline This rooftop restaurant in Dhaka stands out as one of the best, catering to families, friends, and couples alike. With a unique feature of a swimming pool for night-staying hotel guests, complete with changing rooms and a gym, it offers a holistic experience. The ambiance is enhanced by the opportunity for candlelight dinners amid a photogenic, green environment adorned with flowers and diverse seating options. Seafood, grill, and buffet offerings provide a culinary delight. The standout feature is the captivating view of the airport, adding an extra layer of charm to the overall dining experience.

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Grill on the Skyline restaurant. The restaurant's ambiance is very beautiful, especially the rooftop view, which is amazing. I had the grilled chicken burger there, which was truly delicious. The price was also within my budget, costing around 400 to 600 BDT. However, the restaurant was a bit crowded, so the environment was somewhat noisy. All in all, my experience was good, and I'd like to visit again.

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The food is excellent. The candle light dinner package is good. However the 5 course meal is too much to eat in a 3-4 hour window.

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the finest Rooftop restaurant in Dhaka. The atmosphere is nice. Food was amazing. Ordered the BBQ flavored chicken and it was amazing. Staffs are cordial and helpful. Overall the experience was amazing!

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: We have a lot of delicious food here, our company is at the capital level, we will get our food in those districts of Bangladesh. The best company in Bangladesh is Grill on the Skyline.

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: A great place for good & fresh food... Price is high also they serve alcohol so if you have foreigners with you then you can come here...there is a pool also...

business_address: Regency Hotel & Resort, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I visited for candle light dinner. Too nice rooftop garden restaurant, Swimming pool, airport view, romantic setup all make my anniversary awesome.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Let me start with the good things, their food. At least the most of it. Almost every item i tried was cooked to perfection. Seasoning, temperature control, and texture on point. Ribs were the most favorite item on my list. This was a meal i really enjoyed. Now for the few points of improvement. When you pay a lot of money for a single meal, you deserve more attention. I had to take points away from service as the plates, glasses, and cutlery were not well polished, and some of them were greasy. I hope Le Meridien and the latest recipe will pay more attention to it. I love to try the sushi wherever i go. And the sushi station you had was one of the worst. I hope you guys will take these points into consideration until my next visit ^_^

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Best buffet in town . Each and every food dishes are amazing . Best desserts as well

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Location : Le Meridien Dhaka Restaurant : Latest Recipe, Le MÃ©ridien Hotel Dhaka Items : Dinner Buffet Environment : Excellent Taste : Yes It is time to write about the taste. Every where Buffet was average or below average. My personal favorite is Sheraton. This time i had big expectation about their food and food was good. What i liked, I liked their beef steak, Ice Cream & some dessert items. I was looking for Rare Steak & they nailed it. They Serve almost 50+ items but no massed potato ! Good thing is they served varieties of drinks. Allover i would like to say that food was quite good and the atmosphere was fantastic. Recommended

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Great variety of food that exceeds all expectations and takes you to a taste journey. There is everything from oxtail with honey barbecued sauce perfectly cooked that falls from the bone to local speciality like paneer tika . Service is impecabile. All staff were caring and display positive body language, smiling and making you feel welcomed. I observed they are attentive to details like replenishing water and drinks and clearing the table as soon as you done with the service. Constantly checking if you need anything and if you are satisfied. I was impressed with Yusuf that made the best first impression and farewell service. As well Tasin and Mitu made great efforts to anticipate needs and achieve 100% customer satisfaction from us. I have more than 20 years in customer service so l can recognize great hospitality and be objective! Thank you, Oana

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Indulging in the brunch here was an absolute delight. The spread was a culinary masterpiece, offering a diverse array of delectable dishes, from gourmet pastries to savory delicacies. I love the food. There is a variety of items. The quality and freshness of ingredients were evident in every bite. The attentive and courteous staff ensured a seamless dining experience. The elegant ambiance added a touch of opulence to the meal. Whether you're a food enthusiast or seeking a lavish treat, this brunch is an experience worth every penny. The atmosphere was also very good. There was live music program also which was very soothing and free pool access in every friday

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I wouldnâ€™t call that a 5-star service as they should have paid more attention to the guests and kept the noisy maintenance for another time window. But man, aside from that part, everything was perfect. Every item we ordered felt fresh and soothing. The waiters were cordial. I might come back for a dinner someday.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Service and atmosphere were quite nice but I was very disappointed with the food. It was an expensive buffet but the food tasted quite average, some dishes were below average!! Tried several dishes and I couldn't find any dish that I liked and could go for a 2nd time. Me and my 5 other friends had more or less the same experience and were not satisfied with the dishes quite much. The number of dishes were limited and I felt like quite a few common dishes that you can find in other buffets with similar price range in dhaka were missing. Considering bang for the buck, not worth it.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: We went for a family dinner. Great atmosphere, well decorated, variety of foods, mouthwatering dishes. Kids loved it so much. Too expensive but made it worthy in respect of the served dishes and B1G1 offer of various Credit Cards!ğŸ˜œ

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Rooftop restaurant having one of the most beautiful view of Dhaka city. Clean and spacious. Food was freshly cooked but tasted like Bangladeshi version of thai food. Staff behaviour was good, but they need to be more professional. Not every food mentioned in the menu was available. Best thing: Spacious parking lot, no hassel car parking. You can have a hot milk tea after meal. Worst thing: There were plenty of flies after the meal was served and they use polythyn for take away food items.

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Rooftop restaurant having one of the most beautiful view of Dhaka city. Clean and spacious. Food quality was so much good & fresh. You can find here almost all kind of thai items & Deshi food. Best place for all kind of Corporate or family programme. Spacious parking are also available.

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Outdoor area is very beautiful and you can view the city and greenery.

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: A phenomenal place with breathtaking view from the outdoor roofside, to have foods around Bijoy Sarani. The restaurant have both indoor and outdoor facilities. Foods taste good but price seems a bit high according to the quality. There's also room for improvement among the staffs. Overall a nice place. Also during sunset the rooftop looks absolutely stunning.

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: We were there to attend a wedding. Large space, appropriate to arrange any special gathering like birthday, wedding etc. They have a rooftop with beautiful view. Impressive service.

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: It's one of the best rooftops restaurants in Dhaka city. You see a open view of old airport and open sky. Good place for party and family

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Had a wonderful experience at Thai Chi Restaurant & Cafe! The prices were a bit on the higher side compared to other places, but honestly, it was worth it. The location is absolutely beautiful with a stunning view that adds so much to the overall dining experience. The ambiance was calm and relaxing, and the service was excellentâ€”friendly, attentive, and professional. Definitely a great spot for a quality meal and a peaceful atmosphere. Highly recommended!

business_address: Level 7, 117/A, Puraton, Rangs Bhaban, Bijay Sarani, Biman Bondor Sarak, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: The food and atmosphere were awesome ğŸ‘Œ. But the waiters were quite late.

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently dined at the buffet at Sheraton Dhaka, and overall, it was a great experience. The food was delicious, with a wide variety of dishes to choose from, and everything tasted fresh and flavorful. The standout items for me were the grilled meats and the dessert selectionâ€”definitely worth trying! However, the atmosphere was a bit crowded, especially during peak hours. The noise level was high, and it felt a little too busy for a truly relaxed dining experience. If you're looking for a more peaceful meal, Iâ€™d recommend going during less crowded times. Still, the quality of the food and service made it a worthwhile visit. Would definitely recommend if you're in the area and craving a good buffet!

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Yumi at Sheraton, perched on the 27th floor, offers a dining experience that combines stunning views with culinary excellence. The ambiance is sophisticated yet inviting, with sleek decor and warm lighting that create a perfect backdrop for a memorable meal. The menu shines with its diverse offerings. The sushi was impeccably fresh, each piece bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. The dumplings were a delightful surpriseâ€”perfectly steamed, with a delicate balance of textures and savory fillings. The tomahawk steak, cooked to perfection, was juicy, tender, and packed with rich, meaty depth, making it a standout dish. The accompanying rice was fragrant and fluffy, complementing the bold flavors of the main courses. For dessert, the fondant with ice cream was divineâ€”warm, gooey chocolate paired with creamy, cool ice cream, a heavenly finish to the meal. The service (from Tareq) was exceptional, attentive staff who anticipated our needs and ensured every moment felt special. From the warm welcome to the seamless flow of dishes, their professionalism elevated the experience. Yumi at Sheraton is a gem for those seeking top-tier cuisine, breathtaking views, and impeccable service. Highly recommended for a special night out!

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We had an absolutely wonderful experience enjoying a set course menu here! The cherry blossom decor is beautiful, and the service was impeccable. The food was a journey: The Sushi, Miso Soup, and Assorted Fried Seafood were all superb. The main event, the rich Lobster Thermidor, was perfectly cooked and truly decadent. Ending with the unique Yuzu Mango Cheesecake with black sesame ice cream was the perfect finish. Highly recommend this spot for a special occasion or just a fantastic night out. We'll be returning!

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Great property at the heart of Dhaka. World class amenities. Service top notch. The ballroom is beautiful. Suitable for large events.

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: 10/10 Japanese food, 10/10 service. I had gone back another time and the service for shisha and drinks and service werenâ€™t great. But Yumi is an amazing restaurant the food is fresh, authentic and full of flavour. The waiters were excellent, they were well versed about the food, everything was spotless. Unfortunately we didnâ€™t have space for dessert but the mocktails were nice. I would highly recommend visiting. Well worth the price with the quality.

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Attended a dinner at Sheraton Dhaka and had a great experience! The ambiance was elegant and welcoming. The service was top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff. The food was delicious, and the presentation was impressive. The venue's location in Gulshan made it easy to find and access. Overall, a great experience, and I'd recommend Sheraton Dhaka for events and gatherings.

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Itâ€™s a pleasant surprise to find a good Japanese tepanyaki restaurant in Dhaka, although the tepanyaki bar counter was fully booked at both floors the table by the pool is also pretty awesome. The food is great and authentic wrapped in modern Japanesse style. We tried their beef gyoza that was presented unusually fun with round crepes on top, the tepanyaki udon beef and spicy tuna rolls are rockstars!

business_address: Level 27, 44 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Best Japanese restaurant in Dhaka. However, I have to say menu is mixed with authentic Japanese and some alternative ones. As for Sashimi, Yumi must be best in Dhaka. Raw fish items are better than those of Izumi or any other Japanese restaurants in Dhaka. On the other hand, there are some non-Japanese cuisines as well. Teppanyaki is enjoyable especially for kids and those with family members. Service quality is very high and almost all the staffs are gentle enough. The price range is very high and you have to be ready to spend at least 10k taka per person in case of dinner. If you take alcoholic drink with you, you need to pay 1.5k taka per bottle of wines, shochu, sake etc., and 2.5k taka for hard liquors. For beer, it's free. Please make sure to inform when you go with alcohol in advance.

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Bistro E is one of the finest dining spots in Dhaka! ğŸ½ï¸âœ¨ The ambiance is modern, cozy, and perfect for both casual meals and special occasions. The staff are attentive and professional, making the whole experience smooth and pleasant. The menu offers a great mix of international and fusion dishes â€” every item is beautifully presented and full of flavor. Their coffee and desserts are also top-notch! â˜•ğŸ° The place is clean, well-maintained, and ideal for spending quality time with friends or family. Highly recommended for anyone looking for good food, great service, and a relaxed atmosphere in the heart of Gulshan. ğŸŒ¿ğŸ’«

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I had an amazing experience at Bistro-E with my foreign guests. The food, ambience, and service of the staff were commendable. Since there are 5â€“6 embassies in the same building, youâ€™ll find many foreigners dining there. They maintain high-quality standards to ensure food safety. My guests felt comfortable and truly loved the serenity of the place.

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A quite expensive restaurant which is located near the Gulshan - 2 circle. Before entering here, youâ€™ve to go through some security checks because many embassy offices are located in the building. Not sure if the car parking facilities are available or not for the restaurantâ€™s people. Reservation is not required. Food tastes arenâ€™t bad. At the same time, itâ€™s not too delicious either. Ordering first will be a better option because food preparation will be taken sometimes. The waiting time is average. Varieties of food items are available for lunch or dinner. Desert and coffee similar items are also available.

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Iâ€™ve been a regular customer since they opened. The food is consistently good and offers solid value for money. However, some drinks, like Coke and tap water, feel a bit overpriced.

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A place that has a very welcoming look and an ambient atmosphere. The place is big, yet has a cozy feel. The interior decor is very tasteful. The place also has an art gallery in the lower floor with an outdoor seating arrangement. The servers are very cordial, friendly and professional. And the Floor Manager, Mr. Shamim, stood out in that regard. He was there at the door to welcome us, and was also inside, to assist. He even came up to our table to inquire if everything was okay. The food here is sumptuous to say the least. The restaurant does not have tea in its drinks menu. Yet, when we inquired, they went beyond their call of duty to prepare exceptionally well-made masala chai for us. My sincere thanks for that. Highly recommended.

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was terrible. It was way too salty, the beef bacon in the burger was tough and chewy, and the bun was dryâ€”definitely not like fresh bread. When I asked what was wrong, they claimed that Italian food is supposed to taste like that, which isnâ€™t true. The only redeeming part of the meal was the mocktails. Given the high prices, this quality of food is simply unacceptable.

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Inside Dhaka is a nice quality hotel. Whose food quality was extraordinary. I'm proud to come to this hotel. All of you will be a wonderful hotel.

business_address: 1st Floor NE (N, Bay's Edgewater, 12 Madani Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I had a lot of expectations from this place. The price is just too much compared to the taste of the food. I ordered a Gyro chicken from the appetizer menu, they served very less quantity, also the taste was not satisfactory at all. I also ordered the Mozzarella sticks which was alright. The Virjin Mojito was alright too. I had better before. The place is in the building of embassies of multiple foreign countries. Their toilet is far away on a different floor. Felt like going through a maze. Overall the price was too much compared to the quality of food. May be it's for foreigners. I didn't like the food at all. Also their building have a thing with parking of gas cars. Due to safety reasons we had to park the car outside. I wouldn't want to go there again.

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I had a great experience ordering from Breeze Restaurant! Hereâ€™s what I tried : Chicken Wings â€“ Big cuts of chicken with a nice sweet and sour flavor. The meat was soft and tender. Breeze Cilantro Chicken Rice â€“ I requested it with fried rice, and it was absolutely delicious. The chicken was flavorful and very softâ€”highly recommended! Crispy Seafood Salad â€“ Tasted like a standard salad, but everything was fresh and well-prepared. Still tasty and enjoyable. Their delivery service was fastâ€”they got everything to my hotel in about 45 minutes. Definitely worth the price for the quality and service!

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Breeze Restaurant is an absolute gem in Dhaka! From the moment you walk in, youâ€™re welcomed by a warm and inviting atmosphere with beautifully designed interiors that feel both cozy and elegant. The staff are friendly, attentive, and genuinely care about making your experience memorable. The food is outstanding â€” every dish is fresh, flavorful, and presented with great attention to detail. I especially loved the balance of spices and the portion sizes, which were perfect. Whether youâ€™re here for a casual lunch, a family gathering, or a romantic dinner, Breeze delivers on every level. Itâ€™s not just a restaurant, itâ€™s an experience worth coming back to again and again. Highly recommended for anyone who values quality food and top-notch service!

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Excellent food and service within reasonable prices.

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Breeze Restaurant, and it truly exceeded my expectations! Located in a peaceful area, this place offers a relaxed atmosphere with a beautiful view. The dÃ©cor is modern yet cozy, and the ambiance makes it perfect for both intimate dinners and casual outings with friends. We ordered a variety of dishes, including their signature Grilled Chicken, Mutton Korma, and Fried Rice, and each one was a treat to the taste buds. The grilled chicken was tender, and the mutton was cooked perfectly with rich spices. The fried rice complemented the meal very well. The portions were generous, and the presentation was appealing. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring we had a pleasant dining experience. The service was quick, and they were happy to make recommendations when asked. The pricing is reasonable for the quality and quantity of food you get, making it great value for money. If youâ€™re looking for a comfortable, no-rush dining experience with flavorful food, Breeze Restaurant is definitely worth a visit. Iâ€™m already planning my next visit to try more of their menu items

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Had the fried red snapper fishâ€¦ it was simply delicious and really freshâ€¦ staff is also very friendly and courteousâ€¦ would definitely recommend

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The food has lost its spark. Writing this with a heavy heart. Breeze started with fireworks of flavors on the plate. The recent visit was just heartbreaking. Their entire kitchen and service staff has been replaced, but not for the better. The service people are half-mindful of what the customer might want. The previous service staff made sure to always keep an eye on the dining customers. The most disastrous hit was in the kitchen where the food lost all its flavor and tasted blant. The burger, Wastagfirullah! A gourmet burger turned into a roadside jhol-burger. I hope the kitchen finds the momentum with the new staff.

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Breeze offers a casual, breezy vibe with polished execution. The space is bright and comfortable, not noisy, and the service is friendly and efficient. Dishes emphasize fresh, seasonal ingredients with subtle twists, focused on balance and technique. The beverage program pairs well, with quality wines, clever cocktails, and good mocktails. Value is solid for the quality, and reservations are smart, especially on weekends. Dietary accommodations are welcomed, and staff can tailor dishes when possible. Overall: dependable, approachable, and satisfying.

business_address: House# 1/C, 1/D, Road# 16, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was amazing. Every item we tasted was delicious. The interior is stunning. The staff are very nice and helpful!

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: It's was really a good place for get together. We enjoyed time together very much. Actually food was really good. Service and atmosphere also top notch.

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: This is a very old restaurant situated in Banani for about two decades. It is known for its South Indian section that is quite decent. So vegetarians flock in here who otherwise have less options in Dhaka city. However I was quite disappointed with the menu as the South Indian menu is not an extensive one, just basic ones like idli, dosa, uttapam and a few more variations in them. Although thereâ€™s a buffet for lunch, we did not opt for that. The interiors are quite decent and has a parking facility for a few cars inside campus. Altogether it is an ok place to visit in Dhaka, if you are craving for South Indian vegetarian menu.

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We have ordered several items. Kabab, naan, dal makhni, dosa and mutton biryani. All foods were good except mutton biryani. It was smelling like almost spoiled. We were 4 members. All we have experience the same problem. We informed them but they denied. They were trying to establish that it was a smell of spices. When we argue with them again and again they finally cancel the order of mutton biryani.... It was really disappointed from this renowned restaurant.

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: If you are looking for a fine dining experience, then this restaurant would be a good choice. The food is delicious, the menu has a varied selection, and the prices are reasonable. The ambience of the place is remarkable, with a tasteful interior decoration. And, finally, the servers are very courteous and alert. One drawback of this restaurant is that it has no parking facility. And that, in my opinion, is a huge drawback. And that is the only reason this restaurant will not get a 5-star rating from me.

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice Atmosphere ! Nostalgic to 90s. Food was good.

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Okayish place. The food was decent but the staff was kinda rude. Didn't like the vibe of the place though. Try and avoid this restaurant if possible. There's another restaurant "Tarka" nearby. Atleast a 100 times better than this in terms of ambience, food quality, portion size and most importantly "staff behaviour"

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I am from Canada and here is my honest review. Iâ€™ve been here a few times and loved it every single time. Food is fantastic. Service is excellent. Extremely clean restaurant. Their food is by far the best Iâ€™ve had. Iâ€™d definitely recommend coming here. Itâ€™s a lot of food so bring a date or a group.

business_address: House 14, House 14 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Good place for get together, but put space is limited as per number

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Another top end fine dining place for fusion cuisine in Dhaka. Nice ambience, has private rooms and almost all their items are quite yummy. The soup , starters, mains and even desserts and mocktails are very high quality, rich in flavour and quite delicious . The price point makes it expectable but for a special ocassion itâ€™s a very nice place . Would definitely recommend

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Hongbao is one of the best fine dining restaurants in Dhaka, offering a luxurious setting, elegant atmosphere, and top-notch service. The staff are friendly, helpful, and everything feels well-organized and classy. Hereâ€™s what we tried: ğŸ² Hot & Sour Soup â€“ Light and healthy with mushrooms and herbs. It had a warm and soothing flavor. ğŸ¥Ÿ Xiao Long Bao (Soup Dumplings) â€“ Soft, juicy dumplings served in elegant spoons. The filling was tasty, and the broth inside was rich. ğŸ¤ Steamed Shrimp Dumplings (Har Gow) â€“ Thin, shiny skin with perfectly cooked shrimp inside. Very delicate and smooth in taste. ğŸœ Cheung Fun (Rice Noodle Rolls) â€“ Soft rice noodles rolled with filling and served in a soy-based sauce. Mild, chewy, and light on the stomach. ğŸ Stir-Fried Udon with Black Pepper Beef â€“ Packed with flavor! The udon noodles were chewy, and the beef was tender. Spiced just right with black pepper and veggies. ğŸ° Banana Cake with Coconut Ice Cream â€“ A sweet ending! The pudding was moist and rich, and the coconut ice cream was smooth and creamy. A perfect match. ğŸ’¯ Service was excellent, from presentation to timing. Every dish came hot and fresh. The place is clean, calm, and beautifully decorated. âœ… Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy authentic Chinese cuisine in a luxury dining experience in Dhaka.

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I celebrated my birthday here with my family and had a wonderful experience. We ordered dumplings, different types of dumplings, claypot chicken and the coconut dessert to end. Absolutely loved the claypot chicken with rice. What I appreciate most is that the food was very good quality with no excess oil. Would definitely go back again for other options.

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Quality of the food was excellent and the service was outstanding. Atmosphere was cozy suitable for family and couples. I tried the famous hainanese chicken rice. Surely I will come again.

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Came back after a long time. Still great as always. Fantastic food, Fantastic Service, awesome food, insane desserts. Highly recommend it ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Elegant and Worth It Hangbao is easily one of the most refined dining spots in Dhaka. The ambience is luxurious, the service is top-notch, and the food is crafted with real attention to detail. Yes, itâ€™s priceyâ€”but for a special night out, itâ€™s absolutely worth it. Highly recommended for anyone looking to indulge in a premium experience.

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Hongbao, and I have to say it was a delightful experience! The atmosphere is vibrant and beautifully decorated, creating a cozy yet energetic vibe. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making us feel welcome right away. The menu features a great variety of authentic dishes, and everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. The dumplings were a standout, perfectly steamed and packed with flavor. I also loved the spicy stir-fried noodles; they had just the right kick without overpowering the other ingredients. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food, and the portion sizes are generous. I also appreciated the cleanliness of the restaurant, which added to the overall positive experience. I highly recommend Hongbao for anyone looking to enjoy some fantastic Chinese cuisine in a warm and inviting setting. I will definitely be coming back!

business_address: 65 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A fine-dine authentic Chinese restaurant in Gulshan, Dhaka. They beautifully present and serve an exquisite blend of contemporary Chinese food! They have a huge sitting capacity but need a prior reservation. Highly recommended.

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I would say that the food was very average. Lemon chicken was very sweet and mashed potatoes didnâ€™t taste that good. Almost as if it was stale. Rice lacked flavor and the mushrooms were oddly sour. The steak was ok and bbq chicken was also pretty alright. The portion size for the vegetables was not standard either. Overall they have the potential to do a lot better, its a good location and the sustainability concept is amazing. I loved the way the watermelon juice and pineapple juice was served. However, the recipes need work. Wonâ€™t visit again unless there is a complete overhaul.

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The food quality is good. Quality is also sufficient. Price is reasonable considering location of banani

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: If a restaurant is in Banani or Gulshan, of course the prices will be high, so I donâ€™t really mind that. But if Iâ€™m paying 600tk for a set meal, I at least expect it to be properly cooked and served â€” 600tk isnâ€™t a joke. The taste was honestly just okay, not great but not terrible either. What really bothered me was my steak â€” it still had blood marks near the bone. Didnâ€™t complain at that moment since I was in a hurry, but it shouldnâ€™t be like that. Even before the food came, I found a cockroach on my table. They did say sorry, but still, not a good first impression. And also the plate they provides it's wood plate idk how long it should be served. I smelled like the wet wood from the plate. The place has a kind of live kitchen setup, and the theme is dark, so the environment feels a bit heavy. Ambience was actually good, but food quality and hygiene need serious improvement

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We ordered sea food platter and naga chicken. Sea food platter portion size was big. If you donâ€™t like spicy then itâ€™s better to inform during order.

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Ordered Lobster dish cost over 2200 taka, they gave us prawn. Cheating. avoid this restaurant.

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Always a great place to find tasty set meals in a good price & excellent ambiance. However food quality has degraded over the years.

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Good food for affordable price. They have two floors, one is indoor and the other one is outdoor. The place is pretty small though. Service was alright, could be better. If you like spicy food, I recommend the Naga chicken steak

business_address: Banani 13/E , house #135 Opposite of Prescription Point, Rd No. 13E, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The beef iftar platter was good,the beef steak was amazing. It was juicy, tender ..just loved it. The platter had lobster, noodles, chicken lollipop, prawn cake, spring rolls, fruit salad, potato wedges and a lemon mint drink. The food was good. Also had gurer masala tea, I liked it. Due to being houseful, we could only get the top floor rooftop, seating was not very comfortable there but the indoor seating is nice n comfy. Would go there again for the steak for sure.

business_name: Texas Flame | Best Steakhouse In Dhaka
business_address: House 25,8th Floor(Lift 7, Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I had the best steak in Texas Flame. The restaurant is nicely decorated with wild west style. We tried their econo cut Mushroom hanger and one of their prime cuts ribeye steak. The mushroom hanger had two fixed side dishes: mashed potato, potato wedges. With the ribeye steak i chose mexican rice and sauteed mushrooms. With two sauces: bbq sauce and honey mustard sauce. The ribeye steak was cooked to perfection; perfectly juicy tender and tasteful. The bbq sauce was topnotch. The sauteed mushrooms could have been better.
business_name_normalized: texas flame | best steakhouse in dhaka

business_name: Texas Flame | Best Steakhouse In Dhaka
business_address: House 25,8th Floor(Lift 7, Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Went in here with a lot of expectations and I am happy to say they were met adequately. I took the Ribeye steak with potato wedges and mexican rice on the sides and bbq and alabama hot sauce for the 2 sauces. Both the sides and specially the Alabama hot sauce was a hit. The steak itself was perfectly done to medium rare and was juicy on every bite. The seasoning was not too bland, not too peppery; it went with my taste buds wonderfully. I have visited almost all of the top steakhouses in Dhaka and this one is definitely top 5. Special thanks to the staff too who were really polite and helpful. I'll definitely be back for more.
business_name_normalized: texas flame | best steakhouse in dhaka

business_name: Texas Flame | Best Steakhouse In Dhaka

business_name_normalized: texas flame | best steakhouse in dhaka

business_name: Texas Flame | Best Steakhouse In Dhaka
business_address: House 25,8th Floor(Lift 7, Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Texas Flame is a fantastic spot to enjoy steaks in Dhaka. The food was flavorful and well presented, from the juicy steak with mushrooms and creamy coleslaw to the perfectly made mashed potatoes served with sauted vegetables. Everything tasted fresh and satisfying. The atmosphere really stood out, the interior gives off a retro, Texas cowboy house vibe with thoughtful dÃ©cor and a cozy setup. Itâ€™s a great place to hang out with friends, enjoy good food, and soak in the unique Western style ambiance. Definitely worth visiting again.
business_name_normalized: texas flame | best steakhouse in dhaka

business_name: Texas Flame | Best Steakhouse In Dhaka
business_address: House 25,8th Floor(Lift 7, Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Firstly, the ambiance and service are alright. Now for the food. The Carnivore Steak Platter was their prime offering and the taste was overall quite good. They did slightly over/under cook some of the meats but in the end the taste was good and all was okay. However, one person in our group(being non beef eater) went for their Lamb Steak, and that was borderline inedible due to how extremely tough and chewy it was. Lamb is not supposed to be that hard. Bottom line - If you go here, stick to beef As for Texas Flame, just sell beef , the lamb felt like a scam.
business_name_normalized: texas flame | best steakhouse in dhaka

business_name: Texas Flame | Best Steakhouse In Dhaka

review_text: Finally, found the best steak house here in Dhaka! After 3 months craving for steak, find this Gem in google. The highest rate steakhouse in Dhaka, with a special 5 star service and of course 5 star taste. A combination of American atmosphere, with Bangladesh hospitality. My brother Tanvir and his team also give me their best service! Never forget the complimentary drink and milkshake. I really want to go here everyday, but sadly i have to go back home tommorow. They also have a Cowboy themed photo booth complete with all the cowboy stuffs. What a great experience to have lunch here. Bravo Texas Flame ğŸ¾

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Recently, I had the pleasure of dining at "Grandiose Restaurant" in Dhaka Regency Hotel for a buffet dinner. The overall experience was exceptional, from the courteous staff and inviting atmosphere to the delightful taste of every dish. I particularly savored the white sauce pasta and mushroom chicken, which stood out among the impressive array of offerings. The combination of excellent service and delicious cuisine made it a memorable dining experience at Grandiose Restaurant.

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the best buffets in Dhaka City. Foods tasted delicious & plenty of moth watering food items were put on the table. Service was pretty good. Soothing restaurant environment will refresh your mind. Overall itâ€™s an exceptional place to arrange private dining, buffet dinner, business dining & corporate events.

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Great restaurants for any meal of the day. Located on level 6 of the Hotel, the restaurant is the base for all food and beverages. It offer delightful decor and delicious cuisine, with very reasonable price, served by very helpful and friendly staffs.

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Went there for dinner buffet on Thursday night. I am super dissapointed with the food taste. Most of their food tasted below average except for the Indian dishes and tehari. I am happy with the service though. Staffs were professional and the atmosphere was pretty nice.

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The place is fine but food tastes was not upto the mark. Chowmein was very dry and chicken pineta was not good, desserts were average. Their normal pudding was really good but the strawberry pudding wasn't.

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: i visited here many time tested there food also. specially breakfast they have just excellent. i havo many foreigners clients they also want to come here and get to Dhaka regencys excellent service. in the morning time the hostess Fatema takecare and give us a great food service. and also taiqul ,Ishrat the trainee has done their work greatly.

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: â­â­â­â­â­ I had an amazing dining experience at Grandiose Restaurant, Hotel Regency. The ambiance was elegant and cozy, making it perfect for both casual and special occasions. The buffet spread was impressive, with a great variety of dishes from flavorful appetizers to delicious main courses and decadent desserts. The service was top-notch; the staff was attentive, friendly, and quick to respond to any requests. The food quality exceeded expectations, especially the grilled items and seafood selections. I also loved the live cooking stations, which added a great touch to the overall experience. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a luxurious dining experience in Dhaka. Will definitely visit again!

business_address: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort (Level 6, Tongi Diversion Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I have been visited several times at this place in the last 2 years, but in the last 1 year, with the new Chef Mr. Gomej, there has been a delicious transformation. The buffet item's, the layout, the responsiveness of staff has all got a super upgrade. I simply fell in love with the continental layout and the mind blowing desserts.

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The new menu is mind-blowing has almost everything you need from pasta to bruschetta. The service is extremely good. Staffs are nice. Fresh lemon sorbet is out of the world. Has pretty good liquor options.

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Had a great dining experience at Prego. The Italian food was spot onâ€”flavorful, fresh, and clearly made with a lot of care. Every dish we tried tasted amazing. The ambiance was elegant and well put together, which really added to the overall experience. From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel very welcome. Service was excellentâ€”friendly, attentive, and professional, just what youâ€™d expect from a high-end restaurant. Definitely a place worth coming back to.

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: â­â­â­â­â­ The prices are fair, and there are many options on the menu. Itâ€™s easy to get to, and the staff are very friendly. The place feels warm and welcoming, and the food is fresh and tasty.Wonderful food with lots of customers. Still, we passed very fantastic quality time and enjoyed the food. Prego remains a great Italian food place with proper 5 Star food experience! Try it's seafood, steak, chicken, pasta, pizza, salad and exceptional starters. Last but not least, their Lobster Thermidor is just fantastic! Great service.

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Wonderful food with lots of customers. Still, we passed very fantastic quality time and enjoyed the food.

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Prego remains a great Italian food place with proper 5 Star food experience! Try it's seafood, steak, chicken, pasta, pizza, salad and exceptional starters. Last but not least, their Lobster Thermidor is just fantastic! Great service.

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Upscale restaurant located on the 23rd floor of the Westin Hotel. The restaurant is an open kitchen concept, where you can see the chefs preparing the food. The restaurant it spacious with ample room between tables, and service is gracious and professional. Prices are on the higher side, but careful selection can help you avoid a hefty bill (for example, I chose salmon with pasta for 2800 BDT instead of grilled salmon for 7000 BDT, and still satisfied my seafood craving). Food was pretty delicious and a welcome break when youâ€™ve eaten Bangladeshi food every other day.

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Special thanks a Mr. Arif

business_address: The Westin, Main Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This is a very good restaurant i recommend everyone to try

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: I thought their chicken cordon bleu was very plain, the cappuccino was bitter, the cream mushroom soup was ok, and the tiramisu was just average. Although the ambiance was nice, the food was not to my taste.

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently dined at this modern bistro and had an absolutely delightful experience! The atmosphere was chic yet cozy, perfect for a casual night out. We started with a bowl of soup, which was bursting with flavor and clearly made with fresh ingredients. The chicken gyro was a standoutâ€”tender, perfectly seasoned. The fish and chips were equally impressive, with crispy batter encasing flaky, melt-in-your-mouth fish, served alongside golden fries. Finished with a nice brownie and ice cream. The service was attentive and friendly, adding to the overall charm. I canâ€™t wait to return to try more of their menu! Highly recommend this gem for a fresh, flavorful meal.

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: Beautifully topped with caramelized pineapple slices and a rich, dark sauce, possibly a teriyaki or balsamic glaze. The pineapple not only adds a vibrant visual appeal but also seems to offer a delightful sweet and tangy counterpoint to the savory meat. I had a well-prepared and flavorful meal. Great ambiance and top notch service from the staff.

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: One of those restaurants that has compelled me to leave a review. The food here is awesome. Nothing felt/tasted like it needed any improvement. The Chicken Cordon Bleu is the best I have had in Dhaka. The Grilled Chicken Mango Salad had a good amount of mango and the right balance. The Cream of Mushroom Soup was tasty and the bread enclosure it comes with helps its cause. The Apple Iced Tea had a nice balanced taste. But for me the star of the show was the Mango Pie. It truly was mesmerizing and the sweetness just felt right. It's now officially my favorite dessert in town.

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was fantasticâ€” the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, and the sauce had an ideal consistency. The sliders were delicious, each with its own distinct flavor, especially the one with blue cheese. The atmosphere was pleasant, friendly, and not overly hectic. Although the food took a while to arrive, the great taste made it worth the wait.

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: Last week I visited The Grove Bistro in Gulshan for the first time, and honestly, it was such a pleasant experience. The first thing that caught my eye was the beautiful interior and calm atmosphere. With greenery all around and warm lighting, it felt like a peaceful escape from the busy city. The staff were polite, friendly, and attentive. From taking my order to serving the food, everything was done smoothly and on time. For my meal, I had [Bread Bowl and Fish with Chips] â€“ it was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly balanced. The presentation was also spotâ€‘on. The drinks were refreshing and complemented the meal really well. Overall, itâ€™s the kind of place where you get great food, a lovely environment, and genuinely good service all in one. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back and recommending it to my friends.

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice as always Retro Paris look Food is excellent Worth it

business_address: Level 12, Hamid Tower, Gulshan Circle 2, Bangladesh
review_text: Great place to enjoy a quiet evening with friends, family and partners. It's a little on the expensive side but the food quality is definitely value for money. Would like to visit again. Although I'd like to mention that their Cream of mushroom soup in a bread bowl can seem a bit less in quantity due to the bread bowl being so thick, so other than that everything else is fine.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
