review_text: The best things about this place for me were it's ambiance, decor and service. The place is well designed and decorated. Gives you a very premium feel when you enter. They have both outdoor and indoor seating. There a lot of spaces for group seating as well. The service was very good. Staff were very helpful. The food was a bit of a let down. For the price they were charging, I felt one could get much better Thai cuisine at much cheaper prices and better taste. But I guess the ambiance and service sort of made up for it. But if you came for the sole purpose of having some proper, well made Thai cuisine, I'd suggest otherwise. But if you're looking to host a party, or get together with nice seating and decor, this could very well be an option. On the upper floor, they also seemed to have an option for buffet style, if you booked the whole area.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Sei 71 Restaurant has a beautiful ambiance with elegant dÃ©cor and a comfortable environment that enhances the dining experience. The food quality is quite good and well-presented. However, the prices feel a bit on the higher side compared to the portion and overall value. Great place for an occasional treat.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Decor and ambience was amazing. The moment you step into the establishment you could tell they spent money and effort. It was Thursday night and place was packed. Itâ€™s a good thing we made reservations. However, itâ€™s like they spent all the effort on decor because food was very average. It did not live up to the expectations of the restaurantâ€™s ambience. We ordered chicken satay which tasted like Kabab. Donâ€™t get me wrong, it was tasty but it was not satay. Then we ordered prawn on toast which was great. Clear Thai soup which was bland at best. Hot and sour soup on the other hand, was very good. Fried rice was also bland, pad Thai was good, crab with chilli paste was a bit strange in the sense that it was just crab legs portions. Not the entire crab you get at other restaurants. Sizzling beef was oily. Chicken with cashew nut was also oily. So, food was hit and miss. Service was very attentive.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Well decorated. Price is little hig comparing taste. They serve cold drink cans like Coke/Sprite which are imported and price is very high. u should avoid these drinks. Bette to taste fresh fruit juices.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Environment is excellent, some foods were below average, chicken satay were dry, coconut thai soup could be better, vegetable tempura was below average. Coconut ice cream was so good.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Soi 71 has a really nice vibe with a spacious and beautifully designed dining area, perfect for hanging out with family or friends. The interior looks great and super aesthetic. It's definitely a good spot for taking photos and a relaxed meal. It feels comfortable and welcoming, making it a nice place to just chill and enjoy some good food.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The ambience is truly praiseworthy, with an expanded seating area thatâ€™s perfect for group gatherings or parties. The food overall was quite good. However, the beef sizzling dish was a bit too saltyâ€”hope the chef pays closer attention to seasoning next time. Still, a nice place to hang out and enjoy a meal.

business_address: House-8 Rd 101, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: If you want to take a lot of pictures, then this place is it. The interior is amazing. But if you want to have good food in the good atmosphere, then it is a bad idea. Their food is horrible. We waited for 30minutes for our food, then they served cold food and the taste is not even okay. I spent 9k there, but only we liked their appetisers. Also one of my friends visited them a few days ago and she was also talking about the same things.

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Manzo establishes itself as a premier culinary destination within Dhaka, distinguished by its dedication to refined European and Mediterranean cuisine served in an exceptionally sophisticated setting. The ambiance is one of understated elegance, characterized by spacious, meticulously designed interiors featuring high-quality finishes and an intentional curation of contemporary local artwork. This environment is highly conducive to both professional engagements and celebratory occasions, ensuring a sense of calm and exclusivity that elevates the dining event. â€‹From a culinary perspective, the restaurant excels by focusing on both seasonal and locally-sourced produce, which informs a rotating menu of classic dishes executed with modern precision. Their weekend brunch service is particularly noteworthy, offering elevated interpretations of standards such as the Eggs Benedict and the comprehensive Breakfast Plate. The overall experience is further cemented by a commitment to impeccable, attentive service, where staff demonstrate a high degree of professionalism and discretion, making Manzo a truly polished and distinguished choice in the cityâ€™s fine dining landscape.

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Not our first time at this fine eatery. We ordered the Gambas, Beef Bruschetta, Beef Carpaccio, Braised Short Rib Fettuccine, Beef Tenderloin, Rib Eye, Beef Burger with a side of fries. Couldnâ€™t fault a single item ordered. High standard quality and great service!

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Don't have much dishes in the menu. Probably wanted to concentrate only the selected dishes for serving the best. Indeed, every dish were super excellent!

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good atmosphere for a quiet conversation over a delicious and well plated meal. Menu standouts are the Grilled Octopus and the Slow Cooked Mutton Shank.

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Manzo has excellent service and the ambiance is great. The food is on the expensive end though. We tried their Butter seared scallops which was amazing. They give you 6 pieces. We also tried their grilled octopus which wasnâ€™t really up to the mark. Lastly tried their beef tenderloin which was cooked to a perfect medium rare. We also tried their drink Nirvana which was good. The servers were very polite and helpful. Service was excellent.

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was decent but it was a very pricey resturant according to me a gourmet soup for 1500tk seemed too much. Their complimentary bread was not complimenting at all felt soo cheapğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚( amr bichi o er cheye boro). The fish that we had tasted good but had a very fishy taste. If u are looking for a quiet fine dining resturant might be good choice for u.

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Absolutely perfect place for a date night! With dimly lit ambience and an impeccable taste for jazz this place takes the win. The food melts into your mouth, lingering even after days. An absolute delight to the tastebuds.

business_address: 2nd Floor, à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾à¦¬à§à¦²à¦¾à¦‚à¦•à¦¾, 114 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: No doubt their food was amazing but they failed to give me my desired table. Yes I didnâ€™t book a table in advance but there was no one in the whole restaurant when I was there and they kept on telling everything is reserved. They gave me a place beside their front desk and the printing sound or whatever kept damaging my date. I will come again with a reservation because I liked the food but they better quit this bullshit policy.

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Bella Italia offers a classic, comforting Italian experience that has cemented its status as a local favorite. The atmosphere manages to be simultaneously lively and intimate, evoking an old-timey Italian vibe with its charming decor and background music, which makes it perfect for a casual family meal or a laid-back dinner with friends. The environment is generally clean and comfortable, though the lighting can feel a bit too bright in the evenings; a minor detail, but something to note if you prefer moodier dining. â€‹The food, however, is the real reason for the consistent crowds. Bella Italia's strength lies in its authenticity and consistency, particularly with its famous thin-crust pizzas. Dishes like the Pizza Bolognese or the classic Quattro Formaggi arrive perfectly crisp and richly flavored, proving why they are considered some of the best in the city. Beyond the pizza, the menu features a dependable selection of rich pastas, such such as the Lasagne Al Forno. While the service can occasionally be slow during peak hours, the overall experience of enjoying genuinely satisfying Italian comfort food makes this restaurant a reliable staple.

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good food, decent service. This was one of the earliest restaurants in Dhaka where you could get proper Italian pizza and pasta. Now although there are many alternatives, this place holds the classic vibe. A range of pizza, pasta and classic Italian dishes to choose from. Very casual setting. Perfect for work lunch.

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Really nice place, beautiful Italian style interiors! Their coffee smells amazing as well as the pizza and pasta, the tomato flavour on pasta initially didn't feel right but it got better with every bite, but I'm not giving entirely 5 star because I Didn't like their Tiramisu at all, It's more of a coffee ice cream rather than tiramisu, so wouldnâ€™t recommend it. But overall, a good experience.

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: So we were at bella italia, everything was good at first but at the end i got a tiny hair in my pasta, i called service people but they just said they Don't how It's happened!!!! Very awkward. It was our first visit. Except all this food was good but need to maitain more personal hygiene.

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Only downside is the restaurant is over lit and way too bright during the evening. They need to invest in proper quality lighting thatâ€™s not to dazzling. Food is always very consistent and tasty with good sized portions.

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I always grew up hearing that it's the best Thin Crust Pizza ğŸ• of town and undoubtedly it is. For some weird reason, I've never had the chance to go to this place until recently. I took Four Cheese (quattro formaggi) Pizza with add ons of Ground Beef. Oh Man, it was delicious ğŸ¤¤. 5/5 any given day. Loved it. Ambiance is nice, they also have some parking. All in all, amazing.

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: So excited when I saw a word of 'Artichoke' in the menu since never thought able to enjoy artichoke in Bangladesh... Provides authetic Italian's 'Mamma' recipes without changing taste to match Bangladesh tongue. Tomato sauce is wonderful in both pasta and pizza. Pizza dough is thin and crispy, just like the one served in Italia. You can recognize the difference from other restaurants once you take it. Prices are reasonable. Sep30 Took a famous Italian dish called 'Vittelo Tonato', and and was very goodâ¤

business_address: Rangs FC Enclave , 2nd floor, Road 32, Plot 6/A Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Amazing food, their pasta is very fresh, i tried the fettuccini pomodoro secchi and the sauce was very bright and the tomatos were super juicy the shrimp could bw a bit more tender tho. The pizza was absolutely fantastic the crust was very light and crispy and the sauce is very fresh

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I have been going to this place for years, if you have a taste bud for authentic Korean food this place is for you . Their taste and ambience is top notch ! Also for foreigners byob a available

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Very authentic korean food. Loved it. The dumplings. The chicken and shrimp jumulleok was amazing. Did not like the chicken bulgogi much, it tasted very different to what I had abroad. The pan fried beef dumplings were amazing as well. Will definitely go again.

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Loved that place. The food tastes amazing. We tried glass noodles, seafood barbecue, salmon sashimi, Korean fried chicken, and soups. No complains. The ambience was good, servers super nice, price reasonable. I would say this is a great place to enjoy Korean food in Dhaka - especially noodles and grills.

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently discovered an incredible spot to satisfy my Korean food cravings in Bangladesh. The very first bite of the Spicy Braised Chicken was like an explosion of flavors that felt like love at first bite. Each dish we tried was nothing short of amazing. The variety ranged from delectable seafood to mouth-watering chicken options. The Spicy Braised Chicken is a standout, an absolute must-try. The Korean Seasoned Fried Chicken, coated in a gochujang sauce, was equally impressive and left a lasting impression. And letâ€™s not forget about the soupsâ€”they were the perfect companions to the cold weather, offering warmth and comfort in every spoonful. This place truly feels like a haven of comfort food, and I canâ€™t wait to go back.

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The menu has so many options that I was lost! Kimbap was good, so was the Miso soup. Tteokbokki was not good, it was so so heavy. Liked the kimchi, especially the cabbage one!

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food is below average because they don't give enough meat. The bulgogi was all garlic/ onions, no meat. Shrimp sushi was good. The cuttlefish item was also lot of sauce and no cuttlefish. I was going to order the ribs but thank God I didn't as it would have been just bones. Sad that they don't give enough ingredients because its not cheap. I wonder if they have two types of service, more meat for expats and onion and gravy for locals because it was full of expats and surely they wont stand for saucy garlic in the name of Bulgogi. I miss Arirang, top notch it was in every way!!!!!

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I've had a very nice experience at Koreana the other day. Five of us went there for dinner. We have tried multiple items including Beef/Sea Food. Overall loved the food experience. The ambiance is quite nice. It's a bit pricey but the experience is worth it. You can cook on your own if you want or the servers will do that for you. It's a very popular place, in peak time there's a queue to get a seat.

business_address: House No, 22 Rd 123, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Today I tried a Korean restaurant for the first time! The food was amazing â€” I ordered bibimbap and kimchi stew, and the flavors were so unique and delicious. The side dishes (banchan) came in little plates, and I loved trying all of them, especially the spicy radish. The staff were friendly, and the atmosphere made me feel like I was in Seoul. Definitely going back again!

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: I visited Palm View Restaurant for my cousinâ€™s wedding and had a wonderful experience! The ambiance was beautiful and perfect for such a celebration. The food was delicious, the service was attentive, and everything was well-organized. It felt safe and very pleasant. Highly recommended for weddings and special occasions! ğŸ‰âœ¨

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Amazing experience at Palm View Restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious, and the ambiance was so relaxing. The staff were very friendly and professional. A great place to hang out with family or friends. Highly recommended! ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: visited Palm View Restaurant and had a wonderful experience! The food was deliciousâ€”especially their coffee and desserts, which were amazing. The ambiance was cozy and relaxing, making the meal even more enjoyable. The staff were friendly and provided quick, attentive service. Itâ€™s also a great spot for solo dining. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back here again!

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: A restaurant is a place where people go to eat food. It offers different types of meals like breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Some restaurants serve local food, while others serve international dishes. People go there with family or friends to enjoy tasty food and relax. Restaurants also provide good service and a comfortable environment. It is a popular place for celebrations and gatherings.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Good arrangements but full with mosquitos in the evening program. Ample parking, spacious but internal cleaning should be improved. Water bottles were stacked here and there. Wash rooms are required to be improved.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: They serve good tasty and delicious combo platters.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: The food is very delicious and the behavior of the staffs are very good. Also they have peaceful environment to enjoy. Rating - 9/10

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: During my recent visit to Palm View Restaurant after a decade, the first thing that caught my attention was the impressive ambiance and atmosphere. Situated alongside a golf course, the restaurant offers delightful views, particularly from its semi-outdoor seating area. The establishment was not overly crowded, allowing me to relish the tranquility and peacefulness. Regarding the food, we decided to begin with a combination starter consisting of chicken fry, prawn on toast, and chicken wonton. For our main course, we selected Chicken Valencia and Spaghetti Bolognese. While the food was not exceptionally outstanding, it was still tasty. The prawn on toast was satisfactory, and the crispy layer of the fried chicken could have been improved. However, the quantity of food provided for the main course more than justified the price. Both the spaghetti and the chicken portion were generous enough for a single person. I believe that slightly reducing the dryness of the spaghetti would greatly enhance its overall appeal. All in all, it was a highly enjoyable experience for me. The quality and quantity of the food, along with the reasonable pricing and inviting ambiance, convinced me that I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a family dinner or a gathering.

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I normally don't give 10/10 review to any restaurants. But honestly this is an impeccable restaurant. Best food in dhaka. Love the combination of each dish. So harmonies and flattering each mains and even sides. Its a must try. Yes its a proper fine dining restaurant, still worth every penny. Quality of the salmon, tenderloin steak, scallops, mushrooms everything is a symphony.

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: ORO is our ultimate favourite for burgers and pastaâ€¦ i go again and again for the burgerâ€¦ love their presentation, ambience and overall quality and serviceâ€¦ Price moderately expensive.. but worth of the quality and taste!! Pre reservation is neededâ€¦ which is good.. you donâ€™t need to waitâ€¦

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the better Western style restaurants in Metro Dhaka. Open Kitchen design, nicely appointed interior and high quality, tastefully plated cuisine. Menu standouts would be the Beef Tongue Tacos, the Scallop Duxelles, the Bone Marrow, and, of course, the Wagyu Steak. Excellent for takeout / Grab Food too if you just want a good meal while working thru Dinner at the Hotel.

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: It's great . Foods are very yummy, food presentation is very stylishly served. Interiors is nice. service good . Expensive restaurant. I love this restaurant.

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The ambience is very nice and classy, it is beautifully decorated. The pricing might be high but the ingredients are extremely premium and fresh, which makes up for the high price. The taste is also really good. The service is excellent, the food was served very quickly. Overall, recommended if you are looking for a fine dining restaurant.

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We dined for lunch at Oro. We liked the design of the restaurant- we were downstairs. High ceiling and off gold paint work. A nice open kitchen- beautiful exhaust hood. We thought service was a bit off ve other restaurants we visited. The waiter who served us was gruff and simply not very friendly. Food ordered- burger was ok- the frites were very good. The two pastas - seafood with the home made pappardelle was excellent. The red sauce arrabiata was average. However we didnâ€™t think the chicken was very good at all! Overall 4 people - house water and 4 plates came to 6000takaâ€¦ 1500 each. I think the service on the day was the let down. We will try again

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Delicious! Splendid ambiance and great service. We ordered a beet root and goat cheese starter, accompanied by three mains: beef tongue tortillas, alfredo fettuccine with chicken parmesan, and a medium cooked tenderloin steak; finally finished it off with a scoop of salted caramel and chocolate gelato. The food was very tasty, many vibrant flavours! Would recommend all the dishes we mentioned above.

business_address: 6/A, Rangs FC 2 corner of Rd 32 and, Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Loved their food and the service. All their items are sourced carefully and cooked perfectly.

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: Koyla Restaurant in Niketon, Dhaka offers a classic and elegant environment, perfect for a relaxed dining experience. The food is known for being less oily compared to many other Indian-style eateries, which adds to its appeal for health-conscious diners. Dishes like kebabs, curries, and biryani are prepared with fresh ingredients and deliver a good balance of flavor without overwhelming spices. The service is courteous and the ambiance is well-maintained, adding to the overall experience. While the prices are slightly on the higher side, the quality and setting make it worth a visit.

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: Their service is undeniable best. Their food quality can be upgrade. I love the kabab but not a fan for the nun.

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: This is a medium sized restaurant located near Police Plaza on the ground floor of the building. There is no dedicated parking so most people park on the roadside. The entrance is wheelchair accessible. The restaurant specializes in kebabs and Indian dishes. I highly recommend their kebab items as they are quite flavorful. However, I would advise against ordering the Hyderabadi Biryani as itâ€™s not up to the mark. Overall, the food tastes decent. The staff are friendly and their recommendations are generally good. It's a suitable place for both family gatherings and office events. I would recommend making a reservation in advance for events. However, the washroom facilities could be improved.

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: We used to go there regularly. Recently visited there after a gap of about 7 years. It felt great to find that, the amazing taste of their food haven't changed a bit, at all. They have maintained the same great presentation, taste, quality and service. Note: most of their single serving dishes are too much for one person. So order with keeping it in mind. If you are visiting there in a group, this tip may come in handy to save costs and reduce waste. They don't have a dedicated parking. Cars must be parked in front of the restaurant, where the space is limited.

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: Koyla Restaurant, established in 2008, is a distinguished dining destination in Dhaka, renowned for its authentic Indian and Afghan Mughal cuisine. Situated at 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Tejgaon-Gulshan Link Road, the restaurant offers a culinary journey reminiscent of royal feasts. The menu at Koyla is a testament to rich culinary traditions, featuring signature dishes like Hyderabadi Biryani, prepared with basmati rice and tender goat meat, and an array of kebabs grilled over coal to enhance their authentic flavors. Complementing these mains are freshly baked naans, flavorful curries, and the refreshing Koyla Lassi, a yogurt-based drink infused with spices. The ambiance of Koyla is designed to provide a warm and inviting atmosphere, making it an ideal venue for both family gatherings and business meetings. The interior reflects a blend of traditional and contemporary aesthetics, enhancing the overall dining experience. Guests are often welcomed with a complimentary drink, such as cumin water, setting the tone for the meal ahead. Operating daily from 11:00 AM to 11:00 PM, Koyla ensures accessibility for both lunch and dinner patrons. While the restaurant does not have a dedicated parking area, limited street parking is available in front of the establishment. It's advisable to plan accordingly, especially during peak hours. Over the years, Koyla has garnered positive feedback for its consistent food quality and attentive service. Diners have praised the generous portion sizes, often recommending sharing dishes to fully appreciate the variety offered. The restaurant's commitment to maintaining the authenticity of its dishes has solidified its reputation as a go-to spot for those seeking genuine Mughal culinary delights in Dhaka. In summary, Koyla Restaurant stands out as a premier destination for enthusiasts of Indian and Afghan cuisines, offering a harmonious blend of traditional flavors and modern dining comfort.

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: Restaurant is on the Gulshan to Mohakhali link road. Entering the restaurant you will see the live kitchen. Separate wash room for both male and female. Zeera pani was served as welcome drinks. Mainly kebab items, naan in the menu. Biriyani was also available. You can try kebab items.

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: Overpriced tasteless food. We ordered reshmi butter chicken masala, paneer parata and plain polao. The chicken tasted very bad, no spice, very plain. The paneer parata was rock-hard. The polao was good. Overall I ate my money literally. I don't know why these posh restaurants always serve tasteless food. Can't they afford a good cook?

business_address: 411 Bir Uttam Mir Shawkat Sarak, Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh
review_text: The food quality was good, but the taste was average. What I expect from Indian cuisine is a generous use of spices.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Please Improve Your ğŸ™ Food The Way You Show In The Pctures In All Your Aps. SO Much Disappointed, No Salt, No Taste. ITS Just A Waste. SO Sorry To Say, BBQ Chicken Is Sweet Like Anything, Fried Rice ğŸš Is Just Satisfactory, Side Vegetables Has No Taste, Just With Lots Of Capsicum. And The Other Its Just Few Piece Of Carrot Papaya, Green Capsicum & Onion Made It With In Like Ordinary Chinese Vegetable, And That Is Not A Broast Chicken, But A Fried Chicken, Fried In Crumbs.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Tried their couple of platters, not bad but not fantastic either. Cheese of Staffed chicken did not feel that good and Garlic chicken was way more salty. Ambience is good and we got good service from the staffs there. Overall, worth trying atleast once.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We used to eat at Barcode CTG a lot, it was one of our go-to places. I recently visited their Banani branch, and I feel the food quality isnâ€™t what it used to be. On top of that, the prices have gone up quite a bit.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The experience was great. But there was noisy kids around. The food was tasty, but I found hair on the seafood platter. The staff are super friendly and the ambience is nice. Its a must recommended place. One fact, they served seafood ricebowl and there was no fish meat but what they gave was fish fat. It did not taste bad. I found calamari and the rice was good and the salad was excellent. Brosted Chicken ricebowl was okayish but the chicken could be improved. The batter was alot and chicken felt average. They should keep some variety of drinks.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Not very happy and content with the quality and quantity of the foods. Service is also not up to tge mark.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Tried their barcode special chicken pizza sandwich. In my opinion this is a better option than pizza. It was tasty. Also tried their oven baked chicken pasta, which was okay. Their service was good. The seating arrangement could be a bit better. The price range is good according to other nearby restaurants.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Barcode cafe, located in Banani is a popular dining spot known for its diverse menu & inviting ambiance. The restaurant offers a variety of cuisines like Italian, fast food, Mediterranean dishes etc. The have a signature Fuchka dish which is very popular and tasty to eat. Also they have Chicken Pizza Sandwich which is a fusion of pizza and sandwiches. Their Turkish Chicken meal and English roasted chicken meal are popular items on the set menu. It is served with Sauteed veg and fried rice. You can choose whether you want rice or mash potato. I have tried their Calamari deep fry, Wonton with Chilli Oil. Both were good in taste. On the side, I've taken the Beef platter named - Loaded Beef with Sausage. This was also good. Pretty nice place to eat, gossip and have quality time with friends / Family / Colleagues. The stuffs are well-behaved and the interior is good. The price is a bit higher than the quantity. They should increase the proportion of their dishes.

business_address: House 55/B Rd No # 21, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Barcode Cafe offered a mixed dining experience that left us with varied impressions. Our culinary adventure included indulging in the famed fuchka platter and opting for the rice bowl package. While the taste of the fuchka platter met our expectations, the overall experience fell short of the hype surrounding it. The fuchka platter, undoubtedly the star attraction, showcased an array of flavors and textures. The burst of tangy and spicy sensations with each bite of the crispy shells filled with delectable concoctions left a favorable impression. However, the anticipation built around this dish may have elevated our expectations to a level that reality struggled to match. On the other hand, the rice bowl package failed to justify its price tag. The dish lacked the finesse and flavor complexity that one would expect for the amount paid. The rice seemed uninspiring, and the accompanying elements failed to elevate the overall dining experience. This disconnect between price and quality left us somewhat disappointed. Despite our initial excitement about the fuchka platter, we found it essential to acknowledge that its reputation might have been inflated. While enjoyable, it may not be the unparalleled experience some might lead you to believe. Managing expectations is crucial when venturing into the culinary offerings at Barcode Cafe. The ambiance and service at the cafe were commendable, providing a comfortable setting for our dining experience. The staff were attentive and accommodating, contributing positively to our overall visit. In conclusion, Barcode Cafe offers a culinary journey with highs and lows. The fuchka platter, while enjoyable, might not live up to the overwhelming hype, and the rice bowl package may leave you questioning its value. It's a place where managing expectations becomes pivotal for a satisfying dining experience.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I have tasted turkish foods in many other places...But All the foods here were really delicious...Mixed kebab Platter was perfect for 2 adults...Highly recommended.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Visited Turkish Bazaar & Restaurant last week with my cousins for Turkish food at Dhaka, Banani. When I went to Turkey loved their food and specially Baklava. So thought we can get a proper Turkish flavour, that was our mission . We tried Mixed Kebab Plater with Mango Juice, Turkish Tea and Baklava. Food was nice but bit different from original Turkish style and taste. But the decoration they keep Turkey style which is nice and also sell Turkish crockeries.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We had our family dinner here. Interior and searing give you a bit of turkish feel. Seatings are in separate rooms and you can book rooms/table. Food was good and enough as they come with rice and bread as well with kababs. But price wise I found them bit costly. We had Ezme (BDT 350) and Hummus (BDT 380) both comes with 4/5 slices of pita bread. We also took chicken adana kabab( BDT 890), grilled meatballs (BDT 890) and special burhan kabab (BDT 1050) which actually a kabab platter for 1. We also ordered turkish pizza, it was good too. Additional Vat and service charge are there. Staff were very attentive and served turkish tea on the house. Parking available on road side, give a tip to the guard.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: If you love Arabian cuisine, you will love the food they serve. It has the Arabian touch and is highly recommended. It is an amazing spot to hang out with family or a group of friends. For large gatherings, it is a good spot. The waiters are too hostile and polite. They also recommend well. If you are the bread or kabab type, you will love it there. You might feel the food is a bit dry and a little bit of gravy is needed, then you may add hummus to your platter. In my opinion, it will adjust the dryness. Overall, the food tasted delicious and was mouthwatering. We were welcomed with complimentary Turkish Tea. We ordered 5-6 items, therefore it cost quite much ~7000. The order was for 5 adults. So, it suffices. We enjoyed our meal in Turkish Bazaar & Restaurant, so I hope you will too.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food is goodâ€¦ try to do the authentic way. The main problem in our country is the ingredients but still the manage to have the taste. I like the kebabs and naan. Pizza was little bit oily but still the taste was good. But I didnâ€™t like the Turkish coffee. It was very lite. I tried better Turkish coffee in other places. Maybe their beans get old. Interior is very minimalistic nothing fancy.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Turkish Bazaar is a restaurant of authentic Turkish cuisine, especially the kebab. In a nice traditional Turkish ambience, the restaurant serves delicious food with great comfort and hospitality. I love the welcoming gesture of the team. Foods taste really good. All foods were prepared after order and served fresh. Additional was the complementary Turkish Tea. I have ordered the kebab platter, good for two persons. Also, a starter, hummus. In both orders, servings were generous. I had to takeaway some food. For a nice evening with friends and family, this is an ideal place.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The worst restaurant in Banani, Dhaka. I was the only customer during a Friday lunch prayers. Ordered a chef special with a Turkish naan. They brought a smaller size than what I see from everyone elseâ€™s posted pictures. Uncooked wings, foreign objects in the food, cold naan, and half size meal when paid for a full size. Will never go back and also report this place.

business_address: House 48/E, 131 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Turkish Bazaar offers an authentic taste of Turkish cuisine in Bangladesh, showcasing flavorful dishes. While the food impresses with its deliciousness, the pricing might be a deterrent for some, leaning towards the higher side. Despite the cost, the culinary experience is undoubtedly a treat for those seeking traditional Turkish flavors in Dhaka.

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited this restaurant, and it has quickly become my favourite place. The food was absolutely delicious, and the live cooking experience made the whole evening even more enjoyable. Watching the dishes being prepared right in front of us added a special touch. Our waiter, Shuvo, made the experience even better he was very experienced, attentive, and made sure we were well taken care of throughout. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience, and I canâ€™t wait to go back again.

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Thanks to Mr.Kazi tarequl for his hospitality during my dining time. All the staffs are nice, polite and helpful. The welcome service was amazing with cold refreshments tower and the welcome juice. The sushi is very tasty, so I came back again the second time on the same day. Everything is clean which is very important for me when picking a restaurant. They have special zone for live cooking, private room for group also. Very good choices!

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the best Japanese fine dine restaurant in Dhaka. Starting from their food to their drinks,service and ambience everything is top notch. They also have a live grilling station (teppanyaki). The fish and meat they serve is very fresh. Recommended ğŸ’¯ /ğŸ’¯.Will visit again soon â˜ºï¸

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Had an amazing dining experience at Konami! The Teppanyaki was absolutely delicious â€” fresh ingredients, perfectly cooked, and full of flavour. Watching the chef prepare everything right in front of us was such a fun and interactive experience. The ambience was warm and elegant with a real Japanese touch, and the staff were super friendly and attentive. If you love Japanese cuisine or just want to try something exciting and different, Konami is the place to go! Definitely coming back again soon.

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Hands down the best Japanese restaurant Iâ€™ve been to in Dhaka! The Teppanyaki experience was amazing â€“ watching the chef cook right in front of us was not only entertaining but also delicious. The beef teppanyaki and salmon were perfectly cooked and packed with flavor. The ambiance is cozy yet elegant, and the staff are super friendly and attentive. Highly recommend for anyone who wants authentic Japanese food with a fun dining experience!

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This restaurant has been in operation since almost a year and a half, and I only discovered its existence. The location is a little off the beaten path despite being in the heart of Gulshan. We ate Teppanyaki, so the experience was wonderful. Bewarned, the costs can get quickly out of hand with larger groups. Restaurant claims two people can eat with one Teppanyaki order, but I thought it could easily stretch to three.

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The tepanyaki experience was amazing. The chef was very fun, really could tell he was enjoying cooking. The wait staff were very friendly and professional ! Also the food was very delicious, the price was worth it, didnâ€™t feel excessive at all. I was busy watching the show so couldnâ€™t film a lot.. definitely advise people to come and watch it yourself! (And eat)ğŸ˜‚ Thanks!

business_address: House- 58/B, Rd 131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Cozy environment friendly staff and good food . We went for dinner with a few friends every one enjoyed the food especially the live cooking of the food by the chef great experience you can tell by the way the chef was cooking that he takes pride in making the food . Happy chef equals to great tasting food . I highly recommend the hibachi beef it was tender and juicy overall everything we had was amazingly delicious.

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Most of the food tasted good. But the price is quite expensive. Cream of mushroom & chicken is recommended.

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good restaurant for Italian food. Their Mushroom steak, pizza and lasagna are very good. The decoration is classic jazz style with ambient lighting. The staff are very well mannered and friendly. It's one of my and my wife's favorite places for date night. We love it.

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the oldest renowned Italian restaurants at the city center. However, they havenâ€™t put in much effort over the years to keep up the standard in terms of food, service or ambiance. The entrance got a renovation, which is a complete mismatch with the main part of the restaurant. The music was bad/inaudible. We could only hear other guests talking. The food was quite good though. Grilled squid: 9.5/10 Garlic bread with cheese (they served it with butter though): 7.5/10 Mushroom steak: 9/10 Mediterranean spaghetti: 8/10 Tagliatelle alla Alfredo: 9/10

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Steak, pizza and of course, the sinful lasagna, these are my favorite from Spaghetti Jazz. Love their serving and the quantity is also huge. Love the taste of the food. A little heavier for the wallet though, but I think it's worth it. I recently had the opportunity to visit this restaurant again. And the quality of the food has just gone better. This restaurant is still one of my favorites in Dhaka.

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The ambiance makes this place worthwhile. There are not many options where you can take your wife when you two want a quiet candle light dinner, where the place isn't buzzing with laughters of youths (nothing wrong with young people laughing, just on certain nights maybe we want a subtle ambiance ğŸ˜…) But the big TV with IPL kills the vibe of jazz and candles. Also, when it's a fine dining experience and you are spending almost 2-3k per person, you may want your food to be memorable too. Food was barely okay for my taste bud. I loved the behaviour of the staff, the ambiance and the rich history of the place. But the experience wasn't spectacular compared to the expense. I really wish we had some better options for a couple fine dining in Dhaka with good ambience. Sigh!

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Went there after almost 2 years. This is a very dear place to my heart as it has some nostalgic value! Was pleased to find the place as beautiful, calm and serene as yesteryears. The jazz theme interior is there though they donâ€™t play any jazz (never did as much as I can recall)! There service is as impeccable as it used to be. Waiters donâ€™t hang around much or act obsequiously. And the steak is still, to me and my friends, best in the city. Also the steak meal price is still on the lower side compared to other new steak places which will just rip your pocket apart. Old place keeping their business intact and thriving is something I value quite a lot. Itâ€™s a testament to their lasting quality. They have an elaborate menu with spaghettis and pizzas but to me they are the go to place for steaks in Dhaka. Cheers for Spaghetti Jazz & good luck!

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Spaghetti Jazz has lasted the test of time. Love the posters as they are a reminder of the past. They were part of the decor at SJ in their old building. Price is high but food is good. Atmosphere is the best

business_address: Rob Bhaban. Plot 3 ( 4th floor) , Gulshan circle II, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice place but the entrance is little bit difficult to find. You can enjoy very nice pasta here. In addition, though I haven't tried yet, they serve nice steaks as well. There were full of placard of JAZZ musicians on the walls, but the BGM was not JAZZ musics when I visited.

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: To start off, the papad is incredibly addictive. Their kababs are amazing! The mutton sheek is one of my absolute favorites. The mutton rogan josh (pictured) is very good as well, along with the chicken tikka masala. Loved their laccha paratha (pictured) and their aloo paratha. Their sweet lassi is an absolute must have!

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited this place and had a truly satisfying experience, especially if you're someone who enjoys Indian cuisine. Itâ€™s a great spot for a wide variety of Indian food items, and I was quite impressed with both the taste and the quality of the dishes. Among the items I tried, the Mutton Rogan Josh stood out with its rich flavor and perfectly cooked meat. The gravy was well-balanced, aromatic, and full of traditional spices that made it a delight to savor. I also had their Keema Paratha, which was another highlight. The paratha was crispy on the outside and stuffed generously with flavorful minced meat. It paired wonderfully with the side chutneys they provided. Additionally, I tried the Aloo Paratha, which was soft, well-spiced, and comfortingâ€”perfect for a light yet satisfying bite. One dish that I highly recommend is their Handi Chicken. The chicken was incredibly tender, juicy, and cooked just right. The spices were well-blended and not overpowering, which made the dish even more enjoyable. Their kulfi is the best of them all. The staff here deserve a special mention. They were courteous, attentive, and very cooperative throughout the meal. Their pleasant behavior added to the overall experience, making it not just about the food but also about excellent hospitality. I will definitely be visiting again! Let me know if you'd like it formatted as a review for Google, TripAdvisor, or any other platform. The environment was also very nice to have a pleasant meal.

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Had dinner, we ordered butter Naan and garlic naan, paneer butter masala, navratna vegetable and beef pasinda kebab. Firstly food took a good 45-50 mins to arrive. Naan were overlooked and burnt. Infact it lacked body and taste as well, so a definite disappointment. It is the very vehicle of food delivery for the entrees so this being poor, was quite a let down. The beef pasinda was good, but that was it, just good, nothing more or less. Paneer butter masala was disappointing, lacked seasoning and depth. The navratna vegetable was decent. Wait staff was polite and prompt, food took long to arrive which probably was not their fault. They also changed the naam immediately after I complained about it being burnt to a crisp. A lot to improve on food taste though, or maybe it was just a bad day for them, coz I always heard good things.

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Tasty food, fresh and authentic. We had a private room booked for a meeting/dinner, just didn't feel very private most of the time, so something for improvement in the future. Food, drinks and desserts, were all delicious.

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The dining experience was consistently poor, with several issues that significantly impacted the quality of the food. The service was subpar, and we received only one of the three Nun dishes we ordered after finishing our main course. The remaining dishes were also of poor quality, lacking flavor and being excessively priced. This was the most disappointing dining experience I have ever had.

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice experience to having dinner with family. Amazing place with a beautiful interior design. There is nothing to say about this place. I just recommend all of you who are trying to taste indian foods and want to connect with Indian tradition, which makes you feel mesmerised.

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: A great place for Indian food lovers. Indian cuisine is my favourite. And this place satisfied me very much. Loved their alu paratha, chicken tanduri kabab and dal makhni. Beef pasinda kabab is good too if you like spicy food. Kulfi was not that great. Good place for family and group hangouts. Quite spacious and enjoyable for a long duration.

business_address: Block- B, House-35 Rd No 18, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Most Bangladeshi restaurants fail miserably to create at least acceptable North Indian and Paki legit Mughal Kebabs however Lucknow does as good a job as possible this far south. Hope they can maintain quality as the price is fine for the food.

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food test is good, limited items but test is good. Small space but good atmosphere. Over all Good

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I really like every service here, their behavior is very good. The food they prepare is very tasty.

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I visited The Atrium Restaurant about 2 months ago for my cousinâ€™s wedding ceremony, and it was a wonderful experience! ğŸ’ The place is spacious, beautifully decorated, and perfect for family events. The food was delicious, and the staff were polite and well-organized. The garden view and lighting made the evening even more special. Highly recommended for weddings and celebrations! ğŸŠ

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Atmosphere: Entrance as well as the interior was quite nice. Interior lighting felt like a bit dull but it's acceptable. It is an exclusive/expensive restaurant. So it's interior should be a bit dark, right? Right? ğŸ˜‰ Service: They are very responsive and well behaved. Even did not take much time to serve the food. Food: I took French Fries as an appetizer and Pad Thai as the main. Both were 1:3. Considering price, for Pad Thai, the amount was okay but French Fries seemed quite overpriced. I tried Pad Thai in a number of places and considering the authentic taste of Pad Thai, this one is not up to the mark.

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A well decorated, spacious and nice environment restaurant with outdoor sitting facilities. Here on can arrange various parties like get-together, marriage anniversary, birthday party and even corporate party.On e can enjoy Thai cuisine, Indian cuisine, Chinese cuisine etc, also Buffet facilities. Food taste is good but price is little bit high. Staff service is as usual good.

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Atrium Chinese Restaurant offers a decent dining experience with a good balance of cost and quality. For a group of 17 celebrating a birthday, we found the total expenditure of around 16,500/- quite reasonable, considering the variety of items we ordered. The value for money is commendable, especially given the extensive menu options. The ambience is satisfactory, providing a comfortable setting for dining, though it isn't particularly remarkable. It serves well enough for casual gatherings and is an okay spot for photography, with adequate lighting and decor that can add a pleasant backdrop to your photos. Overall, Atrium Chinese Restaurant is a solid choice for group outings and celebrations, offering good value for the price with a satisfactory dining environment.

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The Atrium resturent is most wonderful place in Baridhara Dhaka.This is too much popular and renowned resturent buffet in Dhaka.i have also experince their thai soup.it is too much tasty and highly proccess cheep rated soup.And their decoration is just amazing.

business_address: 50 & 52, Pragati Avenue, J Block, Baridhara, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The lawn is very beautiful.good place to take good pictures.behavior of the staffs is good.i think the price is high.food quality is good.some items taste good,some don't. In the buffet the food items is not many. They should add more items in terms of the price they are charging. the inside decorations is good.

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: They have the best view in Mirpur. The waiters were very friendly, when I went there, the owner who's a nice lady, took my order. They have good collection of drinks coffee and smoothies. I took away a club sandwich, the taste was good and they put fries as well

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: I really liked their coffee. The chowmein was good too. Was surprised to see there was nobody except for us. The staff was quite well behaved as well. They also have a very friendly cat named Choco.

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Finally a pretty dine in restaurant in mirpur dohs shopping complex.ğŸ˜Š As I was recommended , i took chicken ala keiv which was 449 tk most probably and chicken steak costed around 400 both tasted amazingğŸ¥°.little burned garlic on the top of chicken steak gave a beautiful flavor to the food. Mashed potato as a side dish was perfect.ğŸ‘Œ Ordered lemon mint which was quite delicious and refreshing.â¤ That brownie and ice cream didn't appeal to me much because that brownie was very dry.ğŸ¥º Otherwise had a good dinner there. Service is great ğŸ‘

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: excellent decor and cosy ambience, Habit Lounge is the perfect place to chill out over good food and music. Cream of chicken soup, oriental platter and cashew nut salad are some of their best dishes

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: I had a relaxing adda with my friend there. The food tasted excellent while we were enjoying the cozy ambiance. We tasted selective dishes recommended by the chef of Habit Lounge. They had a varied selection of coffee and dessert, but we could make it due to time limitations. The price range is just a bit high but not excessive. I shall recommend all food explorers to have a visit here for quality time with delicious offerings.

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: The interior is very nice. Food was delicious. We tried Pizza & Thai Soup and also Chicken wings. Our two years toddler really like the soup! Pizza was also very tasty. A very recommended place for the people living inside Mirpur DOHS. Hope to visit frequently.

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: It's a gorgeous place with great coffee in Mirpur. While entering the cafe, the aroma will tell you "yes, you have come to the right place ". The place is comfortable too. You can comfortably pass your time while enjoying one of the best coffees. The staffs were well behaved. Definitely a place worthy of your time and money.

business_address: Level 7, Shop 15,16,18,19, Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: I went there for the first time, I had burger at first after that I order chicken steak rice. Burger was too delicious, it came with fries but the is too different. I got to know that they imported the fries which was too good. Now about the chicken steak it was mouthwatering also vegetables was cooked perfectly. I recommend everyone if you visit Mirpur DOHS you guys need to check the place out. It will worth your time & money. PS couldnâ€™t take the picture of burger.

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was really good, especially the kebabs, their service was also good. The staffs are fast, they served our food in a short time. The atmosphere was cozy, warm and friendly. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant if you are going to hang your family or friends.

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Beautiful place, nice atmosphere, great food, good price! We ordered Royal Bengal Khichuri Thali for one person, it was 750 taka! The platter consisted so many items that we could order another bowl of khichuri to eat with those item! The extra bowl took 230 taka! One platter is enough for two person except the khuchuri, thatâ€™s why we ordered only extra khichuri! Every item was tasty! The smell of the khichuri was so good! And the behaviour of the stuffs were great too! We went there at around 4:30 and the place was pretty empty!

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: quite good for bhat lovers. loved the bhorta bhajis there. specially the palong chingri is really good. their coral fish is also good to eat. besides, there is a very good khichuri platter in here. the platter has outstanding range of food items. specially, if there are more than 4-5 members in a group, this platter would really be a great choice. service should be a bit faster. I found it a bit difficult to order evening items here. Options for evening snacks are very few and very costly as well.

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Hello Dhaka is situated at Gulshan 1. It's not on the main road. It's on the sub road but near to Gulshan Circle 1. Multiple businesses at the same building. Parking is available for 2 to 3 cars. Avoid your private car if you are planning for this restaurant. They serve bangla food items. We took plain rice, alu bhorta, chicken bhuna, mejbani beaf, prawn. Food testes good. The tea at the end of the lunch feels good. The restaurant is expensive. Guests were few. Most of the tables were empty during lunch. But foods are good enough.

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good for desi food lovers. bhorta bhaji, daal also available there. specially the coconut chingri is really good. khichuri platter also here. Which was very tasty the platter has outstanding range of food items. for family or group of 4-5 persons this platter would really be a great choice. Price is little bit high.

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I have heard a lot about their Nihari/ Paya. Went to explore during Iftar time. But the Paya has finished already. So I have ordered their kebab platter, beef Halim followed by lime mint juice. Food tastes good. The milk tea was satisfactory. The price is not affordable for all. Service is very much appreciated.

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We have tried the Kabab platter which tests really yammy. Kabab was soft and well cooked. The big platter was good for 4 people. But 4 parata comes with it is not enough. Service is not great. It seems running under staff who can't catter efficiently.

business_address: 60/D Road:131, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice place to dine in with friend and family. We have ordered Reshmi Kabab, Chicken Cheese Kabab, Chicken Butter Masala and Paratha. Chicken Cheese Kabab is mainly some cheese over Reshmi Kabab. And chef couldn't prepare the Chicken Butter Masala...instead it became Chicken milk like item...They have provided complimentary small portion of Jira Pani and Papad...which were great in taste and definitely added some value. Overall nice experience..except the taste of Chicken milk like item. Their staffs are very friendly and service was good...Will go back again...

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The main attraction is the ambience. There are 2 swimming pools. Restaurant has both indoor and outdoor options. Staff hospitality was very good. Co-operative. They offered halloween special food items and also decorated the whole restaurant. They have live bbq and some other food items to serve fresh. Price was reasonable. They also organized live music.

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good buffet BBQ experience. The negative side would be, less selection of bread, soup, no cold cut beef, salami or selection of cheese and salads. Also few items to choose from for desert. Multiple items on the buffet is a Standard for Five star hotel Restaurants around the world! Though the BBQ was good, I would not rate it as a 5 star buffet experience. Rather a 3 star experience. The manager was very polite and made the necessary adjustments for us, though it was full booked. Please make a reservation in advance or come late after 8 pm or 8:30 pm. When it is less crowdy. They made arrangements for us to pay proportionately as per the on going offer. Overall it was a good experience.

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I had the pleasure of dining at this exquisite establishment and was thoroughly impressed. The culinary offerings were nothing short of exceptional, with each dish being a delightful indulgence. We were fortunate to benefit from a Buy One, Get One Free promotion, making the buffet an incredible value at 1750/-, inclusive of water and a refreshing cold beverage. To further enhance the experience, complimentary access to the swimming pool was provided, offering both enjoyment and a perfect way to rejuvenate while burning off a few indulgent calories. I eagerly anticipate my next visit!

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We had their buffet on 31st of December 2019 at their Sky Pool Restaurant. They had excellent staff who arranged the seats for us. They we kind and helpful. There was live music due to the new year celebrations. Their food was really good and they have one of the best collection of meat dishes (beef steak, lamb roast, chicken, beef ribs, etc.) compared to the other top rated buffets in Dhaka. Their price was super reasonable at the time of this review. The Live station was quick and had variety of dishes from sea food to kebabs. Really enjoyed the experience.

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The ambience is superb! The restaurant is located on the rooftop with an open terrace and a pool. The food is great. They serve a superb buffet spread including seafood and the likes. The staff is awesome. Mehedi leads with a team consisting of Mohsin, Pavel, Chef Lalon, Chef Sony, Chef Bhowmick, Chef Rajib. They do an awesome smack on job at suggesting what to eat and are a lovely set of hosts. The dining experience is wonderful with fresh crabs and prawns and a variety of options. The mutton nihari soup was superb. The scenery from the restaurant is awesome and you get to see the Indian, US and Canada embassies from the rooftop. The live grill is active. Live music is played every Thursday and Friday. The overall experience is superb thanks to the people mentioned above.

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Buffet were average. Didn't like stake, it was sure dry. I liked chilli crab the most. Fried rice and pulao was good too. If you look for cozy place for hangout with friends and eat. You should go.

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: It was wonderful trip. I was feel like home. Staff are so friendly and cooperate. The Sky Pool Restaurant which is my favorite restaurant, food was so yummy and delicious. The Service staff Mr. Mustafa and Mr. Nazmul friendly and professional. Thanks Six Seasons for great experience!

business_address: Six Seasons Hotel, 15th floor (rooftop, House 19 Rd 96, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: With a lot of expectations i go there. So here are my thoughts. First part: The Environment It wasn't a very big place. I wanted to have a poolside dinner but there was no sitting arrangements, so i ask them about that and they set a table for two . Thanks for that, though there wasn't enough lights. So overall i would give it a 4/10 nb: there was a under construction part beside our table. Second part : The Food journey Ok there is a reason i called it a journey because i took the Buffet dinner offer. Lets start. We stared with soup . Then sushi,sandwich and salad. The worst part was everything was cold as f. It was really disappointing. Then we tried the bbq section. From there i only like the prawn. Chicken bbq was horrible and beef stake was..... i forgot how it was. After i only tasted boiled fish, grilled chicken, lamd,beef stu, vegetable biriany, and i dont like any of it From the vey beginning i was hoping for a desert ride and it didn't go well. It was beautiful from outside. Thats it about food . I will give it a 2/10 because of the prawn and the bottled mineral water. Third part: The PRICE The dinner buffet was 3500bdt net per person. I wouldn't mind if had one portion of satisfaction from the food . But i would recommend to spend the money in other places. 2/10 Overall rating from my experience 3/10 See for yourself

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently dined at Goong, a Korean spot in Gulshan. The food was outstandingâ€”tempura was crispy and light, the beef was tender and bursting with flavor, the shrimp was perfectly cooked, the rice was fluffy, and the morning glory was a fresh, vibrant side. Portions were massive, easily enough to share, and everything was plated beautifully. But the servic was a letdown. The waiters lacked any warmth or friendliness. However, the overall experience was good for an authentic korean experience. I would highly recommend.

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I am a big fan of Korean Cuisine. I"Iâ€™ve tried Korean food all over the world, but this place really stands out. The quality of ingredients in every dish is top-notch, and the culinary techniques used in both preparation and presentation are highly impressive. The flavors were delightful and well-balanced. Service was excellentâ€”the waitstaff was attentive and always on top of things. In my opinion, the quality and value are well worth it. My only regret was not being able to purchase some kimchi to go. Although they have an extended menu, this item isnâ€™t available for takeaway. Overall, it's a restaurant with a good ambiance, and itâ€™s a great place to experience authentic Korean cuisine. Highly recommended!"

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Goong The Castle is a very nice Chinese restaurant to eat at. The food is incredible! They have a wide variety from fresh seafood to meats and it is really delicious. The service is excellent and they even gave us food on the house! The atmosphere is nice and feels like an authentic Korean place.

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This is a great place to try out some authentic Korean cuisine. The ambiance is nice and they have options for separate rooms for large groups, as well as normal dining space. Their menu is quite vast and as this place tends to attract a lot of foreigners, they ensure that the products are cooked in authentic fashion and presented accordingly. The service is quite good, very responsive. I asked if they could give me a poached egg separately (as it was not on the menu), but they said it was not possible, however, later they gave us some egg soufflÃ©s, and that too on the house! This seemed like a really good gesture from the staff. The food was well prepared, clean, and presented well, and most importantly, tasted delicious. Their duck was especially good, wouldn't mind having that again and again. Overall, I would definitely recommend giving this place a try.

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I will give them 11 out of 10. Their service was excellent. Everything was great

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: What a lifetime experience with Korean cuisine. Such an amazing food experience I have ever had. Food is so tasty and yummy. If you really taste the authentic Korean food at Dhaka try this. Thnx team goong.

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nestled in the heart of Gulshan, Goong The Castle is an elegant Korean dining experience that transports you to a different world the moment you step in. The restaurant's ambience is a blend of traditional Korean aesthetics and modern luxury, making it an ideal spot for both casual dining and special occasions. The decor at Goong The Castle is truly a feast for the eyes. The restaurant is designed to resemble a traditional Korean castle, with intricate woodwork, soft lighting, and tasteful artwork adorning the walls. The seating is comfortable, with both private dining areas and communal tables, making it suitable for intimate dinners or larger gatherings. The menu at Goong The Castle is extensive, offering a wide variety of authentic Korean dishes. The highlight is undoubtedly the barbecue, where diners can grill their own meats at the table. The quality of the ingredients is top-notch, with the beef and pork being particularly tender and flavorful. The side dishes (banchan) are plentiful and varied, providing a perfect complement to the main dishes. The kimchi, a staple of Korean cuisine, is well-prepared and has the right balance of spice and tanginess. For those less inclined towards barbecue, the menu also offers a range of other traditional dishes such as bibimbap, japchae, and various stews. The seafood pancake (haemul pajeon) is crispy and generously filled with fresh seafood, while the spicy tofu stew (soondubu jjigae) is comforting and rich in flavor. The service at Goong The Castle is attentive and polite, with staff members eager to explain the menu and offer recommendations. They are quick to respond to requests and ensure that the dining experience is smooth and enjoyable. However, during peak hours, the service can be slightly slower due to the high volume of diner. Goong The Castle is on the pricier side, especially compared to other dining options in Gulshan. However, considering the quality of the food, the unique dining experience, and the elegant setting, it offers good value for money. It's a place where you go not just to eat, but to savor a culinary journey. Goong The Castle is a must-visit for anyone in Dhaka looking to experience authentic Korean cuisine in a luxurious setting. Whether you're a fan of Korean food or just looking for a unique dining experience, this restaurant is sure to impress. Despite the slightly higher prices, the overall experience is well worth it.

business_address: House no: 88, House no: 88, 12/B Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I had a good experience there. The food was delicious and fresh, especially the sushi, kimbap, and beef bulgogi. The service was excellent, with a complimentary starter and dessert. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Korean cuisine.

business_address: QCW7+79W, House-10, Road-53, Gulshan Circle-2, Top of Weavers Level-6 Dhaka, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Itâ€™s a family kind restaurant located near to the Gulshan - 2 circle. As far I know that itâ€™s one of the oldest restaurants that serve mainly Turkey style foods. The place is in the medium range. Reservation is not mandatory but you can call them for reservation. The taste of the food is not bad but also not too delicious. The food is good until itâ€™s hot. If the food gets cold, it doesn't taste good anymore. The pizza was too tasty for us, I'll recommend these items. The behavior of the staff is also good. Here, cash & card both payment systems are acceptable. No wheelchair accessibility facilities are presented here.

business_address: QCW7+79W, House-10, Road-53, Gulshan Circle-2, Top of Weavers Level-6 Dhaka, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: If you're craving authentic Turkish flavors in the heart of Dhaka, Istanbul Restaurant is a fantastic choice. The cozy ambiance, attentive staff, and traditional Turkish dÃ©cor create a welcoming environment that complements the dining experience. The food is undoubtedly the star of the show. Their mixed grill platter is packed with flavorâ€”succulent, well-seasoned meats that truly reflect Turkish culinary excellence. The lavash bread is soft and fresh, the hummus rich and creamy, and the baklava offers a perfectly sweet finish. One area for improvement, however, is the pricing. While the food quality is high, the menu is on the pricier side compared to similar restaurants in the city. That said, the overall experience makes it worth it if you're looking for an occasional treat or special night out. Highly recommended for lovers of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean cuisine who donâ€™t mind spending a bit extra for quality.

review_text: Wanted to try Turkish food in the city. After a quick search and review check went to this place. Was a bit hard to find. Didn't know it was in the same building as the bittersweet. business_address: house 48, Rd 52, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Restaurantâ€™s Name: Dhaka Metro Its a pretty popular restaurant in Banani mainly among youngsters. I tried their food several times & today i am going to share my personal verdict regarding some of their items which i tried recently. Dhela Kichuri/Letka Khichuri with Beef- 399tk Tasted superb & it had achari flavor in it. This is one of their best seller. The meat was flavorful & tender but i feel the quantity doesnâ€™t do justice to the amount paid. Chotpoti- 130tk This was pretty average or basic. If you are extremely craving for chotpoti while visiting this place, you might give it a go. Chicken Keema Moghlai Porota- 220tk This was again good but the price was way too high. Chicken Chap with 2 Luchi- 395tk This was another hit item & the portion of the chicken was satisfactory. Their chap is one of the best one i had. The luchis were light & went perfectly. However the price is high sadly. Luchi & Aloor dom- 210tk The alur dom had an achari flavor to it & tasted yum but the 1st day i went, they served microscopic amount of potatoes. The next day upon requesting they served comparatively more. The taste was good but i request them to serve more potatoes as its called alur dom not jhol dom. Jilapi with rabri (Large)- 299tk We all loved this jilapi. It was not too sweet, was very crispy & had the aroma of ghee in it. Masala Tea- 110tk The 1st time i were there, i ordered ghee bakorkhani with it which you need to pay extra but it totally lacked the ghee flavor even though this tea was pretty good. I recommend the tea but not the bakorkhani since its just a basic one. Prices are excluding 5% VAT

review_text: Dhaka Metro Restaurant is a great spot for anyone looking to enjoy quality food in a clean and comfortable setting. Located in a convenient part of the city, itâ€™s ideal for both casual hangouts and family meals. The restaurant has a modern and cozy ambiance that immediately feels welcoming. The seating is spacious, and the environment is perfect for relaxing and enjoying your time. The food is one of the main highlights. I tried their grilled chicken and beef burger â€” both were delicious and well-cooked. The ingredients tasted fresh, and the spice levels were just right. Their fried rice and Thai soup also come highly recommended by other diners.Service was excellent. The staff was friendly, attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed without being overbearing. Food was served quickly and looked just as good as it tasted. Prices are reasonable and match the quality and portion size. Itâ€™s a great value overall, especially considering the good service and clean environment. The restaurant also offers takeaway and home delivery, which adds to its convenience. With easy parking and a central location, Dhaka Metro Restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
