review_text: I recently had lunch at Thai Emerald in Gulshan, and it was a great experience. First off, the free parking made things super convenient, which is always a plus in Dhaka. The food was the real highlight. Their Thai fried rice was flavorful and perfectly cookedâ€”light but still filling. The whole snapper was outstanding, fresh and cooked just right with bold flavors that stood out. I also really enjoyed the fish cakesâ€”crispy on the outside, soft inside, and packed with that authentic Thai taste. To wrap it up, the mango sticky rice was the perfect ending: sweet, creamy, and refreshing. The atmosphere was nice and relaxed, and the service was friendly without being over the top. If youâ€™re looking for good Thai food in Gulshan, Thai Emerald is definitely worth a visit.

Service and ambience are top notch but the price is a bit premium. Finally their coconut ice cream is a must try item. Overall a good experience.

review_text: Their Tom Yum Goong soup is delicious, as is the chicken skewers, and the ice cream is a great dessert. Their noodles and fried rice are generously portioned and perfect for sharing.

review_text: A great option for when you want something different from the typical faux chinese eateries. The food is pricey but not extravagantly soâ€”you can get wrap up dinner fully within 1.5k per personâ€”and the portions weren't small. Above all the food was excellent. Would definitely go again.

review_text: The food was really good but I was upset a lot bcz that day I caught someone unexpectedly there which was unfortunate for me anyway- jokes a part. About the restaurant food quality and atmosphere everything was good.

business_address: 1212, 4/B Road No. 2, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Went for their raving reviews.. Ordered their Fried Wonthon(8/10), Chicken Corn Soup (10/10), Chicken Cashewnut Salad(6.5/10), Chicken Fried Rice(7/10), Spring Fried Chicken(6.5/10) and Coconut Ice Cream (9/10)ğŸ§ Had a very basic menu at a Thai place having family at hand. Each of their items are at a proportion for 3 people except the coconut ice cream Starting with their Fried Wonthon rating it a solid 8/10.. They were crispy and perfectly fried..though would've liked a bit more filling as the filling wasn't even noticeable in taste. Paired along the Chicken Corn Soup..Would give it a 10/10... This is the best corn soup I've had in a while..The broth was thick, filled with chicken and egg and had a buttery creamy texture to it..The smell of butter escalated the taste so much better Then tried only two main courses and a salad as we were full already... Chicken Fried Rice paired with Spring Fried chicken..and chicken cashewnut salad on the side. Would rate the chicken fried rice a 7/10 ... The fried rice was however very average tasting. The big slices of chicken in the rice were however bland tasting.. didn't pair well with the rice...their fried rice needs quite an improvement... Their spring fried chicken also felt quite bland to me inside..it felt not well marinated and not juicy inside..Rating this a 6.5/10 and the coating while being crispy.. didn't add much to the taste. Together the rice and spring fried chicken paired better together... I would give the cashewnut salad a 5/10 as well ... It was too saucy and too tangy for our taste...not the traditional cashewnut salad we love...we had to pick and eat the chicken pieces and the nuts were too sour to eat...Even though I like a cashewnut salad saucy/dry..they went overboard with the sauce..so much so it felt more like almost a curry rather than a salad. Their coconut ice cream garnished with peanuts and a layer of sticky rice beneath is a solid 9/10. Loved it...It was refreshing like the waves of the sea... Even though I've heard people complaining about their proportions,I found the portions quite commendable and more than adequate for 3 people having a 2-3 course meal... I'd say 4 people could easily share their 1:3 portions. Would've loved if the staff were more welcoming. Wanted to strike up by praising on their proportion but instead received an underwhelming smileğŸ˜… There behavior was however friendly..but could've been more warm. Looking forward to going again someday and ordering other authentic Thai dishes for a better food experience â¤ï¸

We had to repeatedly ask for basic things, and even then, he forgot to bring us tissues. It felt like we were mostly left to manage on our own. Overall: The food had some highlights, but the service and value didnâ€™t match the price point. I expected better.

review_text: Nawab Chatga in Banani is a paradise for beef lovers! They serve some of the finest Bengali beef dishes, including their standout Beef Kala Bhuna, perfectly spiced and incredibly tender. Their Mejban and Chana Dal Gosht are equally exceptional, with rich flavors that capture the essence of authentic Chittagonian cuisine. The Loitta Fry and Shutki were also marvelousâ€”crispy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection, these dishes brought out the best of traditional Bengali coastal flavors. Overall, Nawab Chatga nails it with their authentic, flavorful offerings. A must-visit for anyone craving bold and delicious Bengali dishes! Highly recommended!

business_address: QCGG+XMR à¦¨à¦¾à¦­à¦¾à¦¨à¦¾ à¦Ÿà¦¾à¦“à§Ÿà¦¾à¦°, Gulshan-1 Dhaka 1212 Bangladesh ( behind, 45 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: My experience at this Bengali restaurant was really poor but I loved it! The food was delicious and tasted absolutely homemade - the Mejbanu beef was amazing. The atmosphere was comfortable and clean, and the staff were very friendly and attentive. Everything from the service to the presentation was top notch. This is definitely one of the best places to enjoy authentic Bengali food. Highly recommended! Food: 4/5 | Service: 5/5 | Ambience: 5/5

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Alfresco Banani I have been visiting Alfresco since 2015 with friends and family and consider myself a regular customer across all branches. On average, I dine here around three times a month. My previous visit was on September 18, 2025. Today, I visited the Banani branch again with my friends. As usual, I ordered pasta BBQ, French fries, blueberry cheesecake, tiramisu, chocolate cake, and mint lemonade. However, I was quite disappointed to notice a significant price increase compared to last month. The pasta is now priced at 450 BDT + VAT, but the quantity particularly for the chicken and mushroom has noticeably decreased. The portion of French fries was very minimal, yet priced at 220 BDT + VAT, which felt unreasonable. Overall, the experience was quite dissatisfying. On a positive note, the blueberry cheesecake and tiramisu were delightful and maintained their usual quality. However, despite being a loyal customer for many years, I am disappointed with the recent changes. At such high prices, I no longer find the pasta and French fries to be worth ordering. Alfresco has always been my first choice for pasta, but after todayâ€™s experience, I feel let down. While price increases are understandable, the quality and quantity should be maintained or even improved to ensure a fair dining experience for regular customers.

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We ordered lasagna, double layered cheese cake, pineapple juice, malta juice and blue ocean.... lasagna was pretty mid not gonna lie. Was expecting more ğŸ™‚. Cheese cake was good. â¤ï¸ğŸ–¤ The juices were really good. â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ blue ocean drinks was average.. ğŸ’” overall nice atmosphere and cozy place for adda and affordable too..

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: This place is on the 10th floor of that building. You have to go to lift, press 9 and than you have to go up 1 floor by stair after reaching 9th floor. Very good environment. They have indoor and outdoor seating option. Staffs are friendly and co-operative. Seatings were very comfortable. At frirst we have ordered Sea food pizza L size and calamary. Pizza was 899tk and calamary was 320tk. The taste is very nice, fresh and yummy . Provided enough amount of food. After that we have orderd Pasta Bolognese and sea food pasta. These 2 pastas are only pan fry. Others are oven backed. So we also odered oven backed pasta alfrasco and pasta zingly. Price range 400-500tk. I have loved sea food pasta and pasta bolognese. Both were very refreshing, spicy. Overall taste was amazing. Amount is very enough for one person. The Mint lemonade is also good. Thank you. Hopefully visit again.

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Best food in this price range. Pasta Basta and Pasta BBQ both were excellent. Double layer cheesecake and Tiramisu were also delicious. Good interior, simplistic. It started raining when we were there, and it made the rooftop environment more enjoyable. The staff are also well mannered.

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Their rooftop is great! The night skyline and cityscape is so picturesque and a treat for eyes. I frequently visit here. A perfect place for gathering with family n friends. You also can take your date or, you can have your solo date there! Must try their seafood items.

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I was looking for a good affordable place to have lunch with my colleagues. And this is just the perfect one. The environment was very good with a great rooftop arrangement. I preferred indoors as it was hot outside. But I think it would be a nice place if you are planning to visit at night. The food they offered was great according to the price. The staff were well mannered.

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We had bbq chicken pizza and pasta basta. Pizza was really good. 7/10 Pasta was average. 5/10 But the rooftop view was really amazing. They also have place to sit inside.

business_address: 11 level 9 84, Skylark Building, plot no Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Excellent environment to dine in. They also have outdoor seating arrangements. Food quality is very good. Price is quite good also. Behavior of the employees are friendly. They don't take much time to serve the foods after ordering. They have some set menu which is good for two people. The restroom was clean. Overall good experience.

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Herfy Bangladesh (Gulshan branch) is a fantastic spot for anyone who loves delicious fast food served in a clean and welcoming environment. The food here is very tasty â€” from juicy burgers and crispy fried chicken to fresh fries and sides, everything is prepared with great attention to flavor and quality. The restaurant maintains excellent cleanliness, with tidy tables, a neat dining area, and staff constantly ensuring that everything looks spotless and well-kept. During my visit, there was a small issue with my order, but what impressed me most was how quickly and professionally the staff handled it. The manager personally came over, listened carefully, and made sure the problem was resolved right away. His polite and respectful attitude made the experience even better. Itâ€™s rare to see such genuine care for customer satisfaction. The service overall was fast, friendly, and efficient. The atmosphere is pleasant, making it a nice place for families, friends, or even solo diners to relax and enjoy a meal. Whether youâ€™re dining in or grabbing takeout, the quality remains consistent. Herfy Gulshan is a great choice for both taste and service â€” Iâ€™ll definitely be returning soon and highly recommend it to others!

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Herfy Bangladesh in Gulshan 1, Dhaka is a great spot for a quick and tasty fast-food meal. The restaurant offers a wide variety of burgers, fries, wings, and combo meals, all freshly prepared and flavorful. Itâ€™s a perfect place to grab a quick bite whether youâ€™re on a lunch break or hanging out with friends. The service is fast and efficient, and the staff are friendly and welcoming. The ambience is clean and casual, making it comfortable for dine-in, though many prefer takeout. Prices are reasonable, and portion sizes are satisfying. They accept cash and card payments, and VAT bills are provided. Overall, a reliable choice for good fast food in Gulshan.

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We tried the Family meal at Harfy Gulshan and also had their burgerâ€”it was so good, we had to record it! The portions were generous, the chicken was juicy, the fries crispy, and the burger was definitely a highlight. Great taste, quick service, and a clean, comfy spot. Perfect for a casual family hangout in Gulshan.

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Herfy in Gulshan, Dhaka, and overall, I had a pretty good experience. The location is easy to find, right in the heart of Gulshan, and the ambiance of the restaurant is clean, modern, and family-friendly. It has a fast-food vibe but with a little more polish compared to other chains. I tried their beef burger combo and chicken zinger meal. The portions were generous, and the burger had a juicy patty with fresh lettuce and a soft bun. The fries were crispy and well-seasoned. The fried chicken reminded me a bit of KFC but with its own twistâ€”definitely worth trying. One thing that stood out to me was their garlic mayo dipâ€”so tasty! Service was fairly quick, and the staff were polite, although not overly friendly. I think they could improve a little on customer interaction. Prices are slightly on the higher side, especially when compared to other local fast food chains, but I felt the quality made up for it. One small downside is the seating spaceâ€”it gets crowded during peak hours, and you might have to wait a bit. Still, itâ€™s a solid choice if youâ€™re looking for clean, halal fast food in a central location. Highly recommended for a casual bite!

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Herfy Bangladesh at Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, delivers the reliable Saudi fast-food experience. Expect consistently good, flame-grilled burgers, Broasted chicken and crispy fries. Service is generally efficient.While seating can get crowded during peak hours, it's a dependable spot for a quick, tasty meal when shopping. Good value for the quality.

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Herfy burger is always good. I found a bad service which the manager should address and take quick action. I requested for hand sanitizer, their staff gave me Suma Bac which actually used for cleaning surfaces not hand. Even he sprayed it on our hands saying its sanitizer.

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I really love their burgers and chicken fries also that soft ice cream, the coleslaw was average but that mango drink was not upto the mark. Overall a very good burger and chicken place.

business_address: Ground Floor, 1st Floor, 1 Gulshan Avenue, Road-1, House-1, GL Bhaban, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I visited Herfy Restaurant in Gulshan for the first time, and I had a great experience overall. The environment is very nice, and they even have a small kids' zone, which is a great touch for families. I ordered French Fries, Chicken Strips, Blueberry Fizz, and a Virgin Strawberry Mojito. Initially, I wanted to try their Premium Shakes, but unfortunately, they were unavailable, which was a bit disappointing. The Chicken Fries and mocktails were deliciousâ€”I really enjoyed them! The Chicken Strips were also good, crispy, and well-cooked, though I felt they lacked a bit of the extra seasoning or spice that KFC uses to enhance the flavor. However, they were still very enjoyable. The staff was friendly and well-behaved. Overall, I would recommend Herfy Restaurant to anyone looking for a nice place to eat in Gulshan!

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the most beautiful places in Bangladesh with average food. Staff are nice but would recommend going for an evening or sunset walk as the place is the most beautiful during this time. Small paddle boats are available to have a sail through the lake.

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Tribeni Restaurant, located inside Dhaka Cantonment, is a popular spot for those who enjoy a peaceful dining environment away from the cityâ€™s hustle and bustle. The restaurant is known for its clean surroundings, disciplined service, and homely atmosphere all of which reflect the overall organized nature of the cantonment area. The food at Tribeni is quite good, especially the local Bangladeshi dishes. Items like chicken curry, beef rezala, fried rice, and dal are freshly cooked and served hot. The taste is more like home style. Cooking is not overly spicy or oily, which many people appreciate. The prices are reasonable compared to the portion size and quality of food. One of the best things about Tribeni is its calm and family friendly environment. It is spacious, well-maintained, and the staff are polite and professional. Since it is inside the cantonment, access is restricted. Visitors might need permission to enter the cantonment. Overall, Tribeni is a great place if you are looking for a decent, quiet meal in a safe and clean setting. It is not overly fancy, but it delivers good food with good service. Perfect for family dinners, small gatherings, or even a peaceful lunch.

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Tribeni Restaurant, located in Dhaka, is a well-established dining destination recognized for its diverse menu, quality service, and comfortable ambiance. The restaurant caters to a wide range of customers, offering both traditional Bangladeshi cuisine and contemporary dishes, ensuring a versatile dining experience suitable for families, professionals, and social gatherings. The facility features a clean and organized layout with spacious seating, appropriate lighting, and attention to hygiene standards. The kitchen operations maintain consistent food quality, while staff are trained to provide professional, courteous, and efficient service, enhancing overall customer satisfaction. From an operational perspective, Tribeni Restaurant demonstrates effective management of order processing, table service, and customer engagement. Timely service, menu variety, and responsiveness to special requests reflect the restaurantâ€™s commitment to maintaining high operational standards and a positive dining experience. While peak hours can occasionally result in longer waiting times, the restaurantâ€™s consistent focus on quality, ambiance, and customer care ensures that patrons continue to return. Tribeni Restaurant remains a notable example of professional food service management in Dhaka, combining culinary quality, operational efficiency, and customer-oriented service.

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Very calm and peaceful place right by the lake. You can rent paddle boats and enjoy riding around until evening. The food menu isn't huge but the taste is really good. The area is quite spacious and the upper floor perfect for hosting parties, weddings or birthday celebrations.

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Not for all general people. You must belong from the defense or defense family. Ambience, location super but food and service average.

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: This is one of the places where we go to have some quality time. I love their food- their price is reasonable and quality is good. You don't have to worry about parking your car- they have plenty of spaces. You can enjoy a ride on the mini-lake during afternoon, take a walk beside the lake, hang around on their entrance while watching the lake and bridge, sit on a lakeside table to have some quality time. The first floor area is perfect for get-togethers. Loved their coffee, chocolate mousse, ice cream, kebab and nun. They offer a wide range of bakery and pastry items. Their washroom is small but clean.

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Recommended! AMBIENCE: Very blended in with the setting as the whole place is glass cladded. The water on which the restaurant is set is very soothing. Spacious. Ample seating arrangements. The surrounding is beautiful! FOOD: Pretty tasty. Though not a lot variation. Mostly kebab/ BBQ items. A little snacks and ice-cream corner too is available. PORTION SIZE: Moderate. PRICE: Very reasonable for the view and ambience it offers. Special feature: Boating option is available. **It's a pretty good option for hanging out but the only downside not all stuff were friendly/ helpful.**

business_address: R94R+PJQ, Near Nirjhor R/A Opposite Army Head Quarter, 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: The restaurant is located inside the Dhaka cantonment and near its central mosque. Very beautiful location and nice ambience. I had kabab platter, coffee, soft drink and icecream. Food was good though price is high. Service is good.

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Recently I have visited at Hakka Dhaka for lunch. Good environment but small. I always love their chinese items. A good place for family and good food. I tried 2 person meal deal. Platter B ( lunch/ dinner enough for 2) Fried Chicken Momo- 8/10 Dry Chilli Beef- 8.5/10 Szechuan Prawns- 8/10 Chicken with Mashrooms- 7.5/10 Hakka Noddles- 8/10 Egg Fried Rice- 8/10

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Hakka Dhaka is always my first option to dine in because of their varieties of platter. Recently, I visited Banani branch which is comparatively smaller than others. But as always their foods taste never disappointed me. Recommended if you want budget-friendly place to dine in with your colleagues, friends, families. We ordered their mega platter for 4 but for 6 persons, it was quite enough; which means the quantity was perfect! Hope to visit again, another time soon. One thing I can suggest to add more options in dessert besides kulfi.

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The food tasted very good and was worth the money. We took: 1.Garlic & Butter Prawn with Chili Peanut Noodles 2. Premium Lunch Box - Option 1 3. Mixed Hakka Noodles

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was quite good, not exceptionally good but pretty good. ambience is also good

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice environment, well behaved & fast serve. The look and smell from the "mixed fried rice" was amazing, the taste was really good. I was surprised by the "butter & garlic prawn" for it's uniqueness and awesome taste though the prawn could be little bit more less fried. Recommending for sure...!!

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Hakka Dhaka's food is so yummy! Specially the 'Hakka Noodles'. I have tested one of their lunch bowls and dumplings. It was one of the best dumplings. The interior and welcoming behavior of the staff is also appreciating. They provided colors and paper to draw in the waiting time for food. That's really fun!

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food was yummy, serving was fast. But the AC was not working properly. It was hot and the environment looked dull.

business_address: Navana Rowshan Sayed Plaza, House # 47, 4th Floor, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Hakka Dhaka, A very popular restaurant in Dhaka. It is located at Banani 11 road, around Aarong and Shwapno. Food quality is fine. Service is also good. The environment is well as well. The restaurant has few parking facilities inside the building. Air conditioning system was down when we visited in this summer. It was the only horrible thing!

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: This restaurant has a nice view of the City Club ground on one side and the main road along with the metro rail on the other. The entrance might be a little bit of search and find for some, I think. Inside, the restaurant is nice. Decent decor. It has a small corner for the kids. Seating arrangements include roadside, ground-side and the in-between. Point to remember, after the sun goes down, you will not be able to get the view of the ground as the ground is not lit and you will only see the reflection of the inside of the restaurant on the glass. I tried the Thai soup, Mexican pizza and pineapple juice. The soup could be better, as I found the pieces of chicken a little undercooked. The pizza was really good. Very fresh toppings. The juice was good too. Overall, it is a good place to hang around with friends and family members. I recommend this place.

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: I just had to wait for some delivery, that's why I went there to pass time. Ordered light snacks as I wasn't hungry. So, I got a club sandwich, which was 220tk probably and watermelon juice, 170tk. Vat will be added. Both juice and sandwiches were great. Service people are very attentive. The restaurant atmosphere is also not bad. But their stair smells like urine. Horrible... totally ruins restaurant's entrance.

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Wonderful place. I didn't expect this but this place is very well maintained. Excellent decor. Seating arrangements are nice. They have seperate place for kids as well. Price was reasonable. I went there with 2 of my friends on a Saturday evening and it was less crowded than usual. I would give it a five star if their strawberry frappe was good. It was too sugary. Recommended !

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Went there with no expectation but got amazed. their interior is very good and the place is big. so good for parties n hangout. they have items from diversified cuisine at their menu which confused me most. however ordered chicken salad, lemon mint n chowmein. food was good. behavior of the staffs is pretty good. you may love to see the club ground view from the restaurant. ... if you are thinking of going their you may pay a visit. I would say it is a quality place indeed in this neighbourhood.

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Nicely decorated and spacious interior. Couches are comfortable. Contemporary menu with Indian and local style Thai/Chinese items. Food is quite delicious. Cooperating staffs.

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Don't be too excited by the look of the food. All that shines is not gold.Food was very bad. Tasteless & cold. I'll never visit this one again. Bad food, High price compared to what you get, Bad & unorganised service. Not worth it. My last visit was amazing, food was tasty that's why I took my mother with me to have Iftar. But it was a huge disappointment. They served very cold food. Everything was tasteless . In my entire life I have never seen chicken sizzling without smoke and any heat. Felt like they had premade chicken sizzling and they just warmed it for 30 second in oven & served. Also it was too sour. Waste of money. I had drinks with my food. They did not serve it . When I asked at almost at the end of our meal then they gave us drinks. The employees are walking everywhere cluelessly. doesn't know how to do service at restaurant. The waiters are roaming around like they donâ€™t work there....they just came to walk around ğŸ¤¦ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Such an amazing place for hangouts with family and friends. The manager Mr. Sunny was very organized with service. Chef Mr. Monir were asking us for the food taste after we finished. We'll definitely like to visit this place again.

business_address: 2nd Floor, City Club Market, Road No #01, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Galleria Restaurant located in mirpur 12. Visited twice. Environment was good. Enough space for seating. You can enjoy your food with watching cricket. Tried their burger , noodles, set menu. Taste was good.

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I had an amazing dining experience at Ciao, an Italian restaurant that truly captures the authentic flavors of Italy. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and every dish felt like a taste of the Italian coast. The highlight of my meal was the Frutti di Mare, a perfect mix of fresh shellfish and seafood served with linguine in a rich, slightly spicy tomato sauce. The flavors were bold yet balanced, and every bite tasted like the Fruit of the Sea. If youâ€™re craving genuine Italian cuisine and a cozy dining experience, Ciao is definitely a must-visit spot! Lighting setuup is a bit dark. Everything else is fine.

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This place is a fully authentic Italian restaurant and they really serve proper Italian pizza and pasta. We tried the Shrimp Aglio Olio pasta, which was so flavorful, especially with the parmesan cheese. Then we had the Chilli Lime Shrimp pizza â€“ definitely this is the 2nd best pizza here, super yummy! We also tried a half n half pizza (not on the menu, but you can ask the waiter and then order). So we ordered Margherita(adding chicken) and Funghi â€“ both were absolutely delicious. Their pizza dough is just awesome ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Ciao Dhaka â€“ Authentic Italian Pizza Ciao Dhaka is one of the best places in the city for real Italian-style pizza. The crust is perfect â€” soft on the inside, crispy on the edges â€” and the cheese melts beautifully. Every bite is full of flavor and feels genuinely Italian. The prices are a bit on the higher side, but the quality and portion sizes make it worth it. One pizza can easily serve two people, so itâ€™s actually pretty good value for money. The pastas are also really good, and I love that theyâ€™ve partnered with a local dessert place for sweet options after your meal (still need to try that next time!). Service can be a little slow, but honestly, the food makes up for it. If you donâ€™t mind waiting a bit, youâ€™re in for a treat. Overall, highly recommend Ciao Dhaka for anyone who wants proper Italian pizza and pasta in Dhaka. The quality, flavor, and authenticity are top-notch! ğŸ•ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I tried Ciao Dhaka, and honestly, their pizza was amazing. The crust was soft yet crispy, the cheese melted perfectly, and the flavor just hit right. Itâ€™s a bit on the pricey side, but one pizza is easily enough for two people, and totally worth it. If youâ€™re looking for proper Italian-style pizza in Dhaka, this place is a solid pick. They collaborated with Dessert Boutique by Nadia Lakhani.

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Ciao Dhaka is a popular Italian restaurant in the city, well-known for its wood-fired pizzas. The pizza crust was crispy and the dough had a nice flavor. Toppings were fresh and tasty. Their Diavola pizza is the best â€” full of flavor and a must-try. For dessert, we had the Deconstructed Banoffee Pie, which was very delicious. It had layers of cream and caramel, making it a unique and enjoyable treat. However, the service was quite slow, and the place felt congested with a long waiting line. If you're visiting, go mainly for the pizza â€” itâ€™s worth it. Not the best place for comfort or quick service, but a good spot if you're craving a great slice.

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The di manzo pizza was great, although I personally expected it to be even better for the price. The fettuccine alfredo was amazing, it was the better of the two items. However, the price:quantity ratio was a bit disappointing, even though the taste was quite premium. In other words, great items but the pricing could have been slightly better. For this price, I personally expect the items to be exceptionally good, which was not the case (the pasta was close to exceptional if the price is taken out of consideration). The service of the staff was commendable too. Very friendly. Best wishes for Ciao!

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Mainly ordered the Seafood Pasta to try out mussels, but sadly it had almost no amount of meat in it. In comparison to the price, the portion size is quite small, however, the base sauce complimented the overall taste. Also tried their fungi pizza but forgot to take pictures. The taste of the mushrooms and cheese paired really nicely, but the dough was a bit more chewy for my liking. The server was not very good at his work, served food on cracked plate and kept on forgetting to deliver food & condiments.

business_address: House 18 Rd No 10A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Loved the food. We ordered Quattro Formaggio from their pizza section and shrimp aglio olio from the pasta one! Loved everything. But service wise I will give 4 as after we went we had to wait for almost 20/30 mins be because of no space even though i called for a booking before going. But the management kept checking on us till we got our table so appreciate that. And the decoration and everything seems quite nice and aesthetic. Definitely worth a try.

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Non halal. Located 6th floor. Spacious resto, good atmosphere, not too crowded. Approved by my Korean colleagues.

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Located on the 6th floor in the vibrant Gulshan 2 area of Dhaka, Sura Korean Restaurant offers an authentic taste of Korean cuisine with a side of great ambiance. My recent visit left me with mixed feelings about the food but impressed by the overall experience. The sushi at Sura was, in my opinion, average. While it was well-presented, it lacked the finesse and flavor complexity you might expect from top-tier Korean sushi. Itâ€™s decent for a quick sushi fix, but it didnâ€™t stand out as a highlight of the meal. Apparently the spicy tuna roll is made from canned tuna, UNACCEPTABLE when you are charging these prices. Where Sura truly shines is its meat dishes. The Korean BBQ and other meat-based offerings were good. The flavors were bold, the meat was tender and perfectly cooked, and the accompanying banchan (side dishes) elevated the experience to another level. Whether it was the bulgogi or the grilled short ribs, each bite was packed with authentic Korean flair. The service at Sura deserves high praise. The staff was attentive, friendly, and quick to accommodate requests, making the dining experience seamless and enjoyable. The restaurant itself is spotlessly clean, with a modern and inviting vibe that strikes a perfect balance between cozy and upscale. The 6th-floor location adds a nice touch, offering a pleasant view of the Gulshan area. Overall, Sura Korean Restaurant is a gem for meat lovers and those seeking a lively yet comfortable dining atmosphere. While the sushi may not steal the show, the meat dishes, good service, and great vibe make it worth the visit for Korean cuisine enthusiasts in Dhaka.l

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The atmosphere of the restaurant is very good, but the food tastes bad. And there were a lot of employees, but they chatted with each other and didn't care about the customers.

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Great place for authentic Korean food if you have the taste bud!

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Superb experience. Worth a try. Their service is especially good as they provide guidance and care. If you do not know what to do, they will help you. Price, yes bring your card with you. Cash will not be sufficient. But you will not regret it.

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Liked the ambience and the interior of this restaurant which reopened after couple of years. Some food I liked & some were a bit average like mixed fried rice & spicy seafood soup. Beef bulgogi, kimchis & vegetable tempura was really good.

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Really good Korean restaurant to enjoy Korean foods. The restaurant provides various Korean menus such as kimchi and soybean stew highly reputated by Koreans. Besides that if you want to try Korean black bean noodle, it is worth for you to make a different taste from that of Bangladesh. They have rooms to have private talks for business meetings.

business_address: 6th Floor, Hamid Tower, Circle, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Yesterday, my friend and I had the pleasure of dining at Sura, and it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm smiles and friendly hospitality that set the tone for the evening. The ambiance of Sura is both elegant and cozy, creating the perfect setting for a relaxing meal. The staff went above and beyond to ensure we were comfortable, promptly seating us and providing excellent service throughout our visit. They were attentive without being intrusive, and their knowledge of the menu helped us make the best choices for our meal. Now, onto the food â€“ it was absolutely phenomenal. Every dish was a delightful blend of flavors and textures, showcasing the best of Korean cuisine. What truly stood out was the care and attention to detail in every aspect of our dining experience. The staff's genuine enthusiasm and passion for what they do were evident, making us feel like valued guests rather than just customers. Overall, Sura exceeded our expectations in every way.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Outstanding Experience at OLIO STEAK! I had an amazing dining experience at OLIO STEAK! The food was absolutely delicious â€” the dish was cooked to perfection, tender, juicy, and full of rich flavor. Every bite showed real care and skill from the kitchen. The sides and sauces complemented the main dish beautifully, and the presentation was spot-on. A special mention goes to Mahmud, who served us with such professionalism and warmth. He was attentive without being intrusive, offered great recommendations, and made sure we had everything we needed throughout the meal. His friendly attitude and excellent service really made the evening even more enjoyable. The overall atmosphere at OLIO STEAK was cozy yet elegant â€” perfect for both casual dinners and special occasions. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back and highly recommend this place to anyone who loves great steak and first-class service!

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Had a very nice dinner and evening in OLIO STEAK. Ordered a steak and a beverage. The food was very nice - delicious and good quality. The service was extremely friendly and helpful. We received a very warm welcome. In addition it was a very nice touch, when the staff brought me a personally signed complimentary brownie. Was a nice surprise. The brownie was very good as well. Will definitely visit again when next time in Dhaka.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I just could not hold myself from sharing my experience with Olio steak even though i don't usually share reviews. I decided to go there for dinner to celebrate my husbandâ€™s birthday and i had called them for reservation beforehand. I told them about the occasion and they were sweet enough to offer a special arrangement to make it memorable (on behalf of Olio steak). We had ordered cream of mushroom soup, fish and chips, BBQ chicken platter and T-bone steak from their menu. We absolutely loved each of the dishes and staff members were too sweet and welcoming the whole time making sure we are comfortable and have everything we need. Lastly, to end the celebration on a sweet note we got brownies on behalf of Olio steak and it was really a sweet surprise for both of us. I loved my overall experience. 100% recommended for good food and good time.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Just visited Olio Steak, and honestly â€” everything was amazing! ğŸ”¥ The food was absolutely delicious, perfectly cooked, and full of flavor. The environment was super cozy and stylish â€” a perfect place to chill, eat, and enjoy good vibes. Definitely one of the best spots in town for steak lovers!

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Excellent place with delicious steaks. We had the ribeye medium and it was platter with dips/sauces and sides of vegetables and spanish rice. Affogato was for the dessert and it was flavourful and lovely. The experience was completed by the attentive service offered by Lincoln Rosario. He gave us delectable chocolate brownies complimentary. There's a beautiful outdoor setting too and it's landscaped beautifully. The indoor seating is spacious and tastefully done. Recommended to all fine dining steak lovers.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Excellent place for dining out and chill with friends. Food was tasty and the service was topnotch.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food and service by Mr.Mamun was really great. Highly recommend this place for good steak

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: My recent experience at Olio Steak was exceptional. It's a stellar combination of gracious service, a strikingly artistic atmosphere, and delicious cuisine. For the main event, the T-Bone steak is highly recommended, delivering on both flavor and quality. The rib-eye is also good- flavorful & tender. The mango smoothie? It's the perfect, refreshing accompaniment! Oh, and their mushroom soup is truly different.

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was really good and needed a bit of a bigger space considering the price of the food & service !

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Experience at Umai Japanese Restaurant I recently dined at Umai Japanese Restaurant, and while there were a few positives, the overall experience left me excited about returning anytime soon. The food was quite tasty, which was the highlight of the visit. Additionally, the restaurantâ€™s location is pleasant and easy to find However, there were notable drawbacks. The service fell short and could use improvement. The ambiance was averageâ€”not particularly memorable. I initially ordered a pineapple juice, but it wasnâ€™t available, so I opted for plan B guava drink as a backup. Unfortunately, it was disappointing and failed to stand out. Considering the higher-than-average prices, I felt the value didnâ€™t quite align with the cost. While it wasnâ€™t a terrible experience, I didnâ€™t find a compelling reason toUmai Japanese restaurant return. Iâ€™ll likely explore other dining options before considering Umai again.

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Excellent choices of bento ğŸ± chicken/salmon/beef. Good for family and office programs. Really enjoyed the Iftaar offers and the complementary freshly made matcha cake. Thanks. Just take care of the mosquitoes beforehand.

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Japanese Cuisine. I usually can't remember the names of the foods, my bad. But the waiters are really helpful. You just clearly tell them what you're looking for. Remember, they'll give you one welcome drink and a soup as complementary. So order accordingly

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Another japanese cuisine experience here in Dhaka. Went there during lunch. I love japanese food and am always looking to try out different places service the cuisine. So, we ordered a good amount of food to try out their dishes. The food was served pretty fast. The grilled octopus and squid was really good. Their beef ramen was okay, but i felt it could've done with some more beef and a thicker broth. Their maki rolls were a let down, and for some reason the size of the rolls seemed extra small. The salmon sandwich was good. They also have good seating options, with rooms available for larger groups (8+). Service was good and they even gave us ice cream on the house.

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We ordered - hot and spice sushi roll - Japanese style sirloin steak - coconut kingyoku - mint lemon The food was very delicious and filling. Amazed by the service and prep time. Our bill was near 7k for two people but it was definitely worth it. Will come back for more!

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Amazing food and brilliant service

business_address: 8 Rd No. 50, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Very nice and soothing atmosphere and the food was fresh and prepared with a lot of care. Really liked the fried squid and octopus and the assorted sushi and sashimi platter. I also had the Chicken Katsu Curry Don, which I personally felt was a little bit too sweet for my taste. But overall was a good experience and the waiter was helpful with choices and recommendations. Price wise, of course Japanese cuisine in Dhaka is never cheap but overall it was a good experience.

business_address: Binni Restaurant House, Concord Sark Building, 56/A Rd 132, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A good quality restaurant in Gulshan just beside my office. Their collection is good but a bit overpriced. Also their service is quite slow. However their letka khichuri is very tasty.

business_address: Binni Restaurant House, Concord Sark Building, 56/A Rd 132, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A good restaurant for everyone. Food are delicious specially Briani. Wishing them success.

business_address: Binni Restaurant House, Concord Sark Building, 56/A Rd 132, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh

The food had a comforting, homemade taste. I especially loved the prawn sizzling and the soup. The ambience was great!!! Highly recommend!

business_address: Binni Restaurant House, Concord Sark Building, 56/A Rd 132, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Khichuri is great here, but price is exorbitantly high! Moreover, the staff here are not that hospitable and cordial. You can only pay via cash and they don't even have options for cards. However, they provided me an option to send money to a personal account, which i declined and had to pay via cash that I did not want to do. Having no cards payment option in a restaurant in the busy gulshan area is surprisingly questionable!

The food is sumptuous and delectable, and the choices are good. The servers are very cordial and helpful. Highly recommended.

business_address: 1st Floor, RM Center, 101 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food quality is good, but little costly. Restaurent ambience is cool. Not a crowdy place, if you want peaceful and calm place you can go there.

business_address: 1st Floor, RM Center, 101 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh

business_address: H-21, Plot 21, Road 7, Jashimuddin bus stand, Dhaka 1230 Popular Diagnostics building, H-21 Road-7, Dhaka 1230, Bangladesh

business_address: H-21, Plot 21, Road 7, Jashimuddin bus stand, Dhaka 1230 Popular Diagnostics building, H-21 Road-7, Dhaka 1230, Bangladesh
review_text: A feast at Turkish Kebab and Pizza! The mixed kebab platter showcased a tantalizing array of flavors, while the baklava was a sweet symphony for the taste buds. The refreshing lassi complemented the meal, and the wrap was a delightful blend of textures. An unforgettable culinary experience that left us craving more! The experience was elevated by the incredibly helpful staff at Turkish Kebab and Pizza. Their attentiveness and friendly demeanor added to the overall enjoyment. Plus, the quick service ensured that we could savor every moment without unnecessary delays. Kudos to a team that truly understands the essence of excellent hospitality!

business_address: H-21, Plot 21, Road 7, Jashimuddin bus stand, Dhaka 1230 Popular Diagnostics building, H-21 Road-7, Dhaka 1230, Bangladesh
review_text: Their foods are so delicious and tasty . Which is situated Uttara and popular for all.

business_address: H-21, Plot 21, Road 7, Jashimuddin bus stand, Dhaka 1230 Popular Diagnostics building, H-21 Road-7, Dhaka 1230, Bangladesh
review_text: Kebabs are very delicious here! Real Turkish cuisine. Loved it!

business_address: H-21, Plot 21, Road 7, Jashimuddin bus stand, Dhaka 1230 Popular Diagnostics building, H-21 Road-7, Dhaka 1230, Bangladesh

business_address: H-21, Plot 21, Road 7, Jashimuddin bus stand, Dhaka 1230 Popular Diagnostics building, H-21 Road-7, Dhaka 1230, Bangladesh
review_text: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Dhaka. Visited nearly 100 times. Foods are hygienic and super delicious. Don't miss their appetizer ovened sesame bread with butter and honey(forgot the name of the dish).

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Purnima Restaurant in Mirpur 2 is a well-known dining spot that has been serving locals and visitors for years. The restaurant is located in a convenient and easily accessible area, making it a popular choice for family dinners, casual gatherings, and even small celebrations. One of the standout features of Purnima Restaurant is its diverse menu, which offers a wide range of Bangladeshi, Indian, and Chinese dishes. From flavorful biryanis and curries to sizzling kebabs and fried rice, the variety caters to different tastes. The quality of the food is generally consistent, with fresh ingredients and balanced seasoning. Their beef curry and chicken tikka are particularly recommended, while vegetarians can enjoy options like mixed vegetable curry and paneer dishes. The ambiance is simple yet comfortable, with enough seating to accommodate both small and large groups. Although the dÃ©cor is not overly fancy, it creates a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The staff members are usually friendly and attentive, ensuring that orders are served in a timely manner. Pricing at Purnima Restaurant is reasonable, offering good value for the quantity and quality of food served. Portion sizes are generous, making it a great choice for those who enjoy hearty meals. However, during peak hours, the place can get quite busy, so a short wait is sometimes expected. Purnima Restaurant is a reliable option in Mirpur 2 for tasty, affordable meals in a friendly environment. Itâ€™s a spot worth revisiting for both regular dining and special occasions.

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: The restaurant is two storied. They have well seating arrangement on the second floor. There is a big arrangement & the section is air conditioned. Food quality is below average. We ordered Hyderabadi Biryani but the mutton was not well cooked. The service of the waiters were slow. They need more people to cover the whole section at the pickup hour.

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: In one sentence the foods of this restaurant is Awesome. They have verity of food items, they offered Bangla and Chinise both food items. The evening food item of this restaurant is must try dishes. I have eaten most of the dishes of this restaurant and I am fully satisfied by their food. They have served breakfast, lunch, dinner, morning snakes, evening snakes and so on. You guys can visit here to taste all the amazing dishes here. â¤ï¸ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Purnima Restaurant impressed my taste buds with delicious Sheekh Kebab, Grill Chicken, Butter Nan, Plain Nan and Vegetable, earning a solid 4.5 stars. The only letdown was the service, a bit disappointing. Despite that, the flavors are definitely worth a visit!

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Negative experience. I had breakfast few days back. Poor standard of cleanliness & irrelevant prices I found. The vegetables they served is attached here & it cost 25 tk ğŸ™„. Although the taste was not up to the mark.

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: This restaurant is very well known and has been serving over decades. The quality of food was good with low price. But something I have noticed recently they have increased the price of every item and the quality and quantity of food has downgraded so much I no longer can reccomend this restaurant anymore. One example I can give is their thai soup. It was my favorite item in their menu and used to cost 100BDT and with a lot of shirmps, but now you have to get it for 140BDT and the food got worse, you can hardly find any shirmp or chicken pieces. I also tried their lacchi and it was borderline bad. It was not good at all. To the stuffs of Purnima restaurant please make your restaurant return to its former glory.

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Food is below average, 2/5. The place is not clean and not a good dine in experience.

business_address: Shop - 1, National School Market, Mirpur- 2, Dhaka Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: It was a pleasant dining experience. The beef curry was very tasty. The food is good and the prices are low. The rice is also in good quantity. I would go there again to eat.

business_address: Plot 6 Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: â€¢SHORT SUMMARY: Authentic Asian cuisine, elegant interior and ambiance, slightly overpriced, top-notch service. â€¢Chows offers a truly authentic Chinese dining experience with an extensive menu. The interior is gorgeously designed, featuring elegant furnishings and warm lighting that create a polished and inviting atmosphere. As for the food, their BBQ Chicken Bao which was delicious - especially when paired with soy sauce. I also tried their Hong Kong-style noodles and pan-fried noodles; both were mid. However, the highlights of my dinner were definitely the crispy beef and sliced squid - absolutely flavorful and well-prepared. Lastly, their rice was average, expected a little bit taste. For drinks, I had the virgin mojito, which wasnâ€™t particularly special for the price. On the other hand, their coffee options were good. I tried the latte, and it was quite enjoyable.

business_address: Plot 6 Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We had a family dinner here on 2nd week of Sep. The main floor is ground floor but due to booking we had to sit 1st floor where they have private rooms for large group. Interior is posh. Staff were attentive. Price range is high but ok considering place and atmosphere. Food was Ok. We had Hot & Sour Soup (BDT 390 for 1:1); honestly i didnâ€™t like it much. Crab & Sweet corn dumpling (BDT 690, 4 pc) was good but we liked Prawn on Toast most (BDT 590) as appetizer. For main course we had Steamed whole fish with chili lime sauce (BDT 2300, its a must try), slice beef steak with black bean & XO sauce (BDT 1390, ğŸ‘ğŸ¼), Chows orange chicken (BDT 950, ğŸ‘), Chicken with cashew nuts was so so (BDT 950) and Chows special fried rice (BDT 690, ğŸ‘). I personally tried Beijing Black from drinks, it was good but came after i finished my dinner. Total 6ppl and cost came around 15K with vat+service charge. Parking is on the road but guards are there. So no worry. Advice to ensure reservation ahead.

business_address: Plot 6 Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Chows offers one of the finest dining experiences in the town. Their Chinese cuisine has pretty authentic taste. Tried dimsum, noodles, a chicken dish. All were excellent. The ambience is suave. Pretty awesome pick for the special dine out with your loved one.

business_address: Plot 6 Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This restaurant isn't for everyone. Bcz of their high price. Aesthetic atmosphere and calm place. Food quality is good if can't say best. But some items r really awesome. I went their with my family and friends. We had a great day. We ordered from Soup section: Hot & Sour soup - average Sweet corn soup - 7.9/10 Seafood soup - must try. Prawn cheese ball - We all liked it. Prawn Har-gao - ok ok Chicken & Prawn suimai- 8/10 Stir-Fried vegetables- 7/10 Chows special mixed fried rice - 8.5/10 Chicken with (some) sauce- 7/10 And 1 prawn item - nice. Orange juice - fresh All items r way more price than other restaurant. So if anyone or any group want to go taste their food then u should take extra money. Price wise I felt its too expensive. Car parking is available. So now my overall rating 7.8/10

business_address: Plot 6 Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I made reservations. When I reached they couldn't find my name. 2 of them looked, nothing. Then another person came and confirmed that I made the reservation. Why didn't he note it down? Inside where we sat, 1 of the air conditioners wasn't working and the other wasn't cooling properly. At the time of giving order, we told that dim sum should be given as a starter. After a while, the waiter came and asked whether everything should be brought together. They also didn't have a small bottle of water. The food was good. However, service must be improved. One final point is that this place promotes itself as a place of fine dining. Yet, there was no napkin! When asked, they brought tissues. Wow! Simply wow!

business_address: Plot 6 Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Excellent food and service. Location and environment also good. Quality food but rates are little higher side. Must try their various dumplings. Especially chicken & prawn dumplings, sea bass fish with lemon, Crab Special.

Highly dissatisfied and Dont Recommend at All.

business_address: House No 42, Block- E, Road No 12, Banani, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh

business_address: House No 42, Block- E, Road No 12, Banani, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
