Not going back again.

business_address: House No 42, Block- E, Road No 12, Banani, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Loved the Mango Sticky Rice and Steamed Fish. Staff are friendly and we'll mannered. Gives great service according to your needs. Food was spicy for a Thai food so make sure to mention your spicy level when ordering.

business_address: House No 42, Block- E, Road No 12, Banani, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: On June 21st, we visited there after hearing about its authentic Thai cuisine. Despite spending over 3,000 taka on food, I realized it wasn't truly authentic Thai, as I've experienced in Thailand. While the food was good, it didn't match the exact Thai flavors. When we arrived around 6:00 PM, the restaurant was mostly empty. Later, some customers were seated in another section. We chose the quieter area after Eid to chat with friends peacefully, avoiding the busier, budget-friendly spots. However, the restaurant staff disappointed us. Although one part of the restaurant was empty, they asked us to leave to accommodate a reservation, even though other tables were available. I found their behavior upsetting. If the restaurant had been full and no tables were free, I would have understood, but that wasn't the case. They could have offered us another table instead of asking us to leave. ((((I didn't take photo of all food together)))

business_address: House No 42, Block- E, Road No 12, Banani, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Pan Tao is a very nice Chinese restaurant to eat at. The food is really good and was given fresh. The service is really nice and they serve the food quickly. The atmosphere is nice and feels almost authentic. Overall it is a very good place to eat at.

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good place for family gathering and small celebrations or group hangouts. I liked the evening environment there. If you want to enjoy your meal with evening city street views, this place is perfect either inside or rooftop.

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A restaurant with nice environmentğŸ‘Œ. But when I visited their rooftop swimming pool section was closed. And most of the menu item was unavailableğŸ‘

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Badda is very underrated area for restaurants where as there are lots of fancy restaurants. I visited AZ restaurant & Lounge. Trust me this one is the best rooftop in Dhaka with swimming pool facilities. They also have semi rooftop and indoor arrangements where you can celebrate wedding and birthday party with free of venue charge. They are offering Indian cuisine, Chinese set menu and ground coffee and moctails. Very very good place for hangout.

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: 1. Rooftop Restaurant 2. Price is higher than other restaurants 3. The environment is a little bit of fine 4. Parking not available 6. Swimming pool available

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Very good and beautiful restaurant for hanging out with friends and family. Also they have arrangements of any programs. Specially the roof top was awesome.

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: AZ Restaurant offers a pleasant dining experience with its inviting atmosphere and good food quality. The ambiance is warm and welcoming, making it a great place to enjoy a meal with friends and family. Their menu features tasty dishes that are well-prepared, reflecting a commendable effort to maintain quality. However, the restaurant seems to struggle in a few areas. One noticeable issue is the lack of advertising, which limits its visibility and potential to attract a broader customer base. A more robust marketing strategy could significantly enhance its reach and help it gain the recognition it deserves. Additionally, there appears to be a lack of skilled manpower. While the staff is courteous, service could be more efficient and professional with proper training and an increase in skilled personnel. Investing in staff development could elevate the overall customer experience. In summary, AZ Restaurant has strong potential with its good food and inviting atmosphere but would benefit greatly from better marketing efforts and improvements in staff expertise. With these changes, it could truly stand out as a top dining spot.

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: So good nd best quality...wonderful location....you must have to go....

business_address: 12 Road No 12, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice food excellent service Average pricing

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice premium, cozy place to dine in with friends, families and colleagues. The atmosphere is aesthetic, beautiful. Make sure to go after afternoon so that you can enjoy both day and night view. Their staffs were friendly. The foods are not that exceptional, just regular taste. I recommend their mango sticky rice dessert. We took Tom yum soup, rice, chicken curry and those were spicier. Chicken Satay was good. Those who likes spicy food, can enjoy that. They donâ€™t have beverage and price of custom drinks seemed too much expensive considering quantity.

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: I celebrated my birthday dinner this year with the love of my life. The restaurant had a wonderful ambience, creating a cozy and welcoming atmosphere. While the food was average, the service was excellent. Our waiter was attentive, cordial, and even helped us take several beautiful couple photos, which made the evening extra special. Overall, a delightful experience worth remembering.

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: We stumbled upon this restaurant on rooftop of SKS tower. We were surprised by the ambience and it was pretty busy due to weekend. They have two level for sitting and we sat on ground floor. Their menu items pricing were reasonable. We enjoyed their tom yum soup and fried chicken and fried rice. Quantity was good for three persons. If you step out in balcony area you can enjoy elevated express way and surrounding.

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Visited Skyfall twice recently and loved it. The food was genuinely delicious, and the atmosphere felt special without being over the top. Great rooftop spot whether you're with a date or a group, plenty of space and a cozy vibe. Service was smooth, and the staff were polite. No long waits, no confusion.

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Honestly so disappointed with the quality of food . Yes of course the ambience and location is nice but at the end the food is the main feature . The staff very poorly trained . Ordered drinks that came even after the main course . Every items takes about an hour to come out . The starters were okay but nothing out of the ordinary. The soup was terrible and literally no prawn found in the prawn tom yum soup. The main courses were straight up miserable . We ordered fish chicken beef salad and rice and noodles . Out of All these items only the whole fish and pad Thai were edible . Everything else was disastrously bad. We didnâ€™t have the guts to even try dessert .

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: I was go there with my best friend ğŸ¥°ğŸ˜˜ The food was so awesome. We enjoyed a lot our dinner. Mr. Farhan Chowdhury is best employee over there ğŸ˜Œ He help us a lot . Best wishes for SkyFall ğŸ˜‡ğŸ˜š

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Service and atmosphere was excellent. Food was good in taste and quality but it was too expensive also. The place was well decorated and Photogenic.

business_address: 10th Floor, SKS Shopping Mall, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Skyfall Restaurant â€“ A Scenic Escape in the Heart of Dhaka Located at top of SKS Tower in Mohakhali, Skyfall offers a truly breathtaking 360-degree view of Dhaka city â€” especially stunning at sunset with the Dhaka Elevated Expressway in clear sight. The ambiance is modern and elegant, making it a great spot for hangouts, dates, or even family dinners. The food is delicious, with a variety of options that cater to different tastes. However, service can be slow, especially during peak hours due to heavy crowds. If you're visiting, it's best to come with some patience â€” the view and food will likely make up for the wait. Pros: âœ… Gorgeous panoramic city views âœ… Tasty food with good portion sizes âœ… Great atmosphere Cons: âœ…Long waiting time for food during busy hours âœ…Can be very crowded Would definitely recommend for the experience â€” just donâ€™t come in a rush..

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Their food is always tasty. Especially, Chicken khichuri is the best. I always eat chicken khichuri whenever I go to the restaurant. However this time I ordered beef handi. Which was a bit overpriced ( Taka 230 ). But what surprised me the most is they charged Taka 80 for only khichuri rice. Which was unbelievably overpriced and the taste of beef handi was average. Not too good not too bad. It should have been better though considering the price.

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: This is known restaurants for Mohakhali Wireless Gate peoples for their Chicken Chap & Tea. Basicaly the serves fried chicken with better sauce & butter naan than others. But it is not recommended for breakfast or lunch.

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I have tried grilled chicken, faluda, beef kichuri, and their special tea. Surprisingly all the items were so good and mouth watering. Apart from food quality the behavior of their staff was also good. Overall, one of the best places to have meal at wireless more.

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Very delicious Chicken Chap I have eaten lot of time this place and every time i'm impressed So tnx for provided good quality food.

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food is good specially khichuri... But biriyani is not that good. Grill chicken is also good

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food and ambience was good but their service is very slow. It took almost 40-50min to get our food. They should improve their service.

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: First and foremost, there was no handwash. The interior is not well-organized and appears to be ordinary. Food: I tried basmoti-kacchi, which cost 270 taka but is not even close to kacchi bhai, let alone Sultan's Dine. But their stuff was pretty well behaving, even they replaced a mutton. I will not go again unless there is an emergency.

business_address: 74, Musa Menshion wireless gate, Mohakhali (C/A), Dhaka, 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Good food and atmosphere both. Their service was also excellent. However, the food delivery was delayed. the evening when the chicken chap is made outside. The majority of the time, smoke fills the entire restaurant. I faced this problem in their restaurant.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This place is on the top floor of the building. You have to go to level 8 by lift and go up by stair more 1 level. Lift Closes at 11:30 pm sharp. Well decorated and nicely presented. Rooftop is decorated by plants and outdoor table and chiar. Variety of cuisines are available here. Taste are average and the amount is good. Staffs are friendly enough and they communicated nicely. In a residential area this fine dining restaurant is good option.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was great. But the atmosphere was below average. I think very less people come here now. That's why their atmosphere is not taken care of.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I went there a long time ago. The garden was clean and cute, there were some kids having a party on the nearby roofs. It was a totally wholesome experience. The food was absolutely average tasting. But the price was pretty low compared to others.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Sky Dine Rooftop is one of the best restaurant in Dhaka. Sky Dine Rooftop Restaurant is located at Niketan, Dhaka, Banglades. We will visit again.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food was good but Service delayed.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A nice ambient. A good place to hangout with friends and enjoy time together.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Less crowded, Good food, well behaved staff. Perfect for booking your meetups, meeting, iftar party, etc. Not recommended if you're looking for a place just based on food. It's more of a better for bookings type of place.

business_address: Rd Number 4, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Not good at night. Green ambient light is horrible. Couldn't see the actual color of food. Thai soup was not fresh. Cashew nut salad's chicken was not fresh. Fresh Malta juice was 80% and max 20% Malta.

business_address: Four Points by Sheraton Dhaka, Gulshan 6/A North Avenue Commercial Area, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Semi-open cucina, the Wine racks are ghosts in 2023 and beyond, but were well stocked in 2020. The quality of the cuisine has remained strong throughout as has the level of service. Nice view of the outdoor seating area, but if the dust and noise of the Gulshan 1 roundabout is too much, the indoor dining space is clean and quietâ€¦unless itâ€™s a live music night. Menu standouts are the JalapeÃ±o Bread Bowl and of course the Filet Mignon. Even tasty when re-heated on the iron at the Hotel as leftovers ğŸ˜„.

business_address: Four Points by Sheraton Dhaka, Gulshan 6/A North Avenue Commercial Area, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A really nice roof top steak house with views over the Gulshan area. Device is excellent and professional. There is a special menu which is extremely reasonable with soup, steak and dessert included for 2200taka. My only gripes were the steak was ordered medium rare came out medium- but itâ€™s ok- the service made up for it. I would recommend

business_address: Four Points by Sheraton Dhaka, Gulshan 6/A North Avenue Commercial Area, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food tested average and had less variety. Best was the desert corner, sushi and the chocolate fountain with Marshmello. Also the service was not up to the mark as stuff of the live station should help people more to experience the food in a better way (there was a lamb dish which should have with their special sauce that the staff should have mentioned, felt plain less to me). Overall not a very decent experience I had there. Among the food it was so so, nothing extraordinary. The srimps were smelly (1 got one piece and that may be a randomly). Also asked for a water bottle multiple time but couldn't get it. But their regular item was good. Liked their beguni and regular ifter items. Also shrimp and others were okish. The steak with gravy was something that had mixed feeling. I liked it but some didn't. Needs to work on the service more. But apart from that the view was amazing.

business_address: Four Points by Sheraton Dhaka, Gulshan 6/A North Avenue Commercial Area, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Review: The Beast â€“ Dhakaâ€™s Ultimate Fine Dining Experience The Beast is hands down my favorite restaurant in Dhaka. From the moment you walk in, the place radiates luxury and exclusivityâ€”itâ€™s not just a meal, itâ€™s an experience. The ambiance, the stunning interior, and the incredible city view all combine to create a truly premium vibe. One of the unique highlights is that they allow you to bring your own alcohol, which is perfect for those who enjoy pairing their favorite drink with fine food. Itâ€™s rare to find a place in Dhaka that offers this kind of flexibility with such a refined setting. This is the place to bring a date if you're looking to impress or just want to enjoy a high-end, private dining atmosphere. Whether you're celebrating something special or just in the mood to treat yourself, The Beast delivers. My only wish? A stronger, more diverse menu to match the rest of the excellence. A little more variety would elevate the experience even further. Still, for the overall vibe, exclusivity, and sheer eleganceâ€”The Beast easily takes the top spot in the city. Highly recommended.

business_address: Four Points by Sheraton Dhaka, Gulshan 6/A North Avenue Commercial Area, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I spent my 31st evening there, they offered us The beast, saying they'd serve the same food as Flair. But in reality, the quantity and quality of the food there was too poor, the atmosphere was too congested, and the service was so poor!

business_address: Four Points by Sheraton Dhaka, Gulshan 6/A North Avenue Commercial Area, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the best restaurants in Dhaka city & top view is awesome, especially from Terrace. Their food & service are great to enjoy. Recently, they started under IHG Crown Plaza, which is extraordinary. A good place for family, couple & events

business_address: Four Points by Sheraton Dhaka, Gulshan 6/A North Avenue Commercial Area, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: It's a fantastic place, food, and a vibe. I loved the interior and the amazing rooftop view.

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: Mizan made the best Flat white in Dhaka sÃ³ far. Not even north end made me a standard and proper flat white. But I will suggest the management to have Oat Milk too. Good job Mizan vai

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: Great ambiance, perfect latte art, and top-notch service. Ideal for small groups. Food, service, and atmosphere all rated 5 stars. Price range: 200â€“400 BDT. A cozy spot for a quick coffee break.

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: This is a coffee place inside SKS Tower, Mohakhali. They also have a good collection of various types of foods. We went there for their breakfast package. The food was fresh and tasty, but didn't feel anything extraordinary. I won't consider it value for money. The interior and the seating arrangements were good. The service wasn't as good as I expected. At the early morning, we were the only customers there, but it took a good while before someone attended us after calling. The coffee was good. They have an outside seating available, if you want to have your cigarettes while sipping your coffee. This restaurant has a lot of scope to improve. I hope they'll do.

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: Edit: I visit now a few times a week and their food quality has improved. Their coffee is pretty good and love their outdoor sitting arrangements. The environment is a little peaceful. . among all the restaurants of SKS centre this one has the best ambience but very sadly its food taste is BAD ! the garlic mushroom was a bit dry and it had a peculiar smell. the burger had a little petty inside it and it was served like a sub-sandwich the sandwich was also a big disappointment. the french fries were like any other cheap Street french fries ( like 30 tk fries ) !!! the staff told us to wait 20 minutes for the food but actually we waited more than 30 minutes. they were charging premium prices for very badly tested food. some positive sides: outdoor sitting arrangement with smoking zone, very well decorated interior. this place is only good for your meetings with a cup of coffee. overall, the money was wasted. not recommended at all please improve your food quality, you have a very nice restaurant at a very precious location !

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: It's a nice cute cafe . The food was good they give big portions. One portions of fries can easily feed 3 person . The pizza was a good size also and the prices are decent. Staff is friendly and kind . Also coffee is fresh nice n hot . I visite again soon.

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: Bhalogari cafe is a well known cafe for coffee and snacks lovers in Mohakhali area... Interior and ambience is fresh and okay...Smoked sandwich was good in taste...Hazelhut coffee was average and Tiramisu was also okay...Price is a bit high...Service is satisfying...

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: Its a cafe at ground floor of SKS Tower shopping floor, on the left side of the entry gate. Has both indoor and outdoor seating. Offers different types of coffee, heavy snacks and pastry. We had their latte and machito. Also took a almond cookie which really turned out a tasty one. Overall service, interior and food taste is fine.

business_address: Q9HW+8VP, SKS shopping mall, Dhaka 1205, Bangladesh
review_text: This cozy cafe provides good atmospheric environment along with good food and services. But there is another rare charm that this cafe provides, which is Generosity! We were stuck in a massive rain, out of any vehicular service and waited in this amazing place for near 2:00am at night, the restaurant was suppose to close it's service by 11:00pm, but they kept it open just for us, furthermore they assured us to wait as long as its required. We were very greatful and felt blessed. Its easy to find restaurant with, good food, humble service and great Interior But its very rare to find such Generosity! I wish nothing but success for this restaurant... May every customer visits here and leaves with a great story to tell!!

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Went there on Eid main day and honestly love their food, it's taste, environment and the service. I found it reasonable too! I was craving for a typical chicken rice set with soup which isinâ€™t easily available in Bangladesh but found a similar one in this restaurant. Good stuff.

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Cheong Shing is one of those places where any item is guaranteed to be tasty. We ordered the following items: Mixed Fried Rice: This is a regular fried rice but the amount of prawn, chicken and eggs are way more than that of any other place. Fusian Fried Rice: This is definitely one of my favorite. I have ordered this on multiple occasions as lunch in my office. It's a fried rice with gravy mixed with seafood. It can be enjoyed on its own. Must try! Fried Chicken: The fried chicken might not look very tempting but it was pretty good. It's served along with some greens and herbs that enhances the taste. Ginger Beef Onion: This was okay. Tasted fine and served in plentiful. Overall the food was great and so we're the drinks. We were 6 people and the total bill was around 5k. I'd surely visit again. Recommended!!!

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Cheong Shing Restaurant in Dhaka left a lasting impression on us when we dined there on May 2, 2024. From the moment we stepped in, the ambiance greeted us with warmth and sophistication. The interior dÃ©cor added to the overall dining experience, creating an inviting atmosphere for our group of colleagues and bosses. The food selection was diverse, and each dish we sampled surpassed our expectations. The flavors were robust, and the quality of ingredients was evident in every bite. Whether it was traditional favorites or innovative creations, Cheong Shing delivered excellence across the board. Beyond the culinary delights, the restaurant provided ample space for socializing, making it an ideal spot for gatherings with friends, family, and colleagues alike. The vibrant energy of the place enhanced our enjoyment, turning a simple meal into a memorable occasion. Overall, Cheong Shing Restaurant earns my highest recommendation. It's a gem in Dhaka's dining scene, offering not just great food but also a welcoming ambiance perfect for any occasion. Whether you're seeking a casual hangout or a place to impress your guests, Cheong Shing delivers on all fronts.

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Very Old building with refurbished ambiance. Mosquitoes flying random. Food taste somewhat authentic Chinese, a bit salty. When I told them to pack my food, the waiter brought some box in front of me and was packing right beside. Very unprofessional. Overall an okay experience compared to the price.

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Horrible experience, full of flies and mosquitoes,It's actually a party place for young stars, with room date facility. It's not a eating place for family. During my visit we found food's served with flies, dining was full with smoke. Waiter's were reluctant to serve . it's look like guests are extra burden for them. Our arrival time was 7.30 pm , and food served at 9pm. Food is plain with lot's of testing salt. Building was very old, remodeled, but still not suitable as eatery.

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Authentic Mainland Chinese and the quantity over price is very good. Remember authentic may not be like Bangladeshi Chinese foods. 11/10/24 Cheong Shing Restaurant is a nostalgic favorite, offering a truly authentic Cantonese dining experience. The atmosphere brings back fond memories, and the food is exceptional. Itâ€™s a must-try for anyone looking to savor genuine Cantonese flavors!

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Very unfortunate.. I went to this restaurant several times before covid & enjoyed a lot, now the food taste not good at all, even the simple egg fried rice was barely eatable. Only best dish was the sea fish stuffed Chili, although too spicy too handle for most of the people. The worse dish was clay pot beef, it's a mixer of squid, chicken liver, sliced beef & vermicelli noodles. I really don't know what to say about this dish, too much black bean sauce, squid other stuffs really overpowered beef.

business_address: Dhaka Rd No. 19/A, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Location good. Nice interior. Food looks good. Test very salty. Cook use a lot of testing salt. After having this Food you fill sleepy. Some one filled vomiting. Those who have testing sales problem please avoid this resturent.

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Its a moderately decorated place for regular breakfast and lunch. Staff are ok and ambience is good. Food tastes vary a lot. Donâ€™t tell them which is your best item rather order directly from menu. Their alur dam was pretty bad and chicken soup was very good for breakfast.

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Beresta Restaurant Review Location: â€¢ Located conveniently on the main road of Rampura. â€¢ Beautiful, well-thought-out design and decor. Atmosphere: â€¢ Lovely lighting and pleasant smell. â€¢ Cozy and inviting environment. â€¢ Great overall dining atmosphere. Service: â€¢ Waiters were polite, well-behaved, and attentive. Food: â€¢ Ordered: Kebab Platter, Garlic Naan, Coffee. â€¢ Complimentary salad and sauce were a nice touch. â¸» Pros: â€¢ Beautiful and cozy restaurant design. â€¢ Pleasant lighting and smell. â€¢ Friendly and professional staff. â€¢ Outstanding Garlic Naan and Coffee. â€¢ Complimentary salad and sauce were very thoughtful. Cons: â€¢ Kebab Platter was disappointing (not warm, felt not fresh). â¸» Overall: I enjoyed my dinner here despite a few issues with the food. I would recommend Beresta for a relaxed evening, especially for their atmosphere and service. â¸»

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Couldn't take much picture of the place and food as it was too crowded, but the atmosphere and food was amazing in one word! Loved their decorations inside and outside. Maybe a little improvement of their staff service is needed.

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Overrated tbh ! Taste of chicken soup and brain is way worse than that of Star and Duurbeen. Mejbani Daal tasted average. Kolija was not only kolija like other restaurants. It had fepsha and other things mixed . Aluur Dom was good . Very congested space . Customer handling also requires improvement. Honestly I had high hopes after reading about this on internet. But actually itâ€™s extremely overhyped in my opinion .

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: A few months ago we ordered naan and kebab from Beresta. It was so good that we ordered it again today. But the thing is that I got a part of hair in beef sheek kebab. Since this is the first time I don't want to complain or do anything else. But they should be careful & also they should follow hygiene rules while preparing the food.

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Love their breakfast items. Pricing was a bit higher than usual but worth it. Good ambience, air conditioning and food quality is great. Keep on coming back here for breakfast. Favourite items: Alur dom Ghee paratha Spicy brain masala Beef nihari

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: The place is well decorated and gives good vive. The place is neat and clean. The food was tasty and price is also okay. We have tried the kabab with butter nun and faluda.. The nun and kabab was very good but considering the price the faluda was not worth of money. The behaviour of waiters was good and they were there whenever you need something. Obviously recommended!!

business_address: 3 E, 2 DIT Rd, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Had their brain masala which was pretty good. Their special Ghee Parata was super good. Went for breakfast a little late which is why they stopped serving tea by that time.

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Over hyped place. If you want to buy traditional Accessories then it seems to be Ok. But in terms of food & Service it is much much disappointing. Food Prices according to quantity & Taste much Higher. I found no justification about the Prices. Then I tried 12 pieces of fuska, which costs 400+ ( service charge 10%). A Photogenic Place but not a recommended place.

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I went for Thursday Open Mic programme which is start from 8 Pm and finished around 11. But I left the place early. Lots of Bengali food they served. Good ambient for seating and hangout. Little bit noisy. Not smoking area is top of the roof corner.

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Itâ€™s a great place if you want to buy traditional souvenirs, but as a cafe/restaurant i think itâ€™s a huge let down. My experience at their rooftop dine-in was sad, firstly because the price of the dishes donâ€™t justify the amount and taste of the food. On top of that they impose a 10% service charge, for absolutely nothing. The washrooms on the rooftop stay closed, no Air conditioning system in this heat, they provide Gamcha as a substitute for tissue, but no alternative for straw to have drinks. The place overall is just for aesthetic vibes, nothing more.

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Absolutely lovely time spent with my friends in a peaceful and cozy setting. We enjoyed some delicious ginger tea and great conversation. The only downside was the presence of mosquitoes, so Iâ€™d recommend bringing some repellent just in case. Other than that, a wonderful experience!

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Jatra Biroti has an amazing cozy, artsy vibe with delicious food and friendly service. Sometimes thereâ€™s a bit of waiting time to get seated, but itâ€™s totally worth it for the atmosphere and experience!

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food is good for the vegetarians but overpriced. I agree on the hygiene concerns like the other reviews. Using reusable cotton napkins is questionable and concerning in this post corona world. However, if you are looking for a place to hangout and click pictures then it's quite appropriate for you.

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I tried their fuchka - average - high price Their mango lassii is 5/5 .. perfect amount of sweetness and price is quite reasonable- 150 Their mushroom biriyani platter(includes vegetable kofta, raita, achar, lemon, onion) tastes 5/5 but costs 700ish which is quite a lot and seems like just one time worth eating due to cost. But the whole place inside in very beautiful. You can visit all the floors and see various beautiful stuffs. Worth visiting atleast once. The topmost floor seemed like a smoking and dating zonish. Due to heavy cigarette smoke I started having asthma issues. But as no other seat was available had to endure the yucky smell of a smoker couple.

business_address: House No, 63 Road No. 17/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food was very good but service very poor. We had to ask for straws, napkins and other basic necessities. Getting food was long wait and some menu items not available.

business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Been there with my family for lunch. When we reached for lunch at 3:25pm, the security guard informed us the restaurant was closed for serving the lunch. Because they serve lunch from 12pm-3pm. And dinner 6pm-10pm. However when I informed the guard we're 7/8 people, suddenly they approved us for dine-in! The professionalism was not up to the mark. The food was good though. Typical family restaurant, not a trendy place for tiktok!

business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Xinxian is the restaurant of the chain group "X". They have many chinese restaurants across dhaka with similar names. Apart from these, Four Seasons restaurant and Zamzam party centre also belongs to them. The food quality is good. I hope, they maintain a certain level of cleanliness in Kitchen. Food taste is good and always have a decent taste. Also, you can have party with only paying the food price. Good option for economical programs.

business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Okay after seeing a lot of reviews on Google Maps., i decided to go there and have dinner with my family there. They have vey nice and cozy environment there. Feeling will be fresh which is must go with Restaurant name. Food is very good, tasty and yammy. I will recommend there food, Environment and clean toilet. Also plenty option of payment. Now come to the downside off this Restaurant. - Service is very Very Very BAD. Especially there waiters. If you are not want to pay 6-8k for you meal there, they will think you as begger and treat you like that. Which i feel and Experienced there. Very disappointed. As you have to pay 10% of your total bill, it is disgusted to me for there behaviour. Waiter is not polite and dont know about THERE menu fully. Suggested me some very bad food menu to try. - they should change there cutlery. It is very old and out dated. - food quantity is very very low. They told me all food item is 1:3 but when i they serve me, i feel thats not for 3 person but for 2 person and 1 is child. You can see that is my photo. - and the last, they are good, nice food, atmosphere is excellent.
