business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Ordered Szechuan soup and American chop suey. Both were great. The portion sizes were good too, especially the chop suey. Would recommend both dishes, especially the Szechuan soup.

business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: The taste of food was good. The price is a bit higher. Staff are friendly.they have a small space for Indoor kids playground. Highly recommended.

business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Our family recently had a wonderful dinner at Xinxian Chinese Restaurant in Dhaka. The restaurant's atmosphere was pleasant, and the service was outstanding. Upon arrival, we were greeted with refreshing welcome drinks. Our meal began with tasty soup and crispy fish fingers, setting a positive tone for the evening. For the main course, we ordered a variety of dishes, including rice, beef sizzling, chicken, and vegetables. Each dish was flavorful and left a lasting impression. The culinary experience was enjoyable, and the chefs showcased their skills. Even though the prices were a bit high, the excellent service and delicious food at Xinxian Chinese Restaurant make it a great option for a special family dinner. If you're okay with the higher cost, the overall experience is delightful. Our family enjoyed our time at Xinxian, and we'd suggest it to anyone seeking quality Chinese cuisine in Dhaka. Additionally, there's a playground for children at Xinxian Chinese Restaurant.

business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: During my stay in BD, I tried three different Chinese restaurants and Xinxian by far is the best one. Food quality still good as before but quantity is not as expected. Service is okay, but they should improve total atmosphere of the restaurantâ€¦

business_address: Plot-11 Road No. 8, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Been going to this place for years. The taste has always been consistent. One of the best family restaurant in the whole country for sure. This is not just a restaurant. It's a place of my family tradition and nostalgia. Their signature chicken cashew nuts solid is one of the best in town. Their Thai soap and wanton combination has always been our signature family appetizer. i owe this place my childhood. Just had lunch here today and we enjoyed our meal very much. Thank you xinxian!

business_address: Sanmar Towner, 2 Rd 35, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Kampai Dhaka with my colleagues, and we had a wonderful experience. The food and service were both excellent, and the seating arrangement was well-organized and aesthetically pleasing. Their live kitchen added a special touch, allowing us to enjoy the cooking experience right in front of us. For those who are not used to Japanese cuisine, the taste may feel a bit different at first perhaps because itâ€™s the authentic Japanese flavor, which is naturally distinct from our usual palate. Overall, it was a delightful dining experience, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to explore quality Japanese food in Dhaka.

business_address: Sanmar Towner, 2 Rd 35, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: OmG, and i thought i have already covered all the good restaurants in Dhaka.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food quality is good. Ambience is quiet and clam.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: A premium experience in banani, Japanese thought that is so tasty I have eaten only in Malaysia, this restaurant comes in second in comparison to that. No restaurant atmosphere was great too. The stuff was very polite. our needs were well taken care of. vegetate there two times each time they satisfied us with their service and food. but I have to say, this is a bit overpriced then that of any other place, but the phone is really worth the price. would likely to visit there many times more in future.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Good place with quality food. If you have a craving for sushi it is a much more visited place.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently dined at Sushi Samurai and had a fantastic experience. The food was delicious, offering a wide variety of authentic Japanese dishes. The atmosphere was inviting and had a pleasant ambiance. The staff's behavior was excellent, providing attentive and friendly service throughout my meal. Overall, Sushi Samurai is a great choice for anyone looking to enjoy top-notch Japanese cuisine in a welcoming setting.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: In my opinion itâ€™s the best place for sushi in Dhaka. They have some of the classic items of sushi, chicken, beef and noodles. We tried the volcano rolls, orange chicken and bulgogi chicken dishes. I must say the overall interior and the ambience of the restaurant is very nice. The service and the staff are also top notch. I know for a fact that the salted caramel cake is the best dessert in there, but sadly they didnâ€™t have it then. Canâ€™t wait to visit again.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The food is good. Although a bit overpriced. But they have different kindof flavors. And the interior is good. However, there are a lot of mosquitoes there. And you have to pay extra to sit in a better seat. So, that's a down for me.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food is amazing. Chairs are not that comfy and decoration looks kinda bad. Lights are not placed properly for good pictures and many lights were flickering. Staff behavior is good. In the end, food quality triumphs all I guess. Rather on the expensive side. They have introduced Chinese menu but didn't try it out yet.

business_address: House-100 Rd No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: A good place to have Japanese, Chinese or rather Asian food in this restaurant. Situated in a prime location of Banani road 11 where hundreds of other restaurants are located. There is always a competition among these restaurants to maintain the quality of food to keep customers happy. We enjoyed varieties of Japanese food and they were good. The quantity is a bit small but quality is good. The ambiance of the restaurant is good but we found there were too many chairs and tables and made the place a bit crowded. Probably many people come for lunch or dinner. They have lots of waiting staff as well and they are friendly and helpful. Prices of food are on the mid range.

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice decor, quiet place..You can enjoy your time while relaxing..Fast service pizza ğŸ• was good ğŸ‘

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice place to grab a bite around banasree area. They have a wide and specious well decorated restaurant. Good for family and friends outings and dinners. Prices are reasonable. Staffs are well behaved and service is good. Accepts both cash and cards. No parking though. Has take out option. Available on Foodpanda.

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Assorted drinks and continental food available here. Prices are little bits higher than nearby similar restaurants. However well decorated and quality of food are acceptable. One annoying person always stay at entrance, who insisted all customers for tips.

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: I like their oven baked pastas. Feels good to eat every time I go there. My favourite is pasta-basta. Bbq chicken pasta is also good. One of my friends said that their other foods are good too. Didn't try though. They give a little welcome drink now which tastes good. They have membership cards for discount and they have a little playzone. They have some branches in Dhaka. I have given photos of the menu.

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Great place for spending qualify time with friends and family. Nice interior, Children's play zone, and excellent service . Restaurants situated near Banasree Farazi Hospital. Food taste with moderate price also awesome.

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Good place to spend your time with family members and kids. There is a section for children. Sitting arrangements of different types. Big space with attractive decorations. Food is tasty, as usual. Chicken masala and fried rice, I liked most. But Kashew nut salad and beef sizzling are poor quality. Hot and crispy chicken should be less fried...

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: I have been visiting them since 2017. And their food, services and the atmosphere level are increasing day by day. I'm so happy to visit them. But one thing, I'm missing a lot of their "Hydrabadi dam biriyani" that was so delicious... I requested the owner to start the dish again and also bring some more platters ..Thank you ğŸ˜Š

business_address: Road No. 1, Dhaka 1219, Bangladesh
review_text: Congenial environment, you can spend your time with your friends, family or colleagues. Interior is very good. Food quality also good.

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Brio in Gulshan is a wonderful Italian restaurant offering great authentic cuisines. Their wood-fired pizzas are a must-try â€” the Burrata & Beef Cheese Pizza had a crispy, thin dough with rich and flavorful toppings. The Mushroom Soup was unique and very delicious with a deep earthy taste. Shrimp Carbonara Pasta was creamy, rich, and perfectly balanced in flavor. Chicken Milanese was fried to a golden crisp and paired well with fresh cherry tomatoes, making it light yet fulfilling. The ambience is cool and gives a nice Italian dining feel. Service was good overall, though they had some difficulty arranging seats for 6 members at first. Still, the staff remained polite and helpful. A very good place for enjoying authentic Italian food in Gulshan. Recommended.

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I am in Dhaka for work and, as we Italians know, we have a problem with food; unfortunately, we are too spoiled. Looking for a place to have lunch on my day off, I came across this restaurant. When I see pizza, I lose all sense of reason. Aware of the possible risk of being disappointed because the food might not be up to my expectations, I decide to try it anyway. My colleague and I ordered a Margherita pizza as an appetizer to share. I must say it was very good, with a light crust. Then I continued with aglio, olio e peperoncino seafood pasta, which was also very good, with the pasta cooked al dente, just the way we like it. To finish, we had tiramisu and espresso. The tiramisu was good, but the cream was very thick. The coffee was excellent. I was very surprised by this well-kept restaurant and the truly delicious and excellent food. Gentlemen, I will definitely be back when I have the opportunity.

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Tried their beef pizza and lasagna last nightâ€”flavors leaned toward authentic Italian, mild and less spicy than local pizza chains, which some may love, others not. Portions felt small for the price. The dimly lit seating area was limited, with only one restroom, and no clear signage made it tricky to find. However, their warm hospitality and welcoming service stood out and made the visit pleasant.

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Okay the pizzas wete TOO good. Highly recommend the Beef & Burrata pizza. Love their Al dente pasta but not a fan of the sauce, its a little bland. DONT order the grilled chicken salad. Its genuinely not worth it. The panna cotta was delicious!!!

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A group of us had dinner at Brio. Appetisers were calamari, roasted potatoes and sausage, tomato caprese, and main dishes were ago polio seafood, pasta bolognaise, and several varieties of pizza. The food was very good. It was tasty and fresh. Service was excellent. I donâ€™t remember the young manâ€™s name but he did a commendable job. Desserts were great too. We would certainly recommend Brio.

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The beef burrata pizza was amazing! If you like authentic pizza, you must visit this place. The tiramisu was delicious too. I took the truffle pasta as well. It was good but not something Iâ€™d order again.

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Our first dine-in experience at Brio and it certainly wonâ€™t be our last. We ordered the calamari, mushroom soup, steak, chicken salad, burrata and beef pizza, crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e , and the cannoli with a scoop of ice cream. DELICIOUS FOOD! Highly recommend a visit!

business_address: 2nd Floor, House 10 Rd 53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was absolutely terribleâ€”Iâ€™d rate it a negative 1000 out of everything ğŸ¤®. We ordered the Carnivaro pizza, Aglio Olio, Palepto Paprika, and mushroom soup, and not a single dish was even remotely tasty. This menu clearly doesnâ€™t cater to Bangladeshi taste buds at all. Waste of money ğŸ˜ª

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Very close to banani road 11 and this place is naturally very beautiful. Itâ€™s very rear to find a place like this which gives you a wow factor when you enter and you will feel like you are in a different place not like a traditional restaurant. They have both indoor and outdoor rooftop facilities. Usually food quality and kebabs are great but donâ€™t know during my last visits place was overbooked which effects on their overall service and food quality. Still I believe by doing a proper meal management in kitchen they can improve. No parking available No kids play zone Good for quick bite and kebabs Price is reasonable compared with banani restaurants Wheel chain is not accessible No lift available Good place for date and have a gossip with colleague and friends Need to maintain and clear the place as much as possible. Please visit and you will like it if you like nature and green restaurant.

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Very good place if you want Bangladeshi food. Great place to take elderly people for a dinner. The ambiance is soothing. Place is huge and have nice decorations. Price is also reasonable. They have offers in special occasions. Their menu had a wide variety to choose from and almost everything was available. The server was really nice and generous. He was very welcoming as well. Will visit there again.

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: A wonderful spot if you're craving authentic Bangladeshi cuisine. The restaurant has a spacious layout with elegant decorations and a calming ambianceâ€”making it especially ideal for bringing elderly family members for a comfortable dinner outing. The menu offers a wide range of options, and we were happy to find that almost everything we ordered was available. Prices are quite reasonable, and they also offer attractive deals during special occasions, which is a plus. Service was another highlightâ€”the staff, especially our server, was warm, courteous, and genuinely welcoming. Their hospitality definitely enhanced the overall experience. Looking forward to visiting again soon!

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Wonderful place with green plants and a classic vibe. Foods taste so good. I had a kebab platter. It was with varieties of kebab and naan and rice. Service is appreciable.

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: absolute waste of money. we took their Iftaar Platter. food was served cold. not evenn mild warm. its absolute cold the plate wasnt even warm slightly. on the menu it says motor polow(Pea) and we got polow with chicpeas (chola boot). you expect some smell from polao rice and there wasnt even any smell. rice was oily. their tadoori chicken was burnt. burnt masala on tandoori tastes horrible. chicken curry in fine. hariali kabab below average. spring rolls are soaked in oil very bad. alu chop was fine. orange drink asked for sauce. and they gave us jolpai er achaar. uncomfortable seats. and its very very old looking resturant. after entering their main gate there was foul smell. every decoration every corner every concrete was dusty. they had a little book sectection and it was falling apart and nobody cleaned it for like ages. wont reccomend.

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: In daylight, the entrance felt decieving. It felt quite rundown from the outside. But the interior is beautiful, giving beautiful pictures. The walls are green, the seating arrangement is comfortable and the food is great. Ordered the chicken cashew nut salad and it was the best chicken cashew nut salad I ever ate. It was refreshing, crunchy and tasted very good. There is card payment option. The service was a bit slow, but it added to the calming ambience. It was a great experience.

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the worst restaurants in Banani.Worst food one can possibly serve. Totally disgusting. Recently we have visited their restaurant and found it really worst place for eating.. Took 1hrz 20 minutes to prepare the food which was cold to the touch. The chef has no idea about "Kala Bhuna".. It tasted disgusting.. I Don't know where they got recipe to prepare " Kala Bhuna" with coriander leaf & black seed paste... Seriously!!!!! & the washroom door are broken..while opening & closing the door, it creates loud noise. Credit card payment was not accepted. Cash only!!! After insisting they accepted the card.. I hope the authorities will pay attention to this.

business_address: House 16, Road 4, Block F. Banani Chairmanbari Moshjid Road. Beside Banani Police Station Dhaka, 6 Rd No 4, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The place has a great environment, good food and timed services. The waiters are well behaved, very polite and disciplined. If you go with a group of people, then make a reservation to save time. The food is really good here, but it takes a bit of time to serve.

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: â€œTime Squareâ€ is a food court located on Ring Road in Mohammadpur. Itâ€™s small but very nicely organized. The place is beautifully decorated and has a lovely environment for taking photos. Each food stall offers a unique and delicious taste. We really liked it. ğŸŒ¿ Thank you.ğŸŒ¿

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: 'Time Square Food Court' is an incredibly cozy and inviting spot, perfect for a variety of dining experiences. The place features six distinct restaurants, offering a diverse range of cuisines to cater to different tastes. The seating arrangement is thoughtfully designed, providing a comfortable and pleasant atmosphere for guests. Once you place your order, youâ€™ll be given a buzzer, allowing you the freedom to relax while your food is being prepared. During this time, you can explore the space, take photos, or even enjoy some light-hearted fun at the toy stand, which adds a playful touch to the experience. The food portions are generous and satisfying, ensuring you get great value for your meal. Whether you're planning a family dinner, catching up with friends, or enjoying a quiet, intimate date, Time Square Food Court is an excellent choice. The ambiance is warm, clean, and well-maintained, making it a delightful environment to unwind and enjoy good food and company.

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Very cozy place. It has 6 different restaurant. The sitting arrangement is quite nice. After ordering they will give you a buzzer. While they prep the food you can wait and take pictures. Or play on the toy stand. Foods good in portion. A good place for family dine, friends hangout or a cozy date. Atmosphere is nice and clean.

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: I didn't know about this place and bumped here quite accidentally, that too, about an hour before they would be closing. We took beef kebab and chicken kebab with porota from a restaurant at the corner. I forgot the name of the restaurant but they were very hospitable. The food was okay. The beef kebab was a bit spicy as per our tastebud but the chicken kebab was a bit bland. Overall the environment was good as we could finish some project work there while waiting for the food and nobody disturbed us.

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Visited last month and found the ambiance quite decent for a food court. The restaurants seem to be doing their best to maintain quality and service. Since this is currently the only food court in Shyamoli-Mohammadpur, itâ€™s been attracting a lot of visitors since its opening. Tried a mix of dishes from different spots. As a fan of Melting Potâ€™s octopus fry, I had to get it againâ€”didnâ€™t disappoint. Also ordered chow mein, nachos, and chicken katsu from other restaurants. The food quality was good overall, but the prices felt a bit higher compared to other food courts.

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: the place is a combination of 6 different lil resturants . you can order from anyone one and start enjoying the atmosphere . for the peoples of sat masjid to shamoli its very near . this whol building are setup by different different resturants . but their is no parking system i think . this place is not so good for kids .

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Good Experience,kind and friendly behavior..fully satisfied ğŸ˜ğŸ˜Š

business_address: 15/C, Time Square, 5 Ring Rd, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Book a table before ordering, we ordered first and found out all of the tables that we wanted were booked (probably because of iftar time). Food was average, some had too much salt, considering the high price range. Expected better.

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The ambience is cozy and comfortable along with well behaved and polite staff. I loved their steak and cream of mushroom soup. There is complimentary snacks with salsa to munch on when you wait for your order. It was a nice experience.

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The place is very nice and the amount of food they provide is more than enough for one person. you wont regret going their. Their service is really good as well.

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: 1) Location of this restaurant is pretty hard to find (it's beside Bread and Beyond, inside Rafflesia) 2) The interior is nothing special, but a really big space to sit and walk around 3) food is expensive and less in quantity compared to the price 4) Taste is AMAZING! Everytime I am done with the meal, start craving for more ğŸ¥º

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Best Food Quality Ever!

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice food can be found here. Pudding is tasty. Also, chicken is good. The service is good. Food is cheap. It's an unsung restaurant with really high standards for food with great quantity and taste. A must try if you like regular Indian, Continental, and Thai food.

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Difficult to locate but incredibly different atmosphere once you are in the lounge. Food is decent though certain items are something you crave for. The service and the easy approach of the team of waiters is worth a mention. The lighting needs to be re-looked at as a change is always welcome

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice place for quality foods and time. The ambience is cozy and comfortable along with well behaved and polite staff. I cream of mushroom soup. There is complimentary snacks with salsa to munch on when you wait for your order. I fell in love with the place and the service and prices are outstanding It was a nice experience.

business_address: House No.: 2, Road No. 22 & 23, Gulshan R/A, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Pricey food but the decor is really impressive. Lounge also features up and coming bands from Bangladesh.

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Very average or basic restaurant in terms of food, services and atmosphere. Price is a bit higher than the regular. Staff needs to be more professional. There are car parking available to park three cars. Apart from this, anyone can use the adjacent big parking.

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: The location is very good, the food was not so good when we visited and the service was awful...that's in short...the interior is good but the serving/ catering team was completely naive...the parking area is specious and the rest rooms are averagely maintained. One good thing to add is it has a mosque in it's premises which is air conditioned and also allows female persons to pray...need to improve...

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Located beside the metro rail station, Agargaon, with nice ambiance & worst services. We ordered BBQ chicken with nan & coleslaw for 5 parsons and we had to wait about an hour. It was very annoying as the waiter told us that it might take 15-20 minutes to prepare the food. The quality of the BBQ chicken was third class, not fresh & amount is small in comparison to price. Stuffs were totally unprofessional. Consumer rights protection authority should supervise their price & quality of foods. Not recommended.

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: This restaurant is located opposite to IDB Bhabhan Environment was good Ordered Thai Soup Wonthon Set Menu And a Fresh juice Food quality not up to the mark In set Menu the Chicken Fry was too hard Maximum items from menu were unavailable

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: The placement of this restaurant couldn't be any better. All is all, the food quality is so so. However, the cost of the foods are comparatively high than usual. Overall, If you have a bit of interest in planes and like to enjoy sitting on the green field under the beautiful sky, then I would recommend you to definitely visit this place. Due to the military extra security system this place is free of eve-teasers and other uncultured cripple minded people; as you know the Bangladesh Air Force museum is its neighbour. Therefore, you would be able to enjoy your time quite well with your family-friends or beloved ones. This is also a kid friendly place. Giving the 4 stars only for the high prices. Otherwise, it's a really cool place to hangout.

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Reciew updated : 2025 Worst Red chicken fry Worst Fried rice. So before order ask them if you can taste!!! Review 2018 : An excellent Restaurent with great ambience.recomemnd others to visit here.

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Nothing Out of the Ordinary In terms of Everything, be it food or service. Food is really expensive. Felt really generic. Understaffed. Although I really gotta admit the space. It's a big one and well decorated. This is the only food option near IDB.

business_address: Begum Rokeya Avenue, Opposite IDB Bhaban, Q9HJ+G3G, Inside Bangladesh Air Force Museum, Agargaon, Dhaka 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Food was good. Specially for kabab. Ambiance was nice. Nice place for hangout. Service was awesome. Recommend to visit. Have indoor & outdoor setting capacity. Have own parking facility.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The Chicken Kebab tasted moderately good, The Lahmachun aka turkish pizza was really burnt and bitter tasting. Baklava was not bad either but was full of sugar syrup. The service was nice. Overall, the food was not worth the price of 10k.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I wonder if 3500++ is really justified for club sandwich ğŸ˜‚ 800 for Schweppes can be gulped ! I do get it itâ€™s 5 star but way overpriced compared to other 5 stars. But the rooftop experience and view is marvelous. If I am going back just for the experience. But yeah you need 20k+ for 4 for some appetizers!

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Upscale dining experience at the heart of Gulshan at Le Meridien. Awesome spot. Went with a large group and the dining experience was fantastic, as to be expected. The service was amazing and the decor was also wonderful. Really felt like I was transported to Turkey! The restaurant also connects to the hotel two-story pool area so you are able to go out and walk the perimeters if you choose while your dinner is being prepared. The food was great. Overall, really liked everything. Though my favorites were the chicken and lamb kebab. Wasn't the biggest fan of the fish and the baba ganoush and tomato didn't appeal to me as much (hummus was great). The tomato just honestly felt like tomato bortha (even that probably would have tasted better). Overall, a nice experience that I would recommend once.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: A very beautifully decorated restaurant to make you feel comfortable while you enjoy the turkish cuisine they serve. Their assortment of appetisers taste amazing with bread. The meat dishes I will say were a bit bland, in my opinion more spice and salt were required. One of the kababs in the platter were dry and difficult to chew. The cheese meatballs were a fun little treat that you can also enjoy with the bread. This was surprisingly the one thing we enjoyed the most from the table. The baklava was alright in terms of texture and authenticity but perhaps I prefer it a tad less sweeter. Overall, the food experience wasnâ€™t too bad nor too good. Will recommend the place though for it will at least be a unique experience!

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Very cozy and elegant ambience inside the restaurant. Also they have an open air poolside sitting arrangement. Regular menu are mainly Arabian styled. Although they offer different cuisines on festivals. Almost every dishes are for one person. But taste wise I can't say that it was my best experience of the flavour. I expected my taste buds to be entertained better. Average dishes are very pricy. Approximately in between 2.5-3.5 k BDT

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: We had dinner at this restaurant of La Meridian Hotel last night. We ate lamb legs, different types of kebabs, bread, rice, salads, and drinks. The lamb legs and kebab tastes were awesome. The price of food seemed too high to me. But if you think of it as a five star hotel, that's fine. I really like the interior design and view of this restaurant. There are two types of seating, indoor and outdoor. Sitting by the side of the swimming pool and eating food feels different. The staff of this restaurant is very good.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Superb view and nice food. Iâ€™ve enjoyed new launched Turkish menu. Delicious and recommended. I tried Ã‡Ã¶kertme Kebap and Hummus. Itâ€™s a traditional Turkish food with touch of Asian style. Some more garlic and herbs. I liked it.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien Dhaka 79/A Commercial Area Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I wish I had taken a photo of the food. Since I had zero expectations for this restaurant, I didnâ€™t take any pictures. I was also very careful when choosing my order because I was a bit doubtful about the food hygiene after reading previous reviews. I ordered some cold mezze and a hot prawn appetizer. Guys, the hot prawn appetizer was the best Iâ€™ve ever had. I mean, why did the prawns taste so good? MUST-TRY!! The staff member, Tanvir, helped me choose the cold mezze since I had been dealing with some stomach issues lately and was being extra cautious about the ingredients. He was incredibly knowledgeable and kind, assisting me so well. I ended up choosing a cold mezze made with poached eggs, and he even brought me small portions of two other mezze dishes on the house so I could try more. That was such a thoughtful gesture, and I was truly touched by his patience, kindness, and attentiveness.

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the best places to have Indian cuisine in Dhaka. At the 18th floor of Iqbal centre. Delicious food, nice decor and well mannered staff. The price is reasonable. Ideal place for dine out with friends and family. Also ideal for working dinners. The lift is spacious and you can enjoy the lit up Dhaka city. Parking may be an issue but they have good security guards to help you park. A must visit place.

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The restaurant located in a busy commercial building. The seating capacity is huge and well decorated. The restaurant is little old so the furniture and interior is little old fashion. Food is testy but very expensive compare to other similar type restaurant. The Indian dishes are much recommended. I have ordered biriyani, tandoori chicken, chicken 65 and paneer item. The biriyani is good for 3 person but price is 800++, tandoori chicken is 700++ for 4 piece. Additional 10% service charge increasing the price alot.

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Bukhara is the oldest best Indian restaurant in Dhaka. Their food is amazing. As starters we had , rumali papad, murgh malai kabab, mutton sheek kabab, prawn fry and fish finger from thai menu and THE CRISPY BEEF WAS SO SO GOOD! Its a must try As mains we had paneer makhani, chicken masala (forgot the exact name) bukhara special dal it was dal makhani, mutton rogan josh, murgh biryani, naan and laccha paratha. All of the items were so so good. As dessert we had kulfi.

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The thing called "Masala Bhelpuri" is our so called "Jhalmuri ( à¦à¦¾à¦²à¦®à§à§œà¦¿) " ... ğŸ™‚ I also tried their other items. I liked their Lassi most (rating it 9 out of 10) ! Also their fish items are good. And the Kulfi (rating it 6 out of 10) is also yummy â™¡ Their "Mahi Tikka Ajwani" is so yummyyy !! I'd rate it 10 out of 10 !!!! Their Papdi Chaat was so mouth watering ğŸ¤¤ (rating 100 out of 10) ... And their "Rumali Roti Masala Papad" was also good (rating 7 out of 10) but you must finish it asap !!! Summary: Must try â¡ï¸ Lassi , Mahi Tikka Ajwani (if u wanna try any fish item) and Papdi Chaat ofc !!!! Please don't try their Masala Bhelpuri ( u can try if u wanna pay 780 tk for itğŸ«©ğŸ™ )

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Absolutely high class environment. Great indian cuisine. Very enjoyable.

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Very tasty food. The real indian delicacy. Wonderfull ambience. The complimentary Panshot served after the food was awesome and exceptional. Overall itâ€™s too good..

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Place was good.. food depends on your taste bud.. they have wide range of kebap items ..

business_address: 17th Floor, Iqbal Center, 42 Kemal Ataturk Ave, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: visited this restaurant based on google review but it was bad experience there. Food is cery average. Lucknow restaurant is far better. Service quality is really bad! Not recommended!

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: The place is good for its view. It captures wide range of view from its rooftop. Food quality is good but need to wait long.

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: Sky Restaurant offers a wonderful dining experience with delicious food, a relaxing ambiance, and great rooftop views. The staff is courteous and the service is prompt. Perfect place for family dinners or a romantic evening

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: The only good thing about this restaurant is the atmosphere. Everything else is disappointing. The food is overpriced and doesnâ€™t taste that great. We went at night â€” it wasnâ€™t very crowded, which was nice â€” but honestly, the rooftop view is the only thing worth mentioning.

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: Recently I went to this restaurant to try out their viral student platter and it was totally worth it! The atmosphere is extremely good and the interior is very beautiful. On top of that the food quality was amazing as well. I didn't have much expectation from the student platter but I was wrong. All over the food was delicious and the service was satisfying as well. It becomes very crowded in the evening so finding a good spot is hard at that time. So if you want to get your favorite spot then make sure to go there early!

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: All the staffs of this restaurant are well decorated in a modern rural and natural environment. Metrorail and elevated expressway can be seen from this restaurant with 3 floors on the roof of the 12-storey building in Dhaka's busiest Farmgate. The prices and food quality are good. They have a parking facility and a small kids zone. There is a small photo session stage also. You can visit with friends & relatives, hope you like it.

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: I had the pleasure of dining at Sky Restaurant on a Friday night and enjoyed the Chichu Platter. The flavors were delightful, and the nighttime view was absolutely stunning. However, we did have to wait a considerable amount of time for our meal. The two small elevators in the building caused some inconvenience, as we had to wait quite a while to get to the restaurant. On a positive note, the live music added a great touch to the evening, making the dining experience more enjoyable. Overall, it was a pleasant evening with attentive service and a wonderful atmosphere. I highly recommend this place for a unique dining experience in Dhaka.

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: Considering the price, the food was good. But the main problem was spiciness. Especially the cashew nut salad was too spicy. The amount of vegetable noodles were okay and the vegetable pakora was tasty.

business_address: Babul Tower, Hotel Givenci, 76/A Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, 1215, Dhaka 1215, Bangladesh
review_text: I have taken the combo pack of BDT1495 for 5 people it was quite good. Let me explain the food 1. Soup quality and quantity is quite good. Unthon is quite satisfactory. 2. Chowmin taste is fine with quantity. 3. The quantity of fried rice is comparatively less if 5 adults people can take food in that case more rice required. Taste awesome. 4. Fried Chicken testy with little chily and crispy it was awesome. 5. Sizzling test and quantity is unbelievable. Finally it is @ Budget friendly @ Staffs behaviour and service is quite standard @ The sky resturant is really awesome. @ Environment is quite good @ Payments Mode: Cash / Card / MFS available. @ Parking place little bit challenging but if u visit at night after 9:45 pm if available in that case the hotels security's are helping to accommodate vehicle. @ Till 11 pm it is open. Order close at 10: 30 pm. Depending on weekend or weekdays. Finally me and my family really enjoyed a lot at Sky Resturant.

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: If you are looking for fancy decor, it's not the place, it's all about very delicious & price worthy good food with authentic Chinese taste. We tried 4 items & was really happy with the outcome. The beef in iron plate was superb so was the boiled fish in spice, Dried hot pot calamari with shrimp was very crunchy & delicious, to me roasted duck was just an okay dish, It would definitely be on top of my restaurant list.

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Never had true authentic Chinese food before and the experience in this restaurant was fantastic. All of the food was extremely flavorful and unique. But was pretty damn spicy as well. The owner is very nice and friendly. The interior of the place is sooo great can't even describe. A lot of Chinese people hangout here and have food.

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the best Chinese Food Restaurant in town. Though it's started few months back but due to Covid-19 issues didn't visited this place before. All of these items were tasty and mouth watering. Best of luck for this restaurant and it's staffs (all of them are jolly and too much helpful). Hope to go there again...

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: China hotpot restaurant. Expensive average food. Pic of sad looking duck. Update Jun 2023. Food getting more and more mediocre. Not coming here anymore

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Great food, cozy pleach, friendly service. Worthly visiting

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Great place for authentic chinese food

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: Authentic Chinese menu, good taste, quality service. They have some individual room for privacy. Open space is also excellent. Nice ambiance and quite place. Chinese owner and Chinese cook. Bengali staff, halal food.

business_address: Level 6, Anannya Shopping Complex, Dhaka 1206, Bangladesh
review_text: We went to this restaurant, and have some delicious food. The place is ok but they can make it mutch better. Service is good. They should place some big table where can sit more than 7 or 8 people together.

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I had an excellent experience dining at this Japanese cuisine restaurant! Although the owner Mr. Gan Jiaping, Chairman of Hua Da International Ltd is Chinese company, the authenticity and quality of the food were truly impressive. The 40-piece sushi platter was outstanding â€” fresh, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. We also ordered a combo, which was prepared right in front of us at the live kitchen, adding to the excitement and overall dining experience. Every bite reflected great skill and attention to detail. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys fresh and well-crafted Japanese dishes!

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Teppanyaki Dhaka truly lives up to its reputation as one of the best sushi spots in the city. The sushi is incredibly fresh and beautifully craftedâ€”each bite is packed with flavor and attention to detail. Whether youâ€™re a fan of classic rolls or something more adventurous, their menu doesnâ€™t disappoint. Ambience was crazy pretty just as my photo !!!

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food tasted good! Complementary tea, salad and desert were served! Enjoyed watching our food being prepared live! Very friendly and helpful service staffs.

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The people were very friendly and nice. They offered me to video them while cooking and showcased the sushi menu. The food was very tasty. They start with a salad and finish with fruits on the house. For the main menu we tried lamb chops. It was quite juicy. The salmon was quite good as well. Highly recommended to others to visit!

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We ordered three different sets and items from Ala Carte menu and they were served at different times which dampened the experience. However the food was excellent.

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: In one word amazing. Excellent food, excellent service, excellent ambiance. Loved the live cooking experience. 10/10 recommendations.

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food is prepared in front of you! So no space for errors or quality compromise! The Chef encourages the food lovers to take photos of the whole process. If you want to enjoy the experience of a recipe from the start this is the place for you. Great on rolls, teriyakis, udons! Pricey $$$. Time flies as the cooking is done right in front of you. It is really a wonderful experience.

business_address: 2, Sanmar Tower, 4th & 5th Floor, 38/A Rd 35, 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Fell in love with each and every item that we have ordered. We were given complimentary tea and salad as welcoming food. The entire meal ended with a surprise once we also got a complimentary dessert. Special thanks to the wonderful staff. The head chef was a delightful person to meet. Overall great food, great customer service and amazing atmosphere.

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I was extremely disappointed after visiting this restaurant. The quality of the food was extremely subpar and the items used were not fresh, rather the restaurant management used mostly stale food items to prepare the dishes. For example the shell of the fuska items were old and not crunchy at all. The amount of yoghurt used in the preparation of dahi phuska and dahi vada was extremely less and consequently the dahi based gravy of the items where very much watery and therefore tasteless. We ordered one dahi vada, dahi pushka, paratha and butter chicken. The food definitely was not on par with the price which was extremely high. The total bill for two persons for this dishes to that almost 1520 taka. Furthermore, the hygiene standards of the restaurant seems to be very poor while visiting the laboratory it was observed that the surroundings of the restaurant were unhygienic. I would strongly recommend not to visit this restaurant because of the poor quality of food and as well as the hygiene standards of the restaurant surroundings. Please do not waste your money here, rather prepared this food that home with proper dahi.

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: So sad to see dhaba at this stage So unorganised So messed up Bad bad bad service Below average food Less light doesnâ€™t make the environment cozy or aesthetic but that irritating. I feel bad for dhaba Best of luck

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Dhaba after many years and was excited to see how it had evolved since my university days when it was located on Street 11. Back then, Dhaba was a cozy, casual spot that my friends and I frequented for its affordable and tasty meals. However, the restaurant has since migrated to a new location and undergone quite a transformation. We ordered the Fuchka Platter, Dahi Fuchka Milkshake, and Pad Thai. I must say, the food was good, just as I remembered. The fuchka was crispy and flavorful, with just the right amount of spice, and the Dahi Fuchka Milkshake was a unique and refreshing take on the classic. The Pad Thai was tasty, with a nice balance of sweet, tangy, and savory flavors. However, the experience felt very different from what Dhaba used to be. The new ambiance is polished and elegant, which gives off more of a fine-dining vibe rather than the everyday eatery it once was. While I appreciate the effort to elevate the atmosphere, it feels like the charm of the old Dhaba has been lost in the process. One major downside is the price. The dishes, though delicious, are now significantly more expensive, despite being the same items from the old menu. What was once an affordable spot for students has turned into a place that feels out of reach for a casual meal. Overall, Dhaba still offers good food, but the price hike and change in vibe make it less of a go-to spot for me.

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Dhaba Banani offers a delightful Fuchka Platter with a variety of flavors like Dahi Fuchka and Naga Fuchka. The atmosphere is vibrant, making it a great spot for chaat lovers. A must-visit for street food enthusiasts! ï¿¼ ï¿¼

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: We really enjoyed our visit to Dhaba Banani. The fuchka items were great. The seafood soup was simply sublime. The appetizer sampler was a good choice. The service here was top quality with the staff being very friendly, attentive, and courteous.

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: It is probably one of the best places for Indian cuisine. This is my go-to place whenever I feel like trying some Indian dishes. Their Churmur is a must, as are the kebab items.

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Good Indian restaurant with lots of good food options to choose from. Vegetarians can eat vegetable curry, masala vegetables wrap, and many more. Non veg, there's good Kabab option. You can try the kebab platter, it's good. *** In my second visit, I didn't like the food.

business_address: House#91 Road No 13C, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Dhaba is one of the good choice for family dining. They serve likely all kind of dishes. Their food quality is 6/10 and environment is 7/10. Price is quite reasonable then other restaurants in banani. It's a average restaurant.

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Dhaka Regency Hotel & Resort, located in Nikunjaâ€‘2, Dhaka, offers convenient access to the airport and business areas. Guests appreciate the friendly staff, spacious rooms, and rooftop pool. The breakfast buffet is diverse and satisfying. Some rooms feel dated and bathrooms need renovation, and the area can get crowded. Overall, itâ€™s a reliable choice for comfort and service, though not the most luxurious option for the price.

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: had a wonderful stay at the dhaka Regency hotel in Dhaka. The environment was clean, comfortable, and very welcoming. What made my experience even better was the excellent service. I would especially like to mention Mr. Ibrahim, who was extremely polite, professional, and always ready to help with a smile. His assistance made my stay smooth and enjoyable. Truly great hospitalityâ€”I would highly recommend this hotel and their amazing staff!

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Staying at this hotel was a truly pleasant experience. From the moment I arrived, the warm welcome from the staff made me feel at home. The room was tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean, and well-equipped with all the essentials. The housekeeping team did a fantastic job every day, and the front desk was always responsive and courteous. I especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet â€” fresh, delicious, and with plenty of variety. This hotel combines comfort, quality service, and a great location. I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to come back again. Highly recommended for both business and leisure travelers.

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: They judge people based on themselves. We were sitting in the restaurant, and right behind us were two foreigners and two Bengalis, speaking so loudly that it would be acceptable in a roadside eatery or in a busy place like Hirajheel (where people naturally have to raise their voices), but absolutely unacceptable in a proper hotel restaurant. We were extremely disturbed, and even after changing tables to sit farther away, we could not find any comfort. Yet, they did not say a word to them. On the contrary, there was an attendant constantly behind them, while nobody attended to us. Even after placing our order, we had to call several times without anyone coming. Eventually, we decided to leave without paying for the food, but then someone came and managed the situation. The soup we were served was cold, which is never acceptable. I have dined at all the star-rated restaurants in Dhaka, and I have always had good experiences, but my experience at Regency was so unpleasant that, even if they offer free items, I would seriously reconsider returning. We felt insulted, especially by the slim woman in the black coat.

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently had the chance to try the buffet at Dhaka Regency Hotel, and I have to say â€” it was an amazing experience! From the moment I walked in, I was impressed by the variety and presentation of the food. There were so many different cuisines to choose from â€” Bangladeshi, Indian, Chinese, Middle Eastern, and even some Western options. What stood out to me the most was the quality and flavor of everything I tried. The kebabs were juicy and perfectly grilled, the curries were rich and flavorful, and even the pasta from the live station was spot on. I loved how fresh everything tasted, and you could really tell they put effort into making each dish special. The dessert section was another highlight for me â€” they had such a great mix of local sweets, pastries, and fruits. I honestly had a hard time choosing what to try first! The overall atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff were really friendly and attentive. It felt like they genuinely wanted guests to have a good time, which made the experience even better. All in all, I had a wonderful time at Dhaka Regencyâ€™s buffet. If you love trying different kinds of food and appreciate good quality, Iâ€™d definitely recommend checking it out. Iâ€™ll for sure be going back!

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: A business-class hotel close to the airport! The hotel offers nice Guest Rooms and Suites, Thai Spa, Health Club, Bar, Swimming pool and buffet breakfast. I never missed their breakfast. Overall I like their service.

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The front desk staff here are very friendly and always answer our questions patiently. The dining service is excellent, with the buffet and Chinese food being very close to authentic flavors, which makes it feel familiar and comforting. Overall, it has been a very pleasant stay.

business_address: Airport Rd, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: There is nothing new to say about Dhaka Regency Hotel. The rooms and food service here are truly amazing. I was especially impressed by Tamanna's behavior.

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Amazing food! Great place. Would definitely come back here again. Customer service was amazing - look out for the guy Takbir, whose recommendations were simply on point for a first timer coming here.

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice ambience. Enoki mushroom soup with glass noodles was good. Caramel pudding was an absolute delight! I took the fruit ice powder bowl because I had something similar in China which had a refreshing feel. This one is not like the Chinese one because they had different ingredients (rose petal), but it tastes good.

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Great time and hangout with team in Chinatown bbq. We like their environment, cosy and attractive decorations, and hospitality. We added our own music playlist with personal speakers and enjoyed our time. Food was pricy enough, and I love the taste of a live grilled of beef and lamb. Their grilled shrimps were great, too. Though lamb steak was a bit heavy rather than other steaks. Btw, it is recommended for people who like and dive in authentic chinese feel.

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was super good, but the amount was very little. Due to the live bbq, the place was too hot even though all the ACs were on. Loved the beef strips and the berry drink.

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Here is the honest review for the food . See the picture below from the menu and the actual picture what I got . So disappointing. After asking where is sausage and fish they both out of stock and saw the old photos doing the same . Scammers . Ordered Ramen and received cheap noodles taste like Maggie noodles . Food : 0 /5 ( I wish I could put negative 1) Service : 0 ( took 30 min ) /5 Atmosphere: 5/5 Poor restaurants.

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Very nice food with great service. Staff very co operative . Love their truffle beef and golden fried rice

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: "The food was absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection!" for food, and "The staff was attentive, knowledgeable, and made excellent recommendations" for service. Other great comments are "This is a delightful experience from start to finish" and "Your [food name] is mouth-watering". For food General: "Absolutely delicious," "This is amazing," "Wow, this is yummy," and "I love how flavorful this is". Specifics: "Everything is cooked perfectly," "The flavors work so well together," and "[The steak] was cooked to perfection!". Presentation: "The presentation was just as impressive" and "The dishes were beautifully presented". High praise: "You've outdone yourself" and "An empty plate is the highest compliment". For service Attentiveness: "Our server was attentive without being intrusive," and "The staff went above and beyond". Knowledge: "Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and offered great recommendations". Overall experience: "The staff was friendly and professional," and "The service was top-notch". Making it special: "You really made this special for us," and "You've really made our anniversary perfect".

business_address: 35 Rd 37, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I would suggest China town bbq not just for their food but for the experience. There is a qr code at every table which you scan and it will redirect you to their menu and you can order from there. The staff are very friendly and you have the option to grill the meat yourself or they can grill it for you. I would suggest to let their staff do it as theyâ€™ll get the doneness just right. I would recommend the special flavour beef slices, lamb skewers, beef skewers and grilled prawns. I like to order a side of steamed rice because it goes well with the plain rice.

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I lovely and smoothly decorated restaurant, with a very homely atmosphere! There are both indoor and outdoor seating to cater for people who is looking for more options! With good service and great food menu makes it an ideal choice for anyone looking for authentic Italian cuisine with the essence of the country! Wonderful experience overall.

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Top notch service. Awesome food. Eye soothing environment. Want a calm & noise free restaurant, here it is. Each & every foods we tried was amazing. As per my taste bud. I will must go there in sunshine time. It must looking great.

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: It was a very pleasant experience, visiting this place. Perfect for a romantic getaway. We took lasagna and a four cheese pizza. Both were good but the pizza required more flavor. It tasted bland at times. Maybe it's my taste bud. Will definitely visit them again.

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the most beautiful places if you are planning to visit with your loved ones. It is a perfect photogenic place both in indoor and outdoor. Pinacolada The price of this drink is 450 plus plus and this one is definitely recommended. Sea shell chowder The price is 649 plus plus It is a combination of butter, sweet corn,cream and shrimp

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food: we tasted pasta Lazarus and lemon chicken with Mexican rice and vegetables. Both are fresh and delicious and quality of food was great. Atmosphere: I think atmosphere and interior of this is the best inside Dhaka. Absolutely awesome interior and feels like you are in old English house. At outside, the tree and the lighting remembered my old house. I personally thanks to the owner of this restaurant and his/her creative mind. Price: Quite high but definitely worth to try. Personal opinion, try this restaurant and you won't regret.

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A very good restaurant for all kind of people . They have separate rooms for family which I think is missing in most of the restaurant. I like their separate room idea for big family dinning because it maintain some kind of privacy and a family can easily enjoy their food without being uncomfortable. They also have space in outdoor which is also a smoking zone which I think is pretty good for date or friendly hangouts because in inside space the environment was pin drop silent and very cozy . I also loved their food . Their beef pepperoni pizza was so good we loved it . Crispy chicken pizza was kind of average . We also love their starters . The amount of calamari fries was very generous.

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Beautiful interior, very calm and relaxing environment. Food was amazing, the price was worthy comparing ambience and location. Best place to visit with friends and families. This place is so photogenic also.â¤ï¸

business_address: 9/A (NW1) (Ground Floor, House no: 88, Road No-53, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Excellent environment. Beautiful paintings hanging on the wall. People who enjoy books over the phone must go there. Both indoor and outdoor dining options are there. Normally outdoor is for smokers. Staffs were friendly, I ordered some foods with lots of if's and but's but they prepared the food according to my wish. Foods were tasty (Unless you hate Italian). Can be recommended to another friend.

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I ordered Nachos and Meat Box from them tgrough Pathao food. Food quality was average. They have varieties of foods in their menu. Indian, Italian, Bengali all are found in this restaurant. So anyone can try. But the food is so so. Not too much delicious. In this price range it will be seems OK for me.

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: They are located in the prime location of pragati sarani, As a Bangali item based restaurant I never had that much expectation from them, but their food quality and quantity was Marvelous compare to price and location. Service was pretty much good also. I must suggest you to try their special milk tea if You're a tea lover.

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Great Food & Friendly Service, but Plan Ahead! I've eaten here so often and tried various dishes â€“ the taste is consistently above average. Their manager and staff are incredibly friendly, which always makes for a pleasant experience. A big plus are their add-on items like jorda, mayonnaise, and sauces; they really add an extra touch to the meal. My only minor suggestion would be for more vegetable options at dinner. I'd love to see that considered! The environment can feel a bit congested, though I understand there might not be much space available nearby. Also, be prepared for a long wait during peak times, so it's definitely better to order your food over the phone for pickup or delivery. Also I have taken a parcel service of a family program, found it very much cost effective. Overall, a solid choice for good food and excellent service, just be mindful of the space and potential wait times!

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Very poor management, no quality of work of the staff, less quantity of food according to the price and there is a matter of increasing the price day by day, sometimes the staff in the restaurant treat the customers badly. There is a lack of proper management. Their staff number is excessive but compared to that the quality of service is even worse than in low quality restaurants. If possible, you should not go to the restaurant.

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We ordered on foodpanda. For this reason packaging quality matters. And they did it perfectly. Packaging quality was good. Nun was well wrapped by foil paper and it was hot enough even after 50 min. Nun quality was good. Ordered BBQ Chicken half. Quality and test was good according to price. Ordered extra mayonnaise with these. Everything was good but these mayonnaises was not up to the mark. Really disappointed with the mayonnaise test and quality. I don't recommend extra mayonnaise from them as it will be waste of money. Overall recommend. Overall service and quality was good. Delivery was fast. BBQ Chicken and normal nun is recommended.

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Do not order via pathao, ordered ayer and got rui fish also chicken was bad too.

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Must try item is their Shawarma ğŸ¥™ . Their beef khechuri is good average taste. Faluda taste was good. All food price is reasonable. Recommended.

business_address: QCRF+MXJ, Bus-Stand, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I ordered chicken bbq and Sharma by foodpanda.It was a amazing food,i ever ate.ğŸ˜‹ All food items were also good. i loved itğŸ’š

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Really liked their food. Though their variation in the menu is a bit disappointing. Over the years it has been almost same. The ambiance is really nice & cozy. Also very near from the airport which gives easy access when taking the customers for dinner when they a flight to catch. Overall the place is recommended. Some of the prices can be a bit high but overall it is good.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The food is good compared to the other places in Dhaka. Ordered this seafood pasta, the pasta is aldente, but the seafood is not fresh. (Or maybe is the fact that the seafood is imported) The restaurant atmosphere is nice with Italian music all the time, tidy and clean. The staff is welcoming and trying to be very good and caring.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Loved their Pizza & Bruschetta. Calamari was ok. But amazing view towards the runway of airport & all around.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Staff not respecting customers opinion they just believe what they say and donâ€™t listen Never try the steak ğŸ¤® steak is marinated in smelly garlic and spices.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Eggplant parmigiana was exquisite!! Seafood linguine better than in Italy - a MUST TRY

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Talking about food taste It's true Italian. There is no guest, impurity is excellent. Good atmosphere, little people are universal, both taste and service.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: The restaurant atmosphere is nice with Italian music all the time, tidy and clean.

business_address: Le MÃ©ridien, Dhaka 79, Dhaka 1229, Bangladesh
review_text: Look at the taxes! Service Charge 10% + VAT 20% + SD 20% + Alc VAT 15%!!!
