review_text: Its one of the popular cafe in BTI Premier Plaza Shopping mall Food zone! It has a nice environment for passing quality time with friends and family! Regularly I tried their coffee and chow mein! Quality is fine! I also had there cashew nut salad which was a best one. ğŸš»separate restroom facilities available in this food zone!

business_address: Leve-3, BTI Premier Shopping Mall, Shop-6 Progoti Shoroni, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: They make coffee with real beans! I was a bit skeptical, so I asked. ğŸ˜… The coffee was really good. So was the interior. Will definitely come here again in the future.

business_address: Leve-3, BTI Premier Shopping Mall, Shop-6 Progoti Shoroni, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Burgers and drinks are too expensive.

business_address: Leve-3, BTI Premier Shopping Mall, Shop-6 Progoti Shoroni, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Great espresso coffee, cappuccino, delicious foods, cozy venue, heart touching hospitality, great venue for birthday parties and more.

business_address: Leve-3, BTI Premier Shopping Mall, Shop-6 Progoti Shoroni, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: An exclusive Coffee centre. You can offer your VIP guest for take coffee.

business_address: Leve-3, BTI Premier Shopping Mall, Shop-6 Progoti Shoroni, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Tea ... Just wow

business_address: Leve-3, BTI Premier Shopping Mall, Shop-6 Progoti Shoroni, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Supportive staffs & convenient venue

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Cinnamon Restaurant offers a pleasant dining experience with a refined ambience, quality food, and professional service. The dishes are well-presented, flavorful, and served in a timely manner. Pricing is slightly premium, but justified by the overall standard. Suitable for family dining and small gatherings.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Food was quite good. We ordered 2 fried rice(1:3)- 350 tk each. 1 chinese vegetables and 1 Chicken sizzling. Fried rice was decent enough, vegetables was average and chicken sizzling was delicious. But the service was too poor, waiter wasnâ€™t friendly at all

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Ambience is average and service is also good, waiters are friendly. I have tried only one item from their menu that is (Thai Noodles), food price is comparatively higher and quality seems poor to me.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: good place for lunch. food was tasty but they have to focus on the food's hygiene issue because we have got some blood inside the chicken piece. we found fried chicken was not cooked well. we have also complained about it. interestingly they serve pudding to us for that complain. interior is nice. behave of waiters is satisfying..

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This restaurant is just 5 min walk from my home. It's an okay restaurant, as this restaurant's target customers are students. I was there regular customer during my university time (2008). Don't expect too much from them.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food was very disgusting.. we order hyderabadi mutton biryani . In the biryani there was a lot of nuts.. I was allergic to nuts... And the mutton was not proper cooked... It was like a metal ... In the biryani too much garlic smell and too spicy ... We spend like a 900$ the The money was wasted once. I say they should improve both the restaurant and the food. They should improve the quality of the food.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good food with price a bit on the high side considering the quality you receive. Popular among adjacent office staffs and BRAC University students it has a decent range of choices in the menu.

business_address: Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Once upon a time, when BRAC University used to be at Mohakhali, it was our go-to place if we wanted to have something special. There were not many restaurants nearby as there are now, so this place actually was special. Pretty decent Bangla-Chinese foods, and they used to have really good aloo paratha there (not sure if they still serve those, so soft and delicious). And there was some kind of Garlic Chicken - another wonderful dish to try!

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The food quality is good compared to other restaurants in Bangladesh. However, it does not match the standards of Arabian countries. The service is excellentâ€”very welcoming, friendly, and cooperative. The atmosphere could be slightly improved, with better ventilation to enhance the fragrance. Washroom facilities are available but space is limited.

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Recommended place for Arabian food. The ordered foods were really delicious. The environment is perfect for gossip. Stuff behaviours are also good. However the price seems too High. You may not be disappointed cause the food is really very tasty. They also have some parking spaces.

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We, a group of colleagues, went out for lunch together. The location is good and easily recognizable. The quality of the food is good, but the waiting time is quite long. Communicating with the staff taking the orders was a bit tough. We sat upstairs, and the interior environment was nice. Overall, the food was good, and the service was satisfactory. The handwashing facilities were also decent.

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I grew up in Saudi Arabia, and while I understand itâ€™s hard to replicate the same quality, the food here was shockingly bad. The chicken had no flavor and was completely inedible. We ordered the Attin platter, and the shrimp tasted like it had been frozen for agesâ€”absolutely no flavor. The lamb chops were chewy, like gum, and lacked any seasoning or taste. Truly disappointing. Btw hummus with meat was good.

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the best places to try Lebanese food in Dhaka. Their service is top notch, their food tastes great and the dining atmosphere is very pleasant. They even have floor carpet sit down style dining rooms for the most authentic Arabian food experience. Highly recommended. Expect quite a hefty bill but you can go as 4 people and easily split the bill for around 1k each or even less. They had Mandi too but itâ€™s worth it if an entire group of 14-16 people all plan on dining as a group. Parking is on the street and so you might not always find a spot to park. One complain I have is that they have mosquitos and flyâ€™s that bother us during dining and they can easily mitigate it if they use an electric fly trap in all their rooms.

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of my favourite places to dine in with my family and friends!! And always satisfied with their hospitality and food quality

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Oh my god! This restaurant is scamming people. Their foods are not similar to the actual Arabian foods. They have increased the price of all the foods and decreased the quality. What a shame! I tried this 1450 tk menu and got 2 pebble-like mutton pieces which tasted very bad, the sauce was tasteless, the salad was soggy, rice had no akhni. People who are given 5 stars have never tried the actual Arabian food. This restaurant doesn't deserve 4 starts. Strongly Not RECOMMENDED.

business_address: House 9 Rd No 27, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Shocking Khabsa! We ordered Khabsa but unfortunately it was not khabsa. It tasted like Indian Chicken which was given on the top of Khabsa. It was really embarrassing for me as I have suggested the restaurant as Arabic. And the guest was the ex-employee of Saudi Airlines. He told me that was just okay. But no Arabic herbs or spices even ingredients been used in the dish. But he appreciated the Baklava (Turkish). Hope the authority will be more caring for the authentic dishes and cuisines. That's all from my side. Thank you!

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We were somewhat surprised with the menu and the taste as well, didn't really expect it to be that good. Enjoyed every bit of their Mediterranean buffet dinner. From salads to desserts, items were good in taste to presentation. Well trained staff and a vibrant interior made the dine better. I believe, we found a great addition to our family dinner choices at Dhaka.

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: So nice ambience. I went there to celebrate my birthday with my wife. overall food quality was top notch. Their behavior was also too good and Mr Ezakael assited us to select food which is so impressive. I wish Mr. Ezakael a very good luck for his upcoming days.

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We tried their Sunday buffet lunch and loved their food! The mutton and grilled fish were my favorite. The attendants were warm, helpful, and very attentive to the guests. The decor is nice. The tables could have been more spaces out.

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Had the B1G2 lunch buffet for 4299/- only. The taste of almost every item was very good, well cooked and fresh, better than any dedicated buffet place. Truly worth the price. Service and atmosphere is also good, though it gets busy during the holidays. Water and watermelon mojito is also included in the buffet which spares costs of buying expensive drinks. Though coffee is not included. The only complaint is that the number of main dishes is limited. Specially Bangla Chinese items are very limited which is disappointing. There is a good selection of desert items though and they taste better than most bakeries. Cashew nut salad should have been included too.

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: We have had breakfast their multiple times. Havenâ€™t had any other meals. The ambiance is exquisite, service truly 5 star. They turned the ac temperature up at our request as our young one was cold. Without any fuzz. Heated the juice to room temperature for my kid without losing their smile. Their buffet is elaborate and all (bar none) the items are awesome. I wonâ€™t go item by item as all the items are perfectly cooked. We almost always find issue with the amount of salt in the cold cuts. Here: perfect! We had a B1G2 offer which took the expense down to normal level. If youâ€™re looking for a good breakfast experience, no a great breakfast experience, you neednâ€™t go anywhere else.

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Went here to have their iftar come dinner buffet. Honestly, when you enter the dining area, you can tell they placed more tables just to accommodate extra orders, and made the place just overpacked. The food options were good but when there's a queue for almost all items, it just takes away all the good vibes from the variety of food on offer. The over crowded-ness just added to all the woes, it was difficult to even walk back to our table after having been able to successfully hunt and secure the food. They had a good selection of items but alas due to the traffic pertaining to the major items, was able to secure maybe a bit of the good stuff. Perhaps I need to visit them during normal time to fully value the food and its quality. But definitely never going back if they continue to overfill like this. They had praying rooms on the second floor which was a good thing.

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The seafood fest was a big disappointment and nothing like the videos advertised. Food: A few things were decent â€” the sushi, some Indian curries, and 2â€“3 desserts stood out. The fruit and cold cuts were fresh. But beyond that, it went downhill. The â€œlive seafoodâ€ section didnâ€™t even have lobster, tuna, or pomfret. The large pieces on display were just for show. The grill served only salted fish, completely dry, without even a slice of lime. The live station was just a stir-fry where you had to search for seafood. The so-called paella was basically polau with a few oysters on top. Most of the other fish dishes simply tasted bad. Service: The staff werenâ€™t rude, but the service was nonexistent. Our table didnâ€™t have glasses, and when I asked, they only brought one. When clearing plates, they placed all the cutlery onto the dirty plate. When we asked for fresh cutlery (since we didnâ€™t know which â€œtrash spoonâ€ belonged to whom anymore), they just pointed out a few and we had to ask again. Even settling the bill was a hassle â€” after asking three times, my friend finally had to joke, â€œShould we just leave without paying?â€ before anyone brought it.

business_address: Renaissance Dhaka Gulshan Hotel, 78 Gulshan Ave, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The place has a great ambience. If you're looking to spend a quality night with someone special, this is the place. It's quiet, not very noisy. The staff are very friendly and professional. Really liked the service they provided. The food was really great. There's no question about the quality of the food. They were very fresh and tasty. But for 5,000 BDT you would expect a bit more variety in the food. There were less options then we expected. But overall it was a good experience.

business_address: 4, House 10 Road, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food quality and price both are quite exceptional for a place like Banani.

business_address: 4, House 10 Road, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh

business_address: 4, House 10 Road, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh

business_address: 4, House 10 Road, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh

business_name: Japanese Restaurant ICHI in Banani, Dhaka.
business_address: House No 32, Level- 2, Block- G Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Recently had the pleasure of dining at ICHI Japanese Restaurant in Dhaka, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience! From the moment I walked in, the ambiance instantly set the tone for an authentic Japanese dining experience. The cozy, traditional setting, with its soft lantern lights and wooden accents, made me feel like I had stepped straight into a restaurant in Japan. Now, let's talk about the food â€“ it was absolutely incredible! The menu offers a variety of dishes that made my taste buds dance. I tried the Rainbow Roll, and it was nothing short of perfection. The freshness of the ingredients really stood out. The Sirloin Steak was another highlight â€“ cooked to perfection and bursting with flavors that left me craving more. Itâ€™s clear that the chef here puts a lot of care and attention into every dish. What truly impressed me was the friendly and attentive staff, who made sure my dining experience was nothing less than top-notch. Their recommendations were spot on, and they made me feel right at home. Whether you're a regular Japanese cuisine lover or trying it for the first time, ICHI has something to satisfy everyone's palate. And if you're like me and sometimes prefer dining at home, ICHI's delivery service is just as great, maintaining the same high quality as dining in. I can't recommend ICHI enough â€“ itâ€™s a hidden gem in the heart of Dhaka that deserves a visit. Whether for a special occasion or a casual meal, youâ€™ll find yourself coming back for more.
business_name_normalized: japanese restaurant ichi in banani, dhaka.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Food is below average. . . . Quality is bad. Chicken Cashewnut Salad had no chicken & it was like a fruit salad. The soup is almost plain (very less chicken/prawn). Even the waiters were very unprofessional. Seems like they were very disgusted if customer comes. The only place is i like is the environment and place.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: It's fantastic. A beautiful outdoor. AC indoor. Service is also good. Food was tasty. Overall I liked. Recently we arranged a party here.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: I had a wonderful dining experience at the Rooftop Restaurant at Bangladesh Parjatan Corporation. The ambiance was amazing, with a stunning view from the rooftop. Foods are tasty actually very similar to other Parjatan Corporation restaurants I have visited. I particularly enjoyed the serene atmosphere and the amazing rooftop view of agargaon. But sadly did not find any sitting arrangement under open sky. Whether it's a romantic dinner or a casual meal with friends, this rooftop restaurant is definitely worth a visit.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Location of this restaurant is outstanding. their inside decoration is good but less spacious. Most importantly their food taste is of average category but they charge extremely high price.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Parjatan Rooftop Restaurant offers a unique dining experience with its rooftop setting and panoramic views of the city. The restaurant's pros include its scenic ambiance, providing a beautiful backdrop. The rooftop setting allows guests to enjoy their food while taking in the cityscape. However, there are a few cons to consider when dining at Parjatan Rooftop Restaurant. Food is average. Staff are well-behaved but service is not great. Internal decoration is poor. Personally I do not recommend this restaurant.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the finest rooftop restaurant in Dhaka. The place is very nice and the view also very nice. Very low crowds all time, I think because of government organization own the restaurant. But you can visit anyone like family, friend, meeting. Food quality and quantity is good but price is higher then regular Bangladeshi restaurants. Recommend everyone for visit.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: A neat and tidy cozy place for dinning. Has provisions for dinning at the OPEN TERRACE. At night time could be a good and probably an only option in the surrounding area. Since it's a govt. entity the food offered here are of REASONABLE PRICE. food quality is okay, could be better but it's valid for the price range. Menu has a varried range of items but not always available.

business_address: Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Not recommended. Price is illogical. Even the menu is useless. Limited foods available

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: The CafÃ© Rio Mirpur branch offers a good buffet experience with plenty of food options to choose from. There are lots of items available, and the price is quite reasonable compared to other buffet restaurants. The environment is nice overall, and the staff are polite and attentive. However, the restaurant is located in a rather congested area, which makes parking and entry a bit difficult, especially during busy hours. While the variety of food is impressive, one major issue is how the popular dishes like beef and kachchi biryani are handled. As soon as the dishes are refilled, a few people rush to take all the meat, leaving only rice or pilaf behind for others. It feels like you have to fight to get a fair share of the main items. The management should control this better â€” perhaps by having the staff serve these popular items directly when the restaurant is crowded. The fish dishes were also not very tasty and could use more flavor. Despite these problems, CafÃ© Rio Mirpur still offers good value for money with its reasonable prices and wide selection. With a few improvements in food management and seating space, it could become an excellent dining spot in Mirpur.

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Had an amazing experience at this buffet! The food was fresh, flavorful, and there were so many options to choose fromâ€”something for everyone. The staff was friendly and kept everything clean and well-stocked. From starters to desserts, everything tasted great. And the atmosphere was really cozy too! Definitely coming back again. Highly recommend to anyone who loves good food in a nice setting. ğŸ½ï¸ğŸ¨ That review is needed to get a free ice-cream. Anyways, I'd rate it 6.5/10. The food really ain't that bad but not too good either.

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: My recent visit to The Cafe Rio was unfortunately a very disappointing experience. I had high hopes for their buffet, but it fell short on multiple fronts. The most significant issue was the subpar food taste. Many of the dishes seemed bland and lacked the flavor I would expect from a buffet restaurant. It felt like the quality was sacrificed for quantity, but even the quantity was lacking. Speaking of which, the number of food items on the buffet was surprisingly small. The selection was very limited, and many of the popular items were missing. It felt like I was paying for a full-scale buffet but only getting a fraction of the options. To make matters worse, the restaurant takes a long time to refill the empty food trays. I found myself waiting several minutes for a simple item to be replenished, which was very frustrating. The overall environment is not good. The dining area felt cramped and noisy, and the decor was unappealing. It lacked the ambiance that would make for a pleasant dining experience. To top it all off, the washrooms were not clean. This is a major concern for any restaurant, as it reflects poorly on their overall hygiene standards. Given the poor food quality, limited selection, slow service, and unappealing environment, I would not recommend The Cafe Rio. I left feeling that I did not get my money's worth and would not be returning.

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Visited The Cafe Rio on October 10 (Friday) with my friends Payel and Robiul. Honestly, it was a disappointing experience. The buffet items were very limited, and most dishes tasted bland â€” lacking real flavor. Food trays werenâ€™t refilled on time, which made things worse. The dining area felt cramped and noisy, and even the washrooms werenâ€™t clean. Overall, the place didnâ€™t live up to expectations in terms of food, service, or environment. Rating: 6.5/10. Wouldnâ€™t recommend unless they improve quality and hygiene.

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: The buffet was average overall. I only liked their crab and kachhi hash bhuna. The beef was below average, and the other items, including the desserts, were quite ordinary.

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Today I had a very disappointing experience at The Cafe Rio, Mirpur Branch. Iâ€™ve dined twice before at their Uttara branch and received excellent service there. However, this time was different. In August, they offered a â€œBuy One Get Oneâ€ deal for students at 999 BDT, which attracted a huge crowd. Unfortunately, the management was clearly unprepared to handle the situation. People were rushing for food, and there was no proper system of refilling. It often took 10â€“12 minutes for an empty dish to be refilled, leaving customers waiting with plates in hand. The staff also seemed overwhelmed with cleaning and serving, which made the dining experience very unpleasant. Honestly, if a restaurant cannot manage customer flow properly, then why announce such an attractive offer? As for the food, it was average at best. The environment was extremely noisy since the place was packed mostly with students, making it difficult for anyone to enjoy a proper meal. I sincerely hope the management will take these issues seriously and improve their service in the future.

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: Solid 3 but no more. The place is crowded, can get kinda loud. The food takes a lot of time to get refilled compared to the seats/guests they have available/present. Price is reasonable compared to the amount of food types available. The quality is average, nothing to write home about.

business_address: 7th Floor) Holding No. 3, Sultan Mansion, Begum Rokeya Ave, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: We booked this buffet for the annual get together of our office colleague. When, we entered in the floor after the Magrib prayer, it was like a gorgeous atmosphere welcoming us to receive. The dazzling reflecting light with the jam-packed crowd made the total environment much heavyer than any other time. The dishes were in a queue one by one and everyone was in the serial to choose their favorite one. We were also in the line to grab of first bite. Since, this was first visit in any buffet ever, I was overwhelmed with both of joy and anxious. I took a small portion of every categories of dishes for preliminary testing to find the best one. Since, there were enough cold drinks, I, along with my colleagues enjoyed a lot while eating and drinking. After testing all of the items, I preferred to eat only the beef curry and hot Thai soups with crabs and shrimps. The other guests who also in there, not only eating the teste of the food but also enjoying the vibes of that place by clicking photos in every corner of the places to capture that moment memorable. We also clicked many photos with our colleagues along with their family members. Since, this was the memorable moment for me in my life which I can't ever forget. Overall, it was a nice place to the family get together and reunion. So, those, who wanna go their for the first time, I would recommend them to must try the beef curry, Thai soup with crabs and shrimps.

business_address: 72 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Food was good! Wouldn't say it was great. The prawn on toast was the winner for me. Their American Chopsuey was a little too sweet for my taste and the rest of the items were all okay.

business_address: 72 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The restaurant may be tucked suspiciously in a commercial building, but the food is good, the waiters and atmosphere is good too, maybe this is why the restaurant stood around for 40+ years? Truly a Gulshan classic!

business_address: 72 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: If you're craving for tasting the old-school/local Chinese dishes which bring childhood memories, this place is a must to go. They are in service for a very long time. They started their business in Gulshan a few years after the liberation war and recently shifted in Banani road 11. Their food still tastes the same. Few old staffs are still there. Not an authentic Chinese restaurant, no eye catching decor or anything but if you have visited this restaurant before the restaurant boom in Dhaka, then you'll obviously feel nostalgic about both their food and the decor.

business_address: 72 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The quality was terrible, lacking in taste, and, notably, the Fried Shrimp had a slightly rotten smell. Would not recommend at all. The food was the worst ever, and the prices were too high.

business_address: 72 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Just an ordinary Chinese restaurant at Banani Road 11. Before this restaurant was called only Cathay. But now, it is known as New Cathay. I don't know, if the ownership has changed or not. Anyway, the food quality is 7 out of 10. Decoration and ambiance, just way too simple. But the good thing is, the floor area is big and sitting arrangements are nice. Distance between one table from another one is quite far. So you can keep your privacy easily. Staff are just doing their job, i guess. This restaurant needs some advertment and some renovation. Location wise, it is obviously in a very good position.

business_address: 72 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: Its a 45 year old restaurant - a Classic when it comes to Chinese food in Dhaka, and now more like a hidden gem. My family & I have been visiting Cathay for over 20 years & if anyone is from North Dhaka, I highly recommend visiting this place at least once in their life.

business_address: 72 Road No. 11, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: The ambiance is serene with calming lighting, whereby the diners can enjoy a peaceful dining experience with family and friends. The sitting area is arranged cleverly whereby groups of 4, 6, 8 and more can sit comfortably. All together, around 40+ people can dine at once when its houseful. In this post I am going to tell you how this restaurant beautifully served us a pan of sizzling beef which actually was something else molded to give us the impression of feeding us the meat. Therefore, please read until the last. Orders were: Lemon soup- We tried this soup because we wanted to try out a light clear soup with a spicy and sour taste. Every spoonful was soury, light and packed with chicken and prawns and spring onions. Serves 5 pax at most. Rating 17/20; Taka 520. American chopsuey- The noodles were a tad bit more fried than it should have been that gave out a little burned taste. Nonetheless, the gravy served with the chopsuey was ordinarily tasty, topped with a properly seasoned fried egg with sunny side up. Rating 15/20; Price Taka 585; Served 5 pax. Sweet and Sour Fish- They used what we call in Bangla â€œBhetkiâ€ to make this dish. The taste of the gravy was nicely balanced between the sweet and the sour although the fish still reeked of itself, I guess they did not wash the fish properly prior to cooking. Rating 13/20; Price Taka 575; Serving size 4-6 pax. Special fried rice- The rice was perfectly fried, seasoned and packed with chopped vegetables, chicken bits, prawns and scrambled eggs. Rating 18/20; Price Taka 525; Serving Size 5-6 pax. Mixed Greek Wok- Stir fried subtly flavoured mixed vegetables are a delight that complemented the rice beautifully. Price- Taka 495; Rating 17/20; Serving size 4-5 pax. Sizzling Beef: Could anything go wrong with a pan of sizzling beef? It looks delectably appetizing, initial smell is heavenly that you want to take your fork to dig into the deliciousness. But New Cathay has pathetically failed in this dish; Most of the shreds of meat were not beef but rather flour molded and fried and cooked in the gravy and served on the sizzling pan. The meat pieces were soggy and did not at all taste and look like meat. Price Taka 645; Rating 10/20; Serving size 5 pax. Lemon Water- One of the most healthiest drinks you could order at a restaurant that could burn your fat while you dine and at the same time spoiling your taste if you are in the mood to indulge into delicious food. A moderately sized freshly squeezed lemon juice was served with a bottle of â€œMUMâ€ water, whereby the drinker can mix the lemon juice with the water as many times as the water in the bottle finishes. Price Taka 120; Rating 17/20. The waiters were well mannered and their service was moderately good. All prices were exclusive of VAT 15% and Service Charge 10%.

business_address: PARADISE PLAZA, PLOT NO. 6 & 11 MIRPUR-1,, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the best places in Dhaka if you're looking for Thai and Chinese cuisine. Lots of variety and diversity in their menu here. Last time I went, I ordered their Signature Special Chowmein, which amounts to 590 /= BDT. It was flavourful and rich, the portion was huge as well. There's many options here. You can order a wide variety of East Asian dishes here. They're generous with the quantity too. The tables are good. They have chilli lime juice as a side on each table, which enhances the flavour of any dish. You can also ask for extra portions of any ingredient in your dish. This is a popular place for families to gather. Multiple families often come here to meet up and reconnect. The atmosphere,thus, can get quite noisy with the kids playing around. All in all, definitely a top tier restaurant in Dhaka.

business_address: PARADISE PLAZA, PLOT NO. 6 & 11 MIRPUR-1,, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: The price of the food is high but the taste is below average. Should be more better according to the price.

business_address: PARADISE PLAZA, PLOT NO. 6 & 11 MIRPUR-1,, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: This is one of the restaurants I went few times. I always feel home with the hospitality of the owner and staffs. Staffs are very humble to customers. Always serve with smiles and love. They even helped me with sitting! Very nicely decorated and good quality sitting arrangement. Music, light all are perfect for spending quality time with family, friends and others. Food quality and test is very good. Food proud reasonable. Very good washrooms. They keep the restaurant and washrooms super clean. Street parking is available. You can also go there by public transit. Highly recommend to check this restaurant.

business_address: PARADISE PLAZA, PLOT NO. 6 & 11 MIRPUR-1,, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: FOOD: Quality is average. Doesn't taste bad but nothing special either. AMBIENCE: Large space. Can accommodate parties for large group of people. Classic Bangla Chinese look. FACILITIES: Has A Kid's PLAY ZONE. SERVICE: Average. PRICE: Mid range $$

business_address: PARADISE PLAZA, PLOT NO. 6 & 11 MIRPUR-1,, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: On the 27th of April, 2023, we dined at this restaurant which had nice decor, but unfortunately was quite crowded when we arrived at around 9 pm. Additionally, there was a kids' playground nearby, causing consistent noise that might be bothersome for those seeking a quiet dinner. Unfortunately, the service wasn't good, and we had to wait a long time for our food. It's possible that a party was taking place, and the staff was under pressure, leaving little time for other customers. However, if this was the case, it raises the question of why they would continue with side service while already stretched thin. After waiting for approximately an hour, we received our food. Although we had no complaints about the food, we were disappointed with the soup, which tasted like drinking water with a hint of Thai soup flavor. The restaurant needs to improve the quality of the soup. One thing we noticed was that the food menu items were mainly designed for three people. As we were a group of four people, it wasn't enough for us. When we asked the waiter if they could prepare a dish for four people, he said, "You have to order the item again, Sir." We found this to be unfair. For instance, the mixed fried rice cost 360 Taka for three people, so to serve four people, we would need to order the dish again, making it a total of 360 + 360 = 720 Taka. It was very disappointing, but we had no other choice but to order two fried rice dishes. Furthermore, when it came to ordering fried chicken, we were informed that they only had options for six pieces or twelve pieces - nothing in between. This showed that they were prioritizing business over customer satisfaction. The restaurant should reconsider its menu, as we saw many families of four people facing similar issues. Thank you.

business_address: PARADISE PLAZA, PLOT NO. 6 & 11 MIRPUR-1,, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: We are having Chinese food here for a long time from my childhood. Their food price and the quantity is really good. The tastes of the food is good also. I really like them over xinxian. Also their environment is good as well.

review_text: Thangabali is a Indian and Chinese food restaurant located in M1 food court, Mirpur 1 beside Aarong. They offer a variety of food, they have long food menu. Here you have to pay first before eating. The place is quite crowded because it is a food court with many restaurants.

The nachos cost 200 taka, which I felt was too much for the quality of the food."

review_text: Here I am writing about the CocaCola sponsored food court not about Thangabali. For spicy and average standard food can be availed. Street car park available. So many food shops. Some other food shops are around. But all of them sells spicy food at their own varieties and standard. Have a little doubt about health safety for the used spices and ingredients. For snack type small bites this place is nice with friends. BSTI or any other food standard measured organization lacks in our country else these sorts of food courts would have been better in service.

review_text: Hakka Dhaka's foods are great if you select wisely. Best items: egg fried rice, hakka noodles, lemongrass chicken set menu, Noodles set menu-A, prwan on toast, Mongolian beef. Noodles Set menu-A: Two chicken lemons grass dumpling, noodles and Mongolian beef. The beef comes as an option, u can choose chicken or prwan as well. The soup was so so.

business_address: Chef's Table - Gulshan 2, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: This Chinese Pan Asian restaurant serves good quality food with delicious flavors. They have tasty platters with a variety of options. The rice, noodles, dumplings, prawn noodles, and beef dishes are well-cooked and very delicious. It's a great place to enjoy different Asian cuisines.

business_address: Chef's Table - Gulshan 2, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Got the Set B with Mongolian Beef and Sweet n Sour Prawn. Their Mongolian Beef has been a long time favorite of mine and it didnâ€™t disappoint this time either. The prawn was pretty average and more sweet than sour in my opinion. The wrapped prawns are another favorite of mine and tasted fresh, albeit a bit thin. The dumplings were average. Overall, at 675 BDT, Hakka Dhakaâ€™s set meals are a safe and filling option at Chefâ€™s Table.

review_text: From the moment we walked in, this restaurant impressed us on every level. The atmosphere is warm, inviting, and beautifully designedâ€”perfect for a relaxing meal or a special night out. Soft lighting, tasteful decor, and comfortable seating made the entire experience feel upscale yet cozy. The food was absolutely outstanding. Every dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. You can tell they use fresh, high-quality ingredients and take pride in their cooking. Whether you're into hearty mains or lighter fare, the menu has something for everyoneâ€”and everything we tried was delicious. What truly elevated the evening was the staff. Friendly, attentive, and professional, they made sure we felt welcome and well taken care of without being overbearing. They were happy to offer recommendations and made the entire experience seamless from start to finish. Overall, this restaurant checks every box: fantastic food, lovely ambiance, and top-notch service. Highly recommend, and weâ€™ll definitely be coming back! Our Birthday program was wonderfully complete as because of you guys. Thank you so much.

review_text: Good ambience. Good service. Average tasting pricey food. We ordered nachos (BDT 580), and Roha platter (BDT 1499). The nachos, taco, burrito, and enchiladas had the exact same filling. It was quite bland and forgetful. The quantity and quality do not justify the high price they are charging. Overall, I won't come back for the food.

business_address: Plot 77, level, 5 Road 3-4, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Savoring Turkish Flavors at Pavo Restaurant â€“ Bashundhara We recently walked into Pavo Restaurant, a new gem at Bashundhara that's been around for about 5 months. As someone who's lived in Oman and grown up loving Turkish BBQ and grilled dishes, I was curious to see if this place could bring back those rich, smoky memoriesâ€”and it did not disappoint! We tried the Sarma & Chicken Beyti Kebab (T-11). This dish was a treatâ€”soft flatbread wrapped around juicy grilled chicken and sarma, perfectly seasoned with aromatic spices. Served with rice, fries, grilled tomato, and a blend of tangy yogurt and rich tomato sauce, every bite was packed with flavor. It struck a great balance between tender meat, warm bread, and bold spices. We also had their Lemon Mint drink, which was super refreshing and complemented the heaviness of the meal beautifully. The ambiance was cozy, service was prompt, and the presentation was top-notch. For a restaurant this new, Pavo is off to a great start. If you're in the area and have a craving for authentic Turkish grill, this place is worth a visit. Hoping it thrives in the competitive marketâ€”it certainly has the potential!

business_address: Plot 77, level, 5 Road 3-4, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Good restaurant for turkish, mexican, snanish food under the same roof. Food is delicious

business_address: Plot 77, level, 5 Road 3-4, Dhaka, Bangladesh
review_text: Pave , a new restaurant in Bashundhara R/A, has a pleasant interior that feels cozy and welcoming. Itâ€™s clearly designed with families in mind but also includes a smoking zone, which makes it a suitable spot for younger customers. I visited during the day, and while the natural light complemented the warm interior, my overall experience was far from satisfying because the food fell short in many ways. Cream of Mushroom Soup I started with the Cream of Mushroom soup, and it was just okay. The flavor was decent, and the soup had a good amount of mushrooms, but the texture wasnâ€™t right. It was a bit too watery, lacking the creamy richness you expect from this dish. While it wasnâ€™t bad, it wasnâ€™t something Iâ€™d recommend or order again. Rating: 7.5/10 BBQ Chicken Next, I tried the BBQ Chicken, which turned out to be a major disappointment. The sauce didnâ€™t taste like BBQ at allâ€”it was bland and unbalanced. Even worse, the chicken had a strange, unpleasant flavor that made it hard to eat. It didnâ€™t seem fresh, which was a real letdown. This dish didnâ€™t live up to any expectations. Rating: 3/10 The Platter The platter was, unfortunately, the biggest failure of the visit. The rice was the only part that was somewhat decent, but even that was just average. They tried to make the dish unique by including a special kind of salad, but the idea backfired because it tasted bad. As for the chicken, it had the same problems as the BBQ Chickenâ€”it didnâ€™t taste fresh, it was bitter, and the sauce didnâ€™t go with it at all. The entire dish felt poorly thought out and badly executed. Rating: 1/10 (only because of the rice) Presentation and Service The food presentation didnâ€™t help either. It looked plain and unappealing, which matched the poor taste of the dishes. On the bright side, the customer service was quite good. The server was polite and attentive, asking for feedback at the end of the meal. When I shared my honest thoughts, they kindly offered to replace the food. However, I didnâ€™t accept because I was short on time and felt that replacing the food wouldnâ€™t solve the underlying issues. While Pave has a good ambiance, especially during the daytime, and friendly service, the food is the heart of any restaurant, and this is where it really struggles. From the lack of freshness to poorly executed dishes, it was a disappointing experience overall. For now, I wouldnâ€™t recommend visiting unless they make some major improvements to their menu and food quality.

business_address: House 60D, 131 Road, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I went to this restaurant for lunch on Thursday. A friend had recommended it, so I was really excited. I made a reservation just in case, but I think reservations aren't necessary at lunchtime. However, instead of dining on the upper floor, which is reserved for reservations, I was shown to the ground floor. I ordered three dishes: soup, an appetizer, and a main dish . The wait time for each dish was short, which was great. My top recommendation is the soup. It was onion soup and delicious. I'll order it every time I visit this restaurant. After finishing my meal, I also ordered cake and coffee. I ordered cheesecake, which was the best cheesecake I've ever had in the country. It was such a delicious restaurant, I'd definitely like to return. Since this is a great restaurant, they asked me if I had a reservation, so please seat me properly next time.

business_address: House 60D, 131 Road, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: C'Paris provides an authentic, luxury French dining experience. The atmosphere captures a sophisticated 1900s Parisian vibe, supported by exceptionally professional staff and service. â€‹The cuisine is curated by Michelin-style chefs, delivering authentic French classics. â€‹Reflecting its high standards and use of imported ingredients, the pricing is definitely high. Reservation is absolutely essential for Dinner. â€‹C'Paris shares a distinct, refined aesthetic with L'Dor, making them kindred spirits in bringing a genuine taste of Paris to the city. It is the definitive choice for sophisticated, authentic French cuisine.

I wud have preffered a baked fish, it would have paired better with the smoked paprika sauce. The grouper tasted okay and it was well plated. It was defintely our better choice out of the two mains. business_address: 32/1, Block-D, Sher Shah Shuri, Tajmahal Road, Mohammadpur, Dhaka-1207 Just behind Dhaka Residential Model School & College Dhaka, 1207, Bangladesh
review_text: Last weekend, I visited a charming little restaurant tucked away on Tajmahal Road in Mohammadpur called **Garden Ship**. Itâ€™s one of those classic, old-school Thai-Chinese family restaurants that you donâ€™t come across often these days. The kind of place that quietly carries on with its legacy while the rest of the city moves on to trendy cafÃ©s and fast food joints. When we first entered, the restaurant was quiet and had a slightly gloomy ambiance. It wasnâ€™t particularly busy, and for a moment, it felt like we had stepped into a forgotten corner of the neighborhood. But that quickly changed. As soon as we walked in, both the manager and the waiter greeted us with warm smiles and a genuinely welcoming attitude. Their enthusiasm at having guests made us feel instantly comfortable. We were shown to our seats, and within moments, the manager came over to recommend a few dishes. He seemed proud of the menu, which was a mix of Thai and Chinese classics. We appreciated his suggestions and ended up ordering the **Seafood Mix**, **Wonton Soup**, **Chowmein**, and a few refreshing drinks. When the food arrived, we were pleasantly surprised by the generous portions. The **Seafood Mix** was especially impressiveâ€”loaded with prawns, crabs, calamari, and cooked to perfection with bold flavors that didnâ€™t overpower the natural taste of the seafood. The **Wonton Soup** was comforting, with soft, flavorful dumplings swimming in a rich broth, and the **Chowmein** had just the right amount of seasoning, veggies, and meat to balance it all out. Everything tasted delicious. It reminded us of the kind of food we used to enjoy in restaurants growing upâ€”hearty, flavorful, and served with care. Garden Ship may not have the flashy decor or Instagrammable lighting that newer places boast, but it has something far more valuable: heart. It's a **hidden gem** in the heart of Mohammadpur, and it's a little sad to think that places like this are slowly fading away from the cityâ€™s dining scene. If you're someone who enjoys classic comfort food and appreciates warm hospitality, Garden Ship is absolutely worth a visit. Support your local family-run restaurantsâ€”they often hold the most authentic flavors and the warmest memories.

business_address: Plot #27 Road No. 17, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently visited Hotel Sarina in Dhaka for a friendâ€™s family event and had a wonderful experience. The hotel offers several restaurants and banquet facilities, making it a versatile choice for dining as well as gatherings. The banquet hall was spacious, well arranged, and perfect for hosting family events with comfort. The staff were attentive and supportive throughout, ensuring everything went smoothly. The food at the event was excellent, flavorful, authentic, and beautifully presented, adding to the overall enjoyment of the event. The combination of quality service, delicious cuisine, and a well maintained venue made the experience very positive. Hotel Sarina is definitely a great choice for both dining and special occasions in Dhaka.

business_address: Plot #27 Road No. 17, Dhaka 1213, Bangladesh
review_text: I recently stayed at Hotel Sarina Dhaka and had a truly pleasant experience. The hotel is located in a convenient area, close to major shopping centers, restaurants, and the airport, which makes it perfect for both business and leisure travelers. The room I stayed in was spacious, clean, and very comfortable, providing a relaxing environment after a long day. The room service was excellent, always prompt and professional, and the housekeeping staff maintained the room very well throughout my stay. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, always greeting guests with a smile and doing their best to ensure comfort and satisfaction. I was especially impressed by their polite attitude and quick response whenever I needed assistance. The banquet buffet and breakfast were another highlight of my stay. There was a wide variety of dishes â€” both local and international â€” and everything was fresh and tasty. The dining area was neat, well organized, and offered a comfortable atmosphere to enjoy meals. Overall, Hotel Sarina Dhaka provides great value for money with its excellent service, spacious rooms, and quality food. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and memorable stay in Dhaka.

review_text: Extremely Disappointed I rarely leave reviews, but I felt compelled to write this one based on how disappointing my recent experience was. I ordered the chicken pasta oven-baked, and unfortunately, it failed on every level â€” starting with false advertising. Hereâ€™s a breakdown of the issues: ğŸ” No Chicken (Yes, Really) Despite the name of the dish being chicken pasta, there was literally no chicken in the entire serving. Not even a single shred. I even double-checked to make sure it wasnâ€™t hidden beneath the pasta â€” but it simply wasnâ€™t there. For a dish marketed as â€œchicken pasta,â€ this is completely unacceptable. ğŸ§€ Cheese? Barely There. I expected a rich, cheesy pasta â€” but it was almost completely dry. There was barely any cheese, and the little that was present didnâ€™t even taste fresh or melted. It lacked both flavor and texture. ğŸ”¥ Not Oven-Baked The description clearly said â€œoven-baked,â€ but the dish felt like it was hastily microwaved or reheated. It had none of the crispy, golden-baked finish that oven-baked pasta is known for. The top wasnâ€™t browned, the cheese wasnâ€™t bubbling, and there were cold spots throughout â€” another indicator that this wasnâ€™t baked at all. This dish felt like a careless afterthought. It was misleading, bland, and not what I paid for. If I wanted plain, dry pasta with no protein or cheese, I would have stayed home and made it myself.

business_address: Plot-1, Road-12, Block-C, Dynasty Tower, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh
review_text: KFC Mirpur 6 is a fantastic dining experience. The food is consistently delicious, with their signature fried chicken being the highlight. It's always crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, just the way it should be. The variety of meal options and combos make it easy to find something for everyone, from spicy wings to classic buckets. The staff is friendly and accommodating, ensuring a pleasant visit. The service is prompt, and they go the extra mile to ensure you have everything you need. Whether you dine in or take out, you can count on the same level of quality. The ambiance of the restaurant is inviting and well-maintained. It's a great place for a quick meal with friends or a family gathering. The cleanliness and hygiene standards are excellent, which is especially important these days. In terms of value for money, KFC Mirpur 6 is reasonably priced for the quality you receive. The portion sizes are generous, and the taste is worth every penny. Plus, they often have special promotions and deals that make it even more affordable. Overall, KFC Mirpur 6 is a top-notch choice for a quick, satisfying, and consistently tasty meal. Whether you're a long-time fan of KFC or trying it for the first time, you won't be disappointed. It's a go-to spot for anyone craving quality fast food.

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Saltz Fine Seafood, located in Gulshan-2, Dhaka, is a well-known restaurant offering a fine dining experience focused on fresh and authentic seafood dishes. Established in 2000, it has gained a reputation as a pioneer in the cityâ€™s seafood dining scene. The restaurant boasts a cozy, nautical-themed ambiance with decor inspired by the sea, including fish motifs, ship instruments, and miniature boats. It creates a relaxing environment perfect for both casual meals and special occasions. Saltz offers a diverse menu combining Continental and Asian flavors, featuring signature dishes like the seafood platter, kingâ€™s crab, and a variety of soups, appetizers, and main courses. The surf-and-turf options are a standout, ensuring thereâ€™s something for everyone. However, some customers have mentioned occasional concerns about the freshness of certain items, so checking current reviews might be helpful. The rooftop dining area adds to the charm, providing a unique setting for guests to enjoy their meals. Operating daily from 11:30 AM to 10:30 PM, Saltz caters to both lunch and dinner plans, and it also hosts private parties. Saltz is a must-visit for seafood lovers, offering a unique experience in Dhaka. However, itâ€™s worth comparing recent feedback before visiting.

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Frist time visiting Saltz, had high expectations but was sadly disappointed. The overall place and seating was really odd, the main dining area was a bit tight and the tables are really close together, another section was far off in the corner and another section of seating in a little hallway area, lighting was extremely bright. One good spot was the seating area in the balcony but probably only good in the day time as at night there are too many mosquitoes. Anyways on to the food: we had the following: Seafood Soup: Soup was quite tasty, nice flavors all around. Seafood Appetizer: The batter of this dish was too thick. So you barely tasted what was inside and it was like eating a donut. Also there was not alot of fish and more vegetables in this dish. Seafood Lasagna: Horrible dish, chewy and rubbery. We couldnâ€™t even eat it. Curry Hurry Fish: Really good, the fish was fresh, the sauce on this dish was really flavorful. A very deshi style dish with a modern twist. My only complain is that the quantity of rice is too little, there should be more rice considering the size of the fish. Fish cake: Fish cake tasted fresh but nothing special, sauce with the fish cake was way too sweet! Surf and Turf: Really bland piece of steak with two tiny shirmp, there was no surf in this surf and turf. I was shocked that a fish restaurant didnâ€™t have a â€œFish and Chipsâ€ on the menu, really odd. Service: Very poor service, our waiter barely understood a word of english. In this area and in a high end restaurant, the waiters should speak and understand basic english. Even when speaking Bangla, waiter didnâ€™t seem to knowledgeable about their dish. When I asked what is the fish used in the â€œcurry hurry fish dishâ€, his answer was â€œocean fishâ€ ğŸ˜. Also the overall demeanor and care was not there. Never came to check once how the food was or if we needed anything, we constantly had to call and ask for basic things like sauce and water. Also one thing I found extremely uncomfortable was when we were eating, the entire staff of about 6/7 people all standing in the main dining area. It was just weird and an uneasy feeling. Overall, an extremely disappointing experience from a restaurant I had high expectations for.

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Great place for sea food lovers. Location, service, food all is good but the price is super expensive. Don't go if you are not into sea food as the whole menu is based on sea food and I barely found 2-4items with meat. Tried the chicken steak meal with seafood salsa. Quantity is good and taste was awesome. Like I tell you don't go if you are not into sea food and this is very expensive restaurant.

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Nice Restaurant with great ambience. Pass awesome time with your dearest one. Hoping all of you will love the restaurant. Excellent service with best quality of food.

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: > Had a great dining experience at Saltz Restaurant! The food was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully served. The ambiance was relaxing and the staff were very friendly. Definitely recommending this place to others. â­â­â­â­â­

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: They served me fried calamaries with hair on it. Didnt even bother to say sorry. Got a discount from service charge. But it really doesnt matter. We pay premium price for good and hygine food. Never going there again.

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Good place for seafood and a nice scerene environment. The restaurant is in 2nd floor of the villa type building with big area. The place is quite old and a bit worn out. Air-conditioning inside and outside Terrace is open (smoking allowed there). Food is of great taste, a bit expensive though. Have big parking area to accommodate enough cars. Staffs are average, not extra cordical. Usually gives 10% discount in cards.

business_address: House 23 Rd 99, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I was there just to have a quick dinner, Well decorated interior but food was bit salty. I ordered fresh orange juice, fried calamari, a prawn fry covered with beef salami & Americano. Fresh juice & Americano was good but the sauce of fried calamari is bit salty. Also that prawn dish was bit more oily & salty so couldnâ€™t finish the food.

business_address: Hamid Tower, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary dinner at Ole, a Spanish restaurant. The beautiful ambiance and cozy interior created a wonderful atmosphere. The staff were incredibly helpful, consistently looking after us throughout the evening. We started with the Grilled Calamari for our appetizer, which was fantastic. The spices and sauce were perfectly balanced, making it a delightful dish. I would rate it 10/10. Next, we enjoyed the Fettuccine Alfredo Pasta. The creamy pasta was delicious, and we savored every bite, giving it a rating of 8/10. For the main course, we chose the Chicken Florentine, a chicken breast filled with spinach and cream butter. It was amazingly delicious, earning a solid 10/10. The highlight of the meal was the De Marisco Seafood Paella, a mixture of shrimp, cuttlefish, crab, and squid. This dish was exceptional, with perfect spicing that transported us to a heavenly taste experience. We both agreed on a well-deserved 10/10. Overall, our anniversary dinner at Ole was a fantastic experience. We highly recommend it to others seeking a memorable dining experience. It was truly a night to remember.

business_address: Hamid Tower, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: I am again lucky to experience the love blended food at Ole by TR. Here again the owner is a celebrity chef. The journey will take anyone to another level when the service is so hospitable. I just loved European cuisine.

business_address: Hamid Tower, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: One of the finest dining experience you will get from olÃ©. The ambience is amazing, perfect for a nice dinner or date. All the staffs are really polite and welcoming. Decor was elegant.. Now comes to food- Seafood paella- it contains shrimp,cattle fish,crab and squid, its was mildy spicy, if its your 1st time having paella, then you might be disappointed by the thing that it tastes kind of like khichuri.but this is what it is. It was good though Fettuccine alfredo pasta- one of the best alfredo pasta I have tasted in Dhaka. Creamy alfredo sauce was just on point.there was good amount of mushroom and chicken..it was just too good. Gambas al ajillo- shrimp was delecious. Served with toasted bread,it was good too. Tiramisu- thats a good portion of tiramisu.tasted good too.

business_address: Hamid Tower, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: My recent visit to OlÃ© was wonderful. This is a newly opened restaurant featuring Spanish inspired dishes. Iâ€™ve tried- âšœï¸Braised smoky short ribs pinchos [price: 700+] Smoky shredded ribs served on toasted bread topped with fresh tomato and olive. âšœï¸Grilled Calamari [price: 880+]. Beautifully cooked calamari with a tangy creamy sauce âšœï¸Gambas sevillanas seafood [price: 900+]. Juicy prawns cooked in a spicy sauce served with toasted bread âšœï¸Seafood Paella [price: 1230+]. Full of calamari and prawn. Also had crabs. Very subtle flavours with stunning seafood collection. Very fulfilling. I wish they also included Mussels. âšœï¸Ribeye steak Served with the most delicious mash potato and side of veggies and sauce. Doneness was correct and had a prompt rosemary flavour which I love. âšœï¸French toast [price: 680+] Fluffy pancakes with whipped cream and maple syrup. It was okay for me. Iâ€™ve had better. âšœï¸Mint Mojito and blue ocean Overall my experience was amazing. I really enjoyed their food and the ambiance- decor is beautiful. Very classy and modern.

business_address: Hamid Tower, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: A true fine dining place with clean but opulent aesthetics. Professional and courteous staff. Ordered the grilled calamari and the dish was divine. The sirloin steak was good as any you find in a good steakhouse. The seafood paella was good but I have had better elsewhere. For the price, a bit more seafood could have been included. The Tirimisu was very creamy with the biscuits drenched in coffee. Classic and delicious dessert. Of course pricey as I mentioned in the beginning a true fine dining restaurant.

business_address: Hamid Tower, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: The place has a nice ambiance. They serve spanish cuisine. We were a party of 7, so they allocated the private seating area for us, which was nice and I liked the fact that there was a private seating area with closed door option, which could seat a total of 10 people. The service was fast, although it should be mentioned that we were pretty much the only people there. The food was decent. Portion size was okay. They had a good variety of options to choose from. Would recommend giving this place a try if you're looking to try spanish inspired dishes.

business_address: Hamid Tower, Dhaka 1212, Bangladesh
review_text: Ole by TR is a stunning place with a gorgeous and upscale ambiance. The interior is well-designed, giving off a classy and posh vibe, making it perfect for a fine dining experience. The food is delicious, though the prices are on the higher side.
